story:
SUV2RV Tent - Turn Your SUV Into an RV

Have you ever wanted to enjoy camping with an RV but didn't want to tow one, drive one, rent one, or BUY one? I know I did. So that's why I've spent nearly the last 2 years developing the SUV2RV Instatent.

The Granville SUV2RV Instatent transforms your SUV, Crossover, or minivan into a luxurious camping abode that lets you enjoy all the benefits of a tent while enjoying the comforts of your vehicle.  Run power from your car to your tent easily, access items stored in your vehicle conveniently, and most of all, the living space in the tent expands into the comfort of your SUV.

The SUV2RV will fit ANY hatchback vehicle. That means it fits all SUVs like Kia Sorentos and  Ford Explorers, it fits all crossovers like Honda CRVs and Subaru Foresters and it fits all minivans like Dodge Caravans or Honda Odysseys. If it has a hatch back, the SUV2RV fits!

Exclusive Instatent™ Technology - Sets up in Seconds

 

 

With our exclusive Integrated Instatent technology, your tent sets up in seconds (literally).

Installation is three easy steps:

  1. Lay the tent flat and raise the tent by simply extending the 4 pre-assembled poles.
  2. Pull the water-proof seal from the tent over your vehicle hatchback.
  3. Tighten the straps from the top of the tent over your roof or your vehicle (to either roof bars or your hood) and behind your wheel wheels.
 

The entire tent comes pre-assembled in one piece. That means no finding out which poles go where. No assembling poles and no deciphering instructions. This is all thanks to the integrated fully-automatic cam located at the top of the tent.

Once the tent is extended, all you do is slip the connection point over the hatchback of your vehicle and you're all set up!

Easy Teardown and Storage

Each Granville SUV2RV comes with a convenient storage bag and fits easily in the hatchback of your vehicle.

 

And thanks to the Instatent Technology,  tear down is just as quick as setting up the tent.

 

The Next Best Thing to Class A Motorhome

The SUV2RV forms a waterproof seal between the the tent and your vehicle, allowing you to turn your hatchback vehicle into the next best thing after a Class A landyacht. The kids can relax in the cargo area of the vehicle while you relax with a drink in the coziness of the tent. When it's time for bed, the SUV2RV tent sleeps up to 5 adults plus 2 in the cargo area.

Camping in the SUV2RV is far more enjoyable than camping in a traditional tent for countless reasons including:

  • No more running back and forth between your vehicle to fetch gear
  • True two bedroom living space
  • Easily run power from your vehicle to your tent
  • Full standup height for easy entering of the tent and getting changed
  • Quick protection when needed from the elements and critters in your vehicle

Two Separated Living Spaces For Up to 6 People

The SUV2RV provides a true two separate living space. While your kids are playing in the vehicle you'll hardly know they're there while you and your partner cozy up in the tent yet you'll know they're safe.

 

Universal Fit Onto Any SUV, Jeep, Crossover, or Minivan

The SUV2RV will install on ANY vehicle with a hatchback. From the tiniest crossovers like Honda CRVs to large SUVs like Ford Explorers, the SUV2RV is universal fit for any hatchback.

 

Bonus Entry-Way Awning

 

No one wants to bring their muddy shoes into their living space, and with the bonus canopy included with each SUV2RV Tent, you'll have a covered awning before entering your luxurious tent. 

Works Without a Vehicle

One of the great things about the SUV2RV is that it works with any hatchback vehicle but it also works as a standalone tent without a vehicle. 

This means the SUV2RV is great for:

  • Camping
  • Sporting events
  • Birthdays
  • Picnics
  • Outdoor events
  • Business events
  • And more...

 

All Season Tent

Built from top of the line rip-stop polyester the SUV2RV is all-season ready for whatever bad weather you can throw at it.

 

Ships to You by May 31, 2021 or Sooner

We are currently in pre-production and we guarantee that your SUV2RV Tent will ship to you by May 31, 2021 or sooner. We know you can't wait to use your SUV2RV tent in time for summer, so we guarantee that we'll ship your tent before the end of May. Allow 2-10 business days for shipping time.

Sorry - U.S. shipping only for now.

 

The Development & Team 

I've spent nearly 2 years developing the SUV2RV. I'm an avid camper and like most people, I've been on trips where I ended up spending more time in my vehicle than the tent either because of weather or simply because of convenience. Eventually it dawned on me to simply make a tent that could attach easily to the vehicle, allowing me to enjoy the best of both worlds.

Our team started development in 2019. Our goal was to make not only a practical vehicle tent but also one that assembled super easily.

After receiving our first prototypes of of the SUV2RV tent it was just too hard to install onto a vehicle. There's nothing I hate more than trying to figure out how to setup a tent at the campsite! So we went back to the drawing board to figure out how to develop a tent that can be setup quicker than it takes to burn a marshmallow over a campfire. The result was exclusive instant pop-up technology that lets the entire SUV2RV tent be setup in 2 minutes or less.

Our team is based in British Columbia - one of the rainiest places on Earth. Subsequently, we've built a tent that can withstand any weather you throw at it - from beating sun to pouring rain.

As a company, our flagship brand is Offroading Gear which is dedicated to helping people use their vehicles to enjoy the great outdoors. We hope you're able to get out and explore as well!

Risks and Challenges

We are in pre-production with a manufacturer we have worked with extensively over the last several years. We have launched several products and your tent will ship to you before the end of May (and arrive to you no later than June 15, 2021), well before the start of the summer camping season! Our team is here to serve you. Shoot us an email any time to questions@offroadinggear.com

story:
WHO WE ARE 

Longtime friends and bicycle aficionados, Alex and Konstantinos, set out in 2020 to tackle the number one safety-concern of cyclists on the streets once and for all: make car drivers aware of you and your intentions on the street.
 
From off-road biking in the Swiss Alps to the daily commute through Zurich City, the importance of proper safety equipment always stood out to us. This knowledge helped us in producing the next generation bicycle helmet.
 
We co-founded Litgard GmbH to bring you a helmet which offers you excellent protection but also remains affordable, without compromising comfort. A helmet that is not just smart, but also discreet and elegant. And we believe that we made it.
 
Say hello to LITGARD, where safety meets comfort and style.

 

THE LITGARD SMART HELMET

 

ULTRA LIGHT

At 290 grams (10.2 ounces) LITGARD is one of the
lightest helmets on
the market. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

ADJUSTABLE SIZE

The rear fitting system
allows you to adjust the
size of your helmet for
tailor made comfort
and maximum stability
and safety.

 

 

 

 

WATERPROOF WIRELESS REMOTE

Control your smart
helmet with the
fully water-resistant
remote control. 

 

 

 

 

 

TURN SIGNAL AND
BRAKE LIGHTS

Control the signaling functionality and brake
lights with the wireless
remote control to
clearly signal your
intentions on
the street. 

 

 

 

WARN BEFORE A
HARD STOP

Warn those behind you
using the brake light indicator.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

USB RECHARGEABLE BATTERY 

Running on a long lasting
USB rechargeable battery,
you can take your LITGARD with you for
days and recharge
anywhere. 

 

 

 

 

INTEGRATED LED LIGHTS 

Integrated LED lights
offer 360° visibility day
and night. Switch on
power saving mode
to maximize the
battery-life. 

 

 

 

FEATURE SUMMARY

 

 

DESIGNED FOR SAFETY
MADE FOR LIFE 

When we first envisioned and sketched out the LITGARD helmet, our primary objective was to bring safety in both your day and night-time biking.

Our first sample focused on integrating the lights in a way that will ensure that you are visible on the street from all angles. In doing so, we quickly stumbled upon the problem of other smart helmets: how to not compromise in terms of looks and comfort.

After multiple iterations of scrutinising and testing samples, we stopped only when we were certain that the design and comfort mix was absolutely perfect.

LITGARD is aerodynamically designed to ensure a cool airflow. Multiple vents, with inner air channels draw the cool air towards the helmet and over the brow, allowing it to pass-through quickly and leave behind you with ease as it warms up.

LITGARD’s ergonomic design allows it to rest comfortably on your head, thanks to its ultralight weight. The rear fitting-system and straps with quick-release functionality offer stability, allowing your head to be lightly and safely embraced.

On-off and remote control buttons were designed so that you can locate them with a simple, intuitive move of your hand.

Elegant and uncomplicated, the LITGARD helmet was designed with you in mind.

 

PRODUCTION

We work in collaboration with manufacturers with a long experience and know-how in the production of bicycle helmets. Here a sneak peek from inside the facilities.

 

 

The first batch of LITGARD helmets is already in production. We will be updating you on the progress throughout the campaign. Stay tuned!

 

MODES

LITGARD comes with 3 embedded modes to best serve your biking needs under changing circumstances on the road. 

  • Mode 1: Just as a simple tail-light, hopefully however, not as frequently stolen or forgotten at home. Best suited for conditions with high visibility. Offers the lowest battery consumption among modes (run time: 14.5hrs).

 

  • Mode 2: White light at 70% allows you to be visible at night from all angles but in a discreet manner and with an economic battery consumption profile (run time: 7.0hrs). 

 

  • Mode 3: White light at 100% brightness not only makes you visible from all angles but also illuminates the area around you. Ideal in conditions with very low visibility. Highest battery consumption (run time: 4.0hrs).

 

 

Note that the turn and brake-warning signal buttons work in all three modes. Once signalling has stopped, the helmet will return to the mode you had selected.


SWITCHING BETWEEN MODES - ON/OFF 

To switch between
modes, just short-press
the button, located at
the rear of the helmet.

To turn LITGARD on or
off, simply press and
hold the rear button
for 0.5 seconds.

 

The button is ergonomically designed, so that you can locate it with a simple, intuitive move of your hand.

For your safety however, we recommend to always take a brief stop at the side of the road, when changing between modes.

 

SELECTING THE RIGHT SIZE

The LITGARD Smart Helmet is available in two sizes; S/M and M/L and they are both equipped with a fitting system to ensure optimal fit and comfort. 

The size only depends on the circumference of your head:  

 

  • S/M for head circumference of 54 - 58 cm (21.2 - 22.8 in).

 

  • M/L for head circumference of 58 - 62 cm (22.8 - 24.4 in). 

 

You can measure the circumference of your head by placing a tape measure about 1cm / 0.39in above your eyebrows.

If you measured your head's circumference at exactly 58cm/22.8in, we suggest that you order the M/L size to be certain that the helmet fits you.​

 

SPECIFICATIONS

We don't want to tire you with endless scrolling going over technical details. That's why we gathered all the specs here. 

 

WHATS IN THE BOX?

The LITGARD helmet comes with a USB charging cable, the LITGARD wireless remote control, a remote control mounting strap and a user manual. 

 

TIMELINE

 

AS SEEN ON

 

                    

 

 

 

FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA

 

      

                          
 

                              
                       

      

 

HELP US SPREAD THE WORD

 

There are many ways to contribute to our project. If you don't feel ready to pre-order the LITGARD helmet just yet, we would appreciate if you help us get the word out and create some buzz around our campaign. If you like our project, please use the Indiegogo share tools to share it with your network. Many thanks!

story:
I decided to live my dream and combine my two passions: travel and photography.  I found bicycling to be a great tool for transportation and an exciting way to explore the world.

Two years ago I left everything that was familiar and started traveling, beginning with a six months journey of my home country, Israel, followed by seven months of backpacking through India and Nepal.  For the past two months I have been cycling the U.S. starting from New York City and have reached the northern part of Florida via the Appalachian Mountains.  I will travel the southern U.S. until I reach the West Coast and then head north to Alaska.  My goal is to arrive as close as possible to the base camp of Mount Denali.  My needs are very basic and I enjoy this pace and way of life. This journey to be the begining of more bicycle tours around the world.

On my blog I will publish images and stories from my journey.  You are more than welcome to follow: OrenOnTheRoad.com

This is a link to my Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/nahshon_oren/

I welcome you to take part in my journey. I am offering fine art prints of images i took during my travels as as perks  at discount prices: http://www.orennahshon.com/gallery/Fine-Art-Pri...

* Please note that the prices on my site are the regular prices and the perks here offered at discount prices only for this campaign, so hurry up purchase one before the campaign ends.

15% of total funds raised will go to:  http://www.worldbicyclerelief.org/  Beacause bicycles can get you far.



 *update for January 4th - i reached New Orleans.


I estimate I have six to seven more months to reach Alaska.

I am letting my hunches determine the route and my legs determine the pace.

story:
Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park will provide mountain bikers with a premier location in Southern Illinois to enjoy our beautiful landscape. All-terrain, Action TrackChairs will enable wheelchair users to experience the trails through the Shawnee Bluffs.

Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour, a world class zipline adventure, stretches above 83 beautiful acres in Southern Illinois.  Owner, Marc Miles, commissioned the International Mountain Bike Association (IMBA) to design a professional and purpose-built mountain bike park on this pristine property!  Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park will crisscross below the course of Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour.


Impacting Southern Illinois 

Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park Trail Map

Building Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park!

We want to build an experience that people from Southern Illinois, the Midwest, and all over the world can enjoy and use to build memories!  After receiving quotes from IMBA and Progressive Trail Design, we have laid the project out in 3 phases.


Who Rides at Shawnee Bluffs?


Our Contributor Perks!


Testimonials

FAQ

Q. When will the Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park be built?

With $95,000, we will begin Phase 1, which we plan to have completed by August! If the full amount is raised, Phases 2 and 3 will be completed by next spring.

Q. I see all this support for veterans, can you give more detail?

Of course!  Our vision is to offer All-Terrain Action Track Chair tours at no charge to veterans and first responders who use wheelchairs.  We also will offer a discount to all military personnel.

Q. I see that there is an option to be on a contributor board or a Veteran Memorial Wall, how do I choose?

After the campaign is completed, we will email you to choose which one you would prefer, along with the additional information we need for the board!


Marc Miles, owner of Shawnee Bluffs Canopy tour, was born in Kansas and raised on a horse and cattle ranch there. After high school graduation, he attended Kansas State University, where he received his D.V.M. degree in 1978, and entered the practice of equine veterinary medicine, working in St. Louis, Missouri, and Riverside, California, before coming to Southern Illinois in 1993. He has been the owner and sole practitioner of Southern Illinois Equine Clinic in Energy, Illinois, since that time.

Marc Miles opened Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour almost 2 years ago as Illinois’ first entirely tree-based, eco-friendly zipline canopy tour, located on 83 wooded acres surrounded by the Shawnee National Forest.  Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour consists of 8 ziplines, the longest stretching 1,016 feet, which zig-zag across the property’s bluffs and through the valley.


When Saluki Collegiate Entrepreneur Organization (CEO), within the College of Business at Southern Illinois University, was given the opportunity to manage, produce, and promote a crowdfunding campaign for Marc Miles, we couldn't say no. As students and entrepreneurs, we are always seeking to gain insight into potential educational learning opportunities that will enhance our future ventures.  Our team has been given the opportunity to learn valuable marketing principles, video development, and content creation.  We can't wait to see you out on the trails!


GoPro is a registered trademark of GoPro, Inc and is not affiliated with  Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour or Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park
story_txt:
Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park will provide mountain bikers with a premier location in Southern Illinois to enjoy our beautiful landscape. All-terrain, Action TrackChairs will enable wheelchair users to experience the trails through the Shawnee Bluffs.


Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour, a world class zipline adventure, stretches above 83 beautiful acres in Southern Illinois.  Owner, Marc Miles, commissioned the International Mountain Bike Association (IMBA) to design a professional and purpose-built mountain bike park on this pristine property!  Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park will crisscross below the course of Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour.





Impacting Southern Illinois 

Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park Trail Map


Building Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park!
We want to build an experience that people from Southern Illinois, the Midwest, and all over the world can enjoy and use to build memories!  After receiving quotes from IMBA and Progressive Trail Design, we have laid the project out in 3 phases.









Who Rides at Shawnee Bluffs?






Our Contributor Perks!




Testimonials


FAQ
Q. When will the Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park be built?
With $95,000, we will begin Phase 1, which we plan to have completed by August! If the full amount is raised, Phases 2 and 3 will be completed by next spring.
Q. I see all this support for veterans, can you give more detail?
Of course!  Our vision is to offer All-Terrain Action Track Chair tours at no charge to veterans and first responders who use wheelchairs.  We also will offer a discount to all military personnel.
Q. I see that there is an option to be on a contributor board or a Veteran Memorial Wall, how do I choose?
After the campaign is completed, we will email you to choose which one you would prefer, along with the additional information we need for the board!




Marc Miles, owner of Shawnee Bluffs Canopy tour, was born in Kansas and raised on a horse and cattle ranch there. After high school graduation, he attended Kansas State University, where he received his D.V.M. degree in 1978, and entered the practice of equine veterinary medicine, working in St. Louis, Missouri, and Riverside, California, before coming to Southern Illinois in 1993. He has been the owner and sole practitioner of Southern Illinois Equine Clinic in Energy, Illinois, since that time.
Marc Miles opened Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour almost 2 years ago as Illinois’ first entirely tree-based, eco-friendly zipline canopy tour, located on 83 wooded acres surrounded by the Shawnee National Forest.  Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour consists of 8 ziplines, the longest stretching 1,016 feet, which zig-zag across the property’s bluffs and through the valley.



When Saluki Collegiate Entrepreneur Organization (CEO), within the College of Business at Southern Illinois University, was given the opportunity to manage, produce, and promote a crowdfunding campaign for Marc Miles, we couldn't say no. As students and entrepreneurs, we are always seeking to gain insight into potential educational learning opportunities that will enhance our future ventures.  Our team has been given the opportunity to learn valuable marketing principles, video development, and content creation.  We can't wait to see you out on the trails!   

GoPro is a registered trademark of GoPro, Inc and is not affiliated with  Shawnee Bluffs Canopy Tour or Shawnee Bluffs Mountain Bike Park

story:
The Stojo Biggie is the world's only 16 oz. ultra-portable, collapsible and leak-proof cup designed for both hot and cold beverages

We launched our first project on Kickstarter in 2014, and with the help of crowdfunding developed the patented 12oz Stojo Pocket Cup. It’s the world’s only ultra-portable, collapsible, leak-proof coffee cup. We learned a lot about making collapsible coffee cups along the way, and received invaluable feedback from our early backers and customers. Two of the most common requests were: “I need a bigger cup!” and “What about a straw?”

Well we listened and now we’re back in a "Biggie" way! Same awesome design and functionality as the Stojo Pocket Cup, but with 33% more thirst-quenching capacity and a collapsible straw, so you can enjoy your coffee, tea or other beverages hot or on ice.

For now, all you have to do is pick the number of cups you want. At the end of the campaign, you will be given the opportunity to pick what color cups you want.

 

The design is complete, the prototypes work as expected, but the tooling is expensive. We need to raise $40k in order to build the tools that will mass produce the Stojo Biggie. By backing us today, you not only get first dibs on this year's coolest coffee gadget (and mad props at the local cafe), but you get the satisfaction of knowing that you (and we do mean YOU) actually helped bring a product to life that will prevent millions of disposable cups from polluting our environment.

As three coffee-loving dads with a passion for the environment, we hated to admit that our combined habit alone was responsible for over 1,000 of the 58 million disposable cups being added to landfills every year. Lugging around a bulky travel mug just didn't fit into our urban lifestyle and after searching the market we found nothing that solved our need for portability.

Fast forward two years and we have manufactured and sold almost 200,000 Stojo Pocket Cups to people all over the world, drastically reducing the amount of disposable coffee cups that get used and tossed into our landfills.



Want to give your company some serious eco street cred? A company can never have enough eco mojo! Buy the 16 oz Stojo Biggie or the 12 oz Stojo Pocket Cup. During the campaign (order must be placed by July 14th), Stojo is offering an extra 15% off our regular wholesale pricing on order of 96 cups or more. Whether your operation is small or large, we have packages to fit your needs.

Interested in the above? Get in touch with us at wholesale@stojo.co and we will create a perk specifically for you!

Jacob, our amazing summer intern, and Patrick, his best friend since kindergarten, agreed to help us beta test the Giving Back business model by introducing their own limited edition Stojo Biggie. We're dubbing it the "All American".

Also...blue is Patrick's favorite color and red is Jacob's. Plus, the cup looks like the Stojo Biggie Captain America would have designed if he was our summer intern instead of Jacob.

Patrick & Jacob's story

The boys started competing in long-distance races together in high school after being inspired by a father-son team who ran the Boston Marathon. Patrick lives with Cerebral Palsy and competing in these runs challenges both boys and gives them a fun way to bond.

They will be running a half-marathon on June 11. In honor of their undertaking, they thought it would be cool to raise some money for a good cause. Read more about Patrick and Jacob here.

Patrick Dewey, Jacob Russell & Dave Russell Rockin' Ugly Christmas Sweaters!

How will Stojo use my money?

$10 from the sale of each $25 cup will be donated to the Double H Ranch, a wonderful organization that provides specialized programs and year-round support for children and their families dealing with life-threatening illnesses. Patrick used to attend their programs as a boy and giving back would mean a lot to him.

If you have a cause that is close to your heart and want to consider creating a special edition Stojo Biggie to raise money, please reach out to us at help@stojo.co. We’ll work hard, make it fun, and help you raise money in a unique, environmentally friendly way!

Q: How do you stow the straw?

A: Our food grade silicone straw bends easily to fit within the Stojo Biggie once collapsed. Just fold the straw, place within the cup and fit the top on and your straw is stowed away.


Q: When the cup is collapsed where does the heat sleeve go?

A: Once collapsed the heat sleeve fits easily on the bottom of the cup.


Q: Can the Stojo Biggie go in the microwave?

A: Yes, the Stojo Biggie is dishwasher & microwave safe. The Stojo Biggie is best cleaned disassembled on the top rack of the dishwasher. The lid to the Stojo Biggie should be removed before placing the cup in the microwave to avoid steam buildup and potential scalding.


Q: What are the colors offered?

A: We offer the following colors: Blue, Green, Orange, Red, Pink, Black, Black Siliglass, White Siliglass. For now, all you have to do is pick the number of cups you want. At the end of the campaign, you will be given the opportunity to pick what color cups you want.

* For wholesale orders of 984 units or more, we offer custom colors. Please contact us through Indiegogo or at wholesale@stojo.co for any wholesale related questions.


Q: What are the product specs?

A: The Stojo Biggie holds 16 fluid ounces, weighs 6 ounces, is 5.5" tall when expanded and 2" tall when collapsed into a disk. It has a 4" diameter and fits comfortably in most hands and cup holders.


Q: How much force does it take to collapse the Stojo Biggie?

A: The following is a sticky analogy, but it takes about as much strength as it does to crush an egg on a table (if the egg is standing tall/vertically).


Q: Can I put a Stojo Biggie in a backpack, purse or other bag while it’s filled with liquid?

A: No. Don't put a full and expanded Stojo Biggie into your bag. The Stojo Biggie wasn't designed to be a bottle or flask. When we say the Stojo Biggie is "leak-proof", we mean that it's designed to be collapsed, sealed and stowed away without you having to stop and rinse it out. When it is empty, collapsed and properly sealed, residual coffee, tea or other beverage won't make a mess in your bag or pocket. 


Q: Are the materials BPA and phthalate free?

A: Yes.

story:
We're on the Edge...

Have you ever been to the Edge of the World? Travel in your mind down the western side of Costa Rica to the small surf town of Dominical where the rain forest covered mountains meet the Pacific Ocean. Now go inland 10 minutes and up about 600 feet and you'll reach Edge of the World Costa Rica, our family owned and operated eco-retreat. 

I'm Luke Barrow. My wife is Devon Brooks. We manage and maintain several cabins adjacent to our property and rent them to tourists. In the last couple of years we have upgraded our cabins and have completed some extensive additions to our house as well, expanding to accommodate groups in a retreat setting. This is going very well; we are providing a very different type of "all inclusive" where our guests are immersed in nature  and still have amenities like wi-fi and a pool. We're only 10 minutes from the beaches and within an hour of some of Costa Rica's most spectacular nature, yet less than 4 hours from airport and capital San Jose.

But wait, there's more...

We've made great strides. Our skills in construction, gardening, hospitality, art and 'jungle living' have transformed our property and have been shared with hundreds of guests from around the globe. But we're not done yet. It's time to use these skills in a very ambitious expansion project that will create three additional rental units and a spacious open pavilion to be used for yoga retreats or other group and family activities.

What's a Hobbit Hut?

Each of the structures we build will be similar in design, materials and construction method.  They are not exactly cabins, houses or huts. Imagine the hobbit houses of  "Lord of the Rings". Imagine the Ewok village in "Star Wars". Now blend the two together in a custom-designed "Hobbit Hut", built into the side of the mountain. The floors will be concrete with river stone walls on three sides (think of a root cellar, but not creepy and dark!). The front walls will be constructed with rustic posts and closed in with a half wall and screening to keep the space as open and airy as possible while protecting guests from the elements. The roof will be constructed of bamboo and thatch, allowing more air-flow and maintaining the tropical style. Each Hobbit Hut will have a small kitchen, 2 bathrooms and beds for four adults in a 350 (+/-) square foot footprint. 

The huts will be near one another, yet far enough apart to ensure privacy and tranquility.  Some key features of our "Hobbit Hut"--

  • Partially underground, yet designed for maximum natural air flow
  • "Jungle" in theme, using natural materials
  • Beautiful stone-work
  • Cool under the hot sun 
  • Environmentally friendly construction
  • Locally sourced materials & labor

The common pavilion is almost identical in construction method, only it will be a larger open space at about 450 square feet and adequate for a group of 15 or more in just about any configuration.

When this project is funded, the yoga pavilion will be the first of the structures to be constructed.Amy Pearce-Hayden, ERYT-500, is a collaborator on this project, working with us remotely from her yoga facilities in the U.S.  As she plans to use these new structures for her future retreats, we're doing our best to make everything perfect for her needs as well. The yoga pavilion will be completed by mid March, in advance of Amy's next retreat starting April 18th.

And then...

We anticipate approximately three months of construction time for each Hobbit Hut, completing the entire project over a year long span. Based on this schedule, the first completed Hut will be ready for guests by September of 2016. In the meantime and for the foreseeable future, we'll continue offering our existing rental cabins, raising our total occupancy to 28 persons among six rental units.

For so many of our guests Costa Rica is a 'bucket list' vacation destination, so expectations are really high. We don't just provide a place to sleep -- hotels along the beach can do that. It's bigger than that. We provide an experience, bringing families and groups closer to the awe inspiring nature, the abundant fresh food and the beauty and kindness this amazing country has to offer.  It's a place to put your stress aside, reconnect with nature and find your creative spark!

Here's where you come in...

Without an infusion of money this project would take us years to complete. We've poured everything we have into Edge of the World (and then some) and we're faced with this 'hump' in order to move us to the next level.  Increasing our capacity and being set up for groups and/or more individual travelers will help ensure our success down here.  

In rough increments, here's a breakdown of our expenditures based on certain 'bench-marks':

  • $25,000...We build the Pavilion
  • $50,000...Finish all infrastructure & site prep for the Hobbit Huts
  • $75,000...First Hobbit Hut completed
  • $100,000...Second Hobbit Hut completed
  • $125,000...Third Hobbit Hut completed

So we're asking you, our friends known and unknown, to become involved. If you applaud the risks we've taken to live out our dreams, then help us!  And when you come to visit us (which is the driving force behind our perks) you too will see the beauty of this place and know that you were instrumental in its realization. If it takes a while before you can make your way to Costa Rica, that's fine. We'll be holding a cabin or Hobbit Hut for you until you can get here. And you can say, "Yeah, I got a place in Costa Rica"!  Thank you so very much for considering this campaign.

story:
My name is Jesse Holt.

 I have spent a lifetime experiencing the wonders of camping. My co-founder Mahi has used his tech companies to fund his love of travel and adventure. 

  So what keeps people from camping?

 Well first off it takes a small fortune to buy all the stuff you need. And that doesn't even include an RV!

 Second, once you buy all the stuff it can be a HUGE project to prep everything set it all up, break it all down then store it all until the one trip next year. 

  What if now going camping was as easy as going to a hotel?

 You simply pull up to a spot that is set up and ready. Put your food and ice in the cooler and enjoy the trip of a lifetime with your family.

  Oh and also for those of you that already spent the fortune on all the gear, now you can turn it into a great income! You can make thousands just setting it up for others to enjoy. 

 We just need a little help from you!

We have decided to run a campaign based on percentages rather than dollars. The money raised from this campaign will determine how quick we can grow. 

 Mahi and I have both been able to use our previous companies, and a very lean model to get us to a point that we can launch in a small market. But we need your help to make this company what it can be. With enough help we can be in all 50 states by 2020. 

 Here is a breakdown on how we will use the funding for growth

Financial plan for Campezz July - September

 10% of every dollar will be placed into retained earnings. This will be an emergency fund. Once fund reaches six months of operating expenses we will use extra funds to buy assets in cash. 

 10% will be used for business growth. This will initially be used for corporation set up. Trademark fees, legal documents etc. Will also be used to open next market. Travel expenses permits etc. 

 Remaining 80% will be divided into two categories, marketing and tech development. 

 

Marketing-

 

Marketing will be broken down into 4 categories. 

Social Media

Photo and Video

Blogs and bloggers 

General expenses. 

 Social Media 37% of funds. This will cover Facebook adds 

Influencers

 Photo and Video 25% of funds. This will cover

Landscape photos

Camp site photos

Photos for host

Video adds

Video for social

 Blogs and bloggers 10% of funds. Will cover

Research for blog post. Having bloggers write about Campezz

 Expenses. 28% of funds. This will cover

Printed material, cards fliers etc and having them distributed. 

Food and entertainment expenses

Travel

 As much of this as possible will be performed by me to keep cost as lean as possible. 

 Tech development -

Over the next three months all tech money will be used on app development. 

One of our biggest risks is the ever present problem of someone bigger than us beating us to market. It has been a concern since we started creating this company. We were even a little nervous to go to Indigogo to be honest. 

 We do feel however that we have two major advantages in our market. Speed and experience. We are a small company and we control every part of it in house. From logistics to app design. Decisions and ideas happen very fast! Sometimes a little to fast and Mahi has to tell me to slow down! 

 What we do better than anyone though is experience. We know camping, we know travel, we know technology. There is no better team for a project like this. We live and love this life style. Spending all of our free time out in the Real World! Camping, boating, exploring and enjoying.

One of our biggest risks is the ever present problem of someone bigger than us beating us to market. It has been a concern since we started creating this company. We were even a little nervous to go to Indigogo to be honest. 
 We do feel however that we have two major advantages in our market. Speed and experience. We are a small company and we control every part of it in house. From logistics to app design. Decisions and ideas happen very fast! Sometimes a little to fast and Mahi has to tell me to slow down! 
 What we do better than anyone though is experience. We know camping, we know travel, we know technology. There is no better team for a project like this. We live and love this life style. Spending all of our free time out in the Real World! Camping, boating, exploring and enjoying.

story:
Why we choose to share our experience as photography lovers and travel lovers!

Taking the side of the objective means to have a few photos of themselves and the photographs that recall trips are definitely the ones we show proudly to our friends.

There is no better gift to give to yourself when you are on vacation.

Pix Around ltd offers this service to tourists, couples, families and friends who want to travel the world and capture a particular moment in their lives not with simple pictures but turning to professionals. Through our Company we managed to combine our passions, discovering the world and photography.

We personally chose each local photographer based on their style and the emotions transmitted from their photographs.

FRANCESCA & ALESSANDRO

How it works

Some trips deserve more than selfies. Occasions like honeymoons, anniversaries, family holidays, solo adventures and even surprise proposals are perfect moments to capture. Or simply because you believe that memories are the best souvenir and connecting with a local is part of the magic of travel.

  1. Select the city
  2. Choose your preferred vacation photographer
  3. Send us an inquiry
  4. Confirm the booking and details with our Pix booking staff
  5. Meet your friendly travel photographer
  6. Enjoy your shooting time
  7. Receive gallery in 5 business days
  8. Download, share and print your beautiful pictures.

What Pix Around Needs

WHY DO WE NEED THIS MONEY?

We are a family run start up and this means that we have invested all our savings in this project and we want to be successful.

To do so we need to increase the audience through advertising campaigns, social media campaigns, participation in trade fairs  and creating emotional videos about out photo shooting sessions. We also need to create a partenership with a SEO specialist for our web site and a copywriter for our Blog.

These are the estimated costs for the necessary activities :

  1. Advertising campaigns with famous travel magazines / travel blogs : € 30,000
  2. Social media campaigns (FB, Instragram, Twitter) : € 10,000
  3. Participation in traid fair (ILTM in Cannes 2017) :  € 25,000
  4. SEO specialist + Copy writer for the blog (for 12 months cooperation) : € 20,000
  5. Creation of emotional videos (proposal + honey moon + family) : € 20,000

Your Rewards:

With your contributions, Pix Around is putting together a variety of perks for you to enjoy

How you can help ?

After making a contribution and getting one of our awesome perks, you can help by inviting your friends, family and peers by sharing our campaign. 

Please back the project and tell everyone know to help spread the word!

We Hope You'll Join us in Making this Project Successful!

Team

story:
Helper  https://myhpr.net/en is a web platform for traveling developed to take into account the successful experience of international sharing services. We want to expand travel opportunities, give you new emotions and broaden your perception of journeys by communicating with interesting new people in a language you understand, to establish business contacts and, perhaps, to meet your soul mate.

What is Helper?

Helper is a world, where everyone can share their knowledge and experience about their city, meet with foreign visitors, spend time together and receive, in addition to positive emotions, a reward.

Why Helper?

Viator comes from the Latin word meaning Traveller. In old times Viators were accompanied by the locals while visiting new destinations. Nowadays not everyone can afford a concierge or a personal guide.

 The Helper network revives this old tradition. A companion (also called Helper) speaks your language, makes an interesting travel plan, advises on any issue, meets you and spends time with you.

 The process of interaction between the Helper network members doesn’t use the principle of costly fees, as in the case of travel agencies or market monopolies, which makes using the Helper network affordable to anyone.

The Helper network has been created to provide straightforward and convenient interaction between users and to maximize their value for time and money.

How it works ?

On the web-page www.myhpr.net you can search by destination, filter results by dates, language preferences and interests. After that you can start a conversation using instant messaging, discuss your expectations and things you are into. Helper will prepare a unique program of your journey based on your schedule and will accompany you when you need it.

Get the most of any kind of travel: tourism, sightseeing, gastronomy, business, outdoor activities, culture lovers, party, transfer, etc.

The Impact

Perks


Advantages

The travel industry has huge scope for improvement in terms of efficiency of expenditures and time. In other words, there is a trend towards a more equitable sharing of the benefits between travelers and service providers.

Thank to the Helper network, it’s possible to organize a trip depending on interests, purpose of trip, size of the wallet or possibility of exchanging the services between the participants.

Anyone can become a member of the Helper network. Helpers determine their own capabilities and approach, i.e. you can be an innovator and the main beneficiary of your own ideas. Thus members have unlimited possibilities in choosing preferences and ways of spending their time on a trip. Everyone has the opportunity of feedback to improve the quality and variety of services.

Our goals

I decided to share my project with the world via indiegogo so anyone has an opportunity to help or get helped out. I would like to receive your support by sharing this idea and web platform with your friends, family and mates. Every cent raised is going to be spent on developing web platform, creating mobile application and adding new functions and languages.

You will help us not only by donation, but also by using Helper network.

We are open to your suggestions.

story:
Level Seat, Less Mess, More Surface

SHIPS NOVEMBER 2019

We created Stupid Car tray to help our time spent in the car in many ways: 

  • Securely hold everything level from pizza boxes, coffee trays to laptops and paperwork
  • Organize items that we transport regularly and want close and secure
  • Keep our kids occupied and the backseat clean
  • Free up your cup holders that fill with everything from loose change to sunglasses

 

Whenever our kids have a snack in the back, play a game or just want to color, they use their own Stupid Car Tray. Whenever I commute, I use the Stupid Car Tray in the passengers seat to organize my busy life.

 

 

We have begun production

We've put nearly two years of design and funding into the Stupid Car Tray, and would like to give one to you. This has been an incredibly well-received product from our pilot test groups, and we want to make it simple for you to experience the benefits first-hand.

Through Indiegogo, you will get Stupid Car Tray(s) at the lowest possible price - guaranteed. We are launching here, and would greatly appreciate your support to bring a brand new product to mass market. 

 

 

Your advanced purchase will make a huge difference

We are not a big team - we are two people who simply had a dream to make a product - and worked our butts off. Your advanced purchase will make a difference in 3 ways:

  • Give us the momentum to continue following our dreams and bring more new products to market.
  • Allow us to increase production to lower manufacturing costs.
  • Make a difference in peoples lives through innovation.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We've already eaten most of the risk. We've worked through the design iterations, tooling, mold iterations, and LOTS of complexities to make the grippy rubber work like we want it to. The final steel mold will be arriving Oct 11th, 2019 to our local manufacturer's facility. When it's there, it will take a couple weeks to calibrate the machine, and we'll be making trays daily. The manufacturing logistics have been worked out.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word, or show your salesman buddy, busy friend juggling kids and sports, Uber or Lyft driver friend, or any other person on-the-go in their vehicle. It's been a game changer for us and many people around us, and we're pretty confident it will be for you as well :)

We are also proud to say, that the Stupid Car Tray was designed, and manufactured in the USA. We support local business.

story:
________________________________________________________________________________________

EASY ACCESS END CAP

Lockable, yet easily accessible, this sleek zip down end cap will hold all your personal items when you want easy access to them.  It even comes with a handy, hidden bottle opener for whenever you may need it.

________________________________________________________________________________________

CUSTOM SIZED PACKING CUBES

Definitely not your typical packing cubes!  We've tried more brands than we can count.  Maverick & Companies packing cubes are made of high grade water resistant canvas and top of the line zippers.  They are specifically designed to fit several days worth of clothes and fit perfectly into your EVERYDAY DUFFLE.

__________________________________________________________

ELECTRONICS CASE / TRAVEL WALLET

This will be your new favorite travel wallet.  Once you use this, you will wonder how you traveled without it. This wallet has dual access compartments. In one compartment you can neatly store all your electronic cords, chargers, power banks and accessories. In the other compartment, you can keep your ID, credit cards, passport, money, plane tickets or anything else you may want easy handling on.

__________________________________________________________

TOILETRY TRAVEL BAG

This foldable, hangable and custom fitting toiletry bag is compact and durable. It's large enough to hold at least a weeks worth of toiletry items and stores neatly in your matching everyday duffle.

__________________________________________________________

WET/DRY BAG

Whether it's wet clothes from the beach, lake, snow or simply wet gym clothes, this waterproof bag will keep your dry items dry and your wet clothes sealed up until you arrive to your destination.

_________________________________________________________

SHOE BAG

Yes, there is a separate easy access compartment on the EVERYDAY DUFFLE that you could use for shoes, but we also wanted to provide a water resistant shoe bag... so whether you want to bring an extra pair of shoes or simply want to keep your shoes packed separately, this ones for you.

__________________________________________________________

DIRTY CLOTHES BAG

This dirty clothes bag is hangable and closes with a drawstring closure. It also folds up and tucks away neatly in a specially designed slim pocket in the bottom of your EVERYDAY DUFFLE BAG. 

Shoe Bag and Dirty Clothes Bag tucked away in slim bottom pockets 

________________________________________________________________________________________

MULTIPLE MODES TO CARRY

BACKPACK MODE

Easily convert your duffle into backpack style mode. Backpack straps are in a zipper compartment underneath the bag for quick conversion. Extra padding has been added to the bottom of the bag and also to the shoulder straps for added comfort.  Both shoulder straps have easy access pockets for your phone, wallet or whatever else you may need quick access to.

__________________________________________________________

SHOULDER/HAND CARRY MODES

________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

story:
Welcome aboard PACIFIC AURORA…

Come sail with us. Explore and discover.

Connect with nature through this intimate cruise.

Discover the Garden of Eden… above and below the water.

This is an interactive experience where you’ll discover and connect with new friends, nature and with yourself. As we explore unique destinations we’ll discover more about ourselves because it's  not so much who we are, but who we are meant to be.

Let’s leave the beaten path and explore Mexico’s Baja California in a way only a few get to experience. Stunning vistas and spectacular underwater sea life will grace each day of our voyage. So leave the masses behind. Join us for a cruise of a lifetime.  Pacific Aurora awaits you. Let's get some sand between our toes!!

​We depart Vancouver this November. We’ll cruise south along the Pacific west coast all the way to Cabo San Lucas and into the Sea of Cortez.  (See our itinerary below.)  

EARLY BIRD BACKERS - SAVE 60%​ ... in appreciation for your early support 

The Expedition Ship...

PACIFIC AURORA is 188 feet in length. Her 34 guest staterooms are located on two decks and vary in size and makeup. Each has a private ensuite. The common areas – the dining room, Salty Dog Bar and Upper Vista lounge, have their own unique décor. The upper areas have full vistas to be enjoyed. There is ample deck space to ensure unforgettable cruising. 

 

What specifically will your money be used for?

Pacific Aurora has undergone an extensive refit: motors, cabins, galley and lounges. The ship's equipment, while in excellent working order needs to be re-certified. We also need to add an additional radar and satellite internet equipment. Satellite internet will allow us to communicate with you at all times so you will be able to reach us whenever you want to join us. 

 

Your friend Sammy the Seal is wondering when you are coming to swim with him??

 

What kind of adventures?    

Fun and adventure - that's our motto! And we take delight in doing just that.  The Pacific west coast and Mexico provide the perfect playground.

Imagine…

  • watching gray whales migrate
  • swimming with sea lions and seals
  • hiking and exploring
  • snorkelling with legions of rainbow colored fish
  • strolling down Baja’s endless pristine beaches
  • witnessing Baja's iconic red sunsets
  • star-gazing on the ship’s vista deck on crystal clear nights

An endless spectacle of nature is waiting for you to enjoy. 

 

How can you participate?

You are our pillar of support and your EARLY contribution is the magic way to sail with us. It gives you the opportunity to custom design your cruise the way you want it. No matter which perk you choose, it can be applied for any segment of a voyage or any activity you wish to participate in.

  • You are welcome to work along side of the regular crew, would it be navigating the ship from the bridge, or joining the chef in the galley preparing your favorite creation to share with your fellow passage-mates.
  • Or you may just want to relax, kick back and enjoy the sea breeze as it seduces your senses. Observe and take in the world as it unfolds. There is nothing like the sea to renew one's spirit. Recline in a comfortable deck chair, or spend time sharing laughter and conversing with fellow adventurers.  The choice is yours.
  • Spread the news. Encourage your friends & family to participate. An adventure is best when shared. 

There are many ways to contribute. Review the “backer perks” and determine which one best resonates with you. 

 

ITINERARY

You can join the ship anywhere, any time. 

 

#1 - NOVEMBER 15, 2016

10-day Voyage - Vancouver to San Diego... stops in San Fran & L.A. (2 days in each city)

Experience the thrill of sailing in the open Pacific Ocean,  then imagine sailing under the famous Golden Gate Bridge and strolling along Fisherman's Wharf.  Wow what a charge!!! Then on to L.A.'s Marina Del Ray and the port of Long Beach. Stroll down Venice Beach and you'll feel like a star!!

And then on to San Diego the magnificent!!

Use your $200 perk/day (for 1 person). $370 perk/day (for 2 people sharing).

#2 - DECEMBER 15, 2016

10-day voyage - San Diego to Cabo San Lucas

This is where we start to enjoy tropical weather - with visits to Ensenada and Dos Coronado Islands. Amazing Bahia Magdalena will catch you by surprise. Imagine whale watching, sport fishing or surfing world-class breaks. It's a walker and hiker's delight. Discover 5 varieties of cactus and 1 agave... and vistas that leave you speechless. It’s a bird watcher and beach lover's paradise and solitude lover's dream.

Don't forget your favorite water-toys (snorkel equipment, kite-boards, surf-boards, etc.) We’ll always troll a line for fish as we cruise. There is nothing like fresh tuna or mahi for dinner. Did anyone mention lobster? Catching lobster is the Captain’s favorite thing. It’s all about having fun!

December 15 – day 1

Fly into San Diego and embark the MV Pacific Aurora at the Waterfront.  We are leaving at noon for our first port of call in Mexico – the cruise-ship destination Ensenada.

Moorage in port of Ensenada.

December 16 – day 2

You will have the opportunity to visit the Plaza Civica with the sculptures of the three national heroes and the twin-towered church of Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe. Or take a tour to Bodegas de Santo Tomas vineyards south of town.

Leaving Ensenada at 18:00 h.

December 17 – day 3

At sea. Reaching Guerrero Negro in the evening.

Anchorage in Laguna Ojo de Liebre.

December 18 – day 4

Board our RIB and watch for early arrivals of grey whale in the lagoon. These magnificent sea mammals will typically spend January to March in these shallow waters to give birth to their calves.

Explore the world largest sea salt operation on the shores of the lagoon or hike the Dunas de Soledad sand dunes area.

Anchorage in Laguna Ojo de Liebre.

December 19 – day 5

Take a tour to the interior of the Vizcaino peninsula.

This is a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve and the largest protected area in Latin America, featuring exceptional ecosystems, mangroves, and the whale sanctuaries of Laguna Ojo de Liebre and Laguna San Ignacio.

Visit the strangely shaped Boojum Trees and spot the endangered bighorn sheep and pronghorn antelope.

Anchorage in Laguna Ojo de Liebre.

December 20 – day 6

Excursion to Cueva del Raton caves, located 45 km north of San Ignacio. These caves were most likely painted by the ancestors of the Cochimi first nation. The black and red images date back to 1200 BC. Besides human figures and animals, they also feature abstracts of unknown significance.

Visit the town of San Ignacio with it’s famous 18. century mission church which is nestled among thousands of date palms.

Anchorage in Laguna Ojo de Liebre.

December 21 – day 7

Sail around the cape of Punta Eugenia, visit Bahia Tortuga, and carry on south down the coast of the Vizcaino Peninsula.

In the late afternoon, we will reach the Laguna San Ignacio, which is home to one of the largest breeding colonies of ospreys in the world. Elephant seals, sea turtles, and various kinds of seabirds can be watched here.

Anchorage in Laguna San Ignacio.

December 22 – day 8

We head south for Bahia Magdalena, an inside passage through narrow channels, with a long string of islands protecting the mainland’s coast. Enjoy kayaking, fishing, or birdwatching in the bay.

Mooring at Puerto San Carlos for the night, the only deep water port on Baja’s Pacific coast besides Ensenada.

December 23 – day 9

Watch for migrating grey whales as we carry on through Gaviota Canal or go for a hike in 30 foot sand dunes on one of our stops at the surrounding islands. You might want to try some windsurfing, as the canal has some of the best windsurfing conditions worldwide.

This evening, we will arrive in Cabo San Lucas. Stroll the waterfront strip with it’s many bars and restaurants.

Moorage in Marina Cabo San Lucas.

December 24 – day 10

Enjoy the sun on Lover’s Beach, accessible only by water, and framed by a rock archway. Other jagged rocks at the end of the peninsula are called Los Frailes (the friars). Or put on some scuba diving gear and explore the immense underwater canyon, where the Pacific Ocean meets the Sea of Cortes.

This is our last night on board the MV Pacific Aurora, and we will be having our Captain’s Dinner.

December 25 – day 11

Cabo San Lucas is the port where we say, “See you later.”  Or do we? This is your trip so choose more perks and stay longer.  Why not stay for the winter?

Merry Christmas to all!

#3 - JANUARY 15, 2017

7-day cruise from Cabo San Lucas to La Paz & the many bays & islands along the east coast of Baja California, Sea of Cortez

This part of the Baja peninsula is world-renown for it’s intoxicating beauty.

You can feel the excitement building up. Your heart races as you swim amongst legions of rainbow coloured fish... or as you touch whale's snout. You feel triumphant as your inner you screams, “I did it! Oh my God I did it.”

 

#4 - FEBRUARY, 2017

Depending on interest we will offer additional cruises from Cabo San Lucas during the month of February. 

 

Special Cruises

If you are part of a large family or group of friends, why not organize a special cruise? Where would you like to visit? What would you like to do? We can custom design a cruise especially for your group.

 

 

Future Pacific Aurora Activities & itineraries

Check back often. Our future itineraries and activities will be posted on-line. Select your favourite segments of the itinerary and join us. It's time to get some sand between your toes!

Your Contribution

Shirley and I appreciate your contribution but we ask that you only give an amount you are comfortable with. There is availability for 12 crew assistants and 70 adventurers at any given time so there is plenty of opportunity to accommodate everyone at various stages of our adventure. Check the perks to see which one fits you best.

 

Risk Assessment

There is no risk to our backers. Regardless if we reach our campaign funding target or not, voyages will start November 15. We have a backup strategy to make up the difference between donations and our target.

Contribute as much as you are comfortable with. And more importantly share this program with all your contacts – the young and young at heart.  Be the messenger of something unique!!

There is no risk because the perks... 

  • stay aboard in port
  • join a voyage, cruise, expedition or special project
  • make Pacific Aurora your home-away-from-home for an extended time period

...are all interchangeable and valid for 5 years. For those who need to plan their schedule and are budget conscious - acquire one perk at a time and when you’ve accumulated enough perks, treat yourself to a voyage. What a great way to make it happen!! Go for it.  Start acquiring your perks today.

Your Hosts

Shirley and I are fortunate to have gained many loyal friends over the years. Because of them our journey has been enriched and we are grateful for their friendship. It’s something we take very seriously. We believe as we journey through life each of us builds our reputation and creates our own karma. We strive to be worthy of the friendships bestowed upon us. Many have trusted us with their lives as we cruised the world together. We appreciate the honour of their trust and have never forgotten those who have helped us along the way.

So don’t hesitate... Jump on-board! We won’t forget your patronage. We live by the rule of “going one step beyond” our previous achievements. We’d love to have YOU be part of this adventure and to gain another friend along the way.

If you’d like to know us better, read about our travels in our book…

THE UNSINKABLE SPIRIT, In Search of Love, Adventure and Riches.   


 

Reviews & Past charter guests...

"We first met Boris and Shirley when my wife and I eloped on their charter-yacht to get married in the Bahamas. 30 years and more of cruising together, we have become long-time friends. Thanks so much for your generosity of spirit that has made our adventures with you so remarkable." Warren & Josie  M., Vancouver.

"There is a man alive today who lives the spirit of Captain Cook, Marco Polo and Magellan! Boris King and his delightful wife, Shirley, bought a ship and sailed off to the South Pacific to discover the most exciting adventures. One of the best page-turners I've ever read. You won't be able to put it down. The best gift you'll ever receive!"... Dottie Walters, Author, Publisher, Sharing Ideas
story_txt:
Welcome aboard PACIFIC AURORA…Come sail with us. Explore and discover.Connect with nature through this intimate cruise.Discover the Garden of Eden… above and below the water.This is an interactive experience where you’ll discover and connect with new friends, nature and with yourself. As we explore unique destinations we’ll discover more about ourselves because it's  not so much who we are, but who we are meant to be.Let’s leave the beaten path and explore Mexico’s Baja California in a way only a few get to experience. Stunning vistas and spectacular underwater sea life will grace each day of our voyage. So leave the masses behind. Join us for a cruise of a lifetime.  Pacific Aurora awaits you. Let's get some sand between our toes!!​We depart Vancouver this November. We’ll cruise south along the Pacific west coast all the way to Cabo San Lucas and into the Sea of Cortez.  (See our itinerary below.)  EARLY BIRD BACKERS - SAVE 60%​ ... in appreciation for your early support The Expedition Ship...PACIFIC AURORA is 188 feet in length. Her 34 guest staterooms are located on two decks and vary in size and makeup. Each has a private ensuite. The common areas – the dining room, Salty Dog Bar and Upper Vista lounge, have their own unique décor. The upper areas have full vistas to be enjoyed. There is ample deck space to ensure unforgettable cruising.  What specifically will your money be used for? Pacific Aurora has undergone an extensive refit: motors, cabins, galley and lounges. The ship's equipment, while in excellent working order needs to be re-certified. We also need to add an additional radar and satellite internet equipment. Satellite internet will allow us to communicate with you at all times so you will be able to reach us whenever you want to join us.  Your friend Sammy the Seal is wondering when you are coming to swim with him?? What kind of adventures?    Fun and adventure - that's our motto! And we take delight in doing just that.  The Pacific west coast and Mexico provide the perfect playground.Imagine…
watching gray whales migrate
swimming with sea lions and seals
hiking and exploring
snorkelling with legions of rainbow colored fish
strolling down Baja’s endless pristine beaches
witnessing Baja's iconic red sunsets
star-gazing on the ship’s vista deck on crystal clear nights
An endless spectacle of nature is waiting for you to enjoy.  How can you participate?You are our pillar of support and your EARLY contribution is the magic way to sail with us. It gives you the opportunity to custom design your cruise the way you want it. No matter which perk you choose, it can be applied for any segment of a voyage or any activity you wish to participate in.

You are welcome to work along side of the regular crew, would it be navigating the ship from the bridge, or joining the chef in the galley preparing your favorite creation to share with your fellow passage-mates.

Or you may just want to relax, kick back and enjoy the sea breeze as it seduces your senses. Observe and take in the world as it unfolds. There is nothing like the sea to renew one's spirit. Recline in a comfortable deck chair, or spend time sharing laughter and conversing with fellow adventurers.  The choice is yours.

Spread the news. Encourage your friends & family to participate. An adventure is best when shared. 
There are many ways to contribute. Review the “backer perks” and determine which one best resonates with you.  ITINERARYYou can join the ship anywhere, any time.  #1 - NOVEMBER 15, 201610-day Voyage - Vancouver to San Diego... stops in San Fran & L.A. (2 days in each city)Experience the thrill of sailing in the open Pacific Ocean,  then imagine sailing under the famous Golden Gate Bridge and strolling along Fisherman's Wharf.  Wow what a charge!!! Then on to L.A.'s Marina Del Ray and the port of Long Beach. Stroll down Venice Beach and you'll feel like a star!!And then on to San Diego the magnificent!!Use your $200 perk/day (for 1 person). $370 perk/day (for 2 people sharing).#2 - DECEMBER 15, 201610-day voyage - San Diego to Cabo San LucasThis is where we start to enjoy tropical weather - with visits to Ensenada and Dos Coronado Islands. Amazing Bahia Magdalena will catch you by surprise. Imagine whale watching, sport fishing or surfing world-class breaks. It's a walker and hiker's delight. Discover 5 varieties of cactus and 1 agave... and vistas that leave you speechless. It’s a bird watcher and beach lover's paradise and solitude lover's dream.Don't forget your favorite water-toys (snorkel equipment, kite-boards, surf-boards, etc.) We’ll always troll a line for fish as we cruise. There is nothing like fresh tuna or mahi for dinner. Did anyone mention lobster? Catching lobster is the Captain’s favorite thing. It’s all about having fun!December 15 – day 1Fly into San Diego and embark the MV Pacific Aurora at the Waterfront.  We are leaving at noon for our first port of call in Mexico – the cruise-ship destination Ensenada.Moorage in port of Ensenada.December 16 – day 2You will have the opportunity to visit the Plaza Civica with the sculptures of the three national heroes and the twin-towered church of Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe. Or take a tour to Bodegas de Santo Tomas vineyards south of town.Leaving Ensenada at 18:00 h.December 17 – day 3At sea. Reaching Guerrero Negro in the evening.Anchorage in Laguna Ojo de Liebre.December 18 – day 4Board our RIB and watch for early arrivals of grey whale in the lagoon. These magnificent sea mammals will typically spend January to March in these shallow waters to give birth to their calves.Explore the world largest sea salt operation on the shores of the lagoon or hike the Dunas de Soledad sand dunes area.Anchorage in Laguna Ojo de Liebre.December 19 – day 5Take a tour to the interior of the Vizcaino peninsula.This is a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve and the largest protected area in Latin America, featuring exceptional ecosystems, mangroves, and the whale sanctuaries of Laguna Ojo de Liebre and Laguna San Ignacio.Visit the strangely shaped Boojum Trees and spot the endangered bighorn sheep and pronghorn antelope.Anchorage in Laguna Ojo de Liebre.December 20 – day 6Excursion to Cueva del Raton caves, located 45 km north of San Ignacio. These caves were most likely painted by the ancestors of the Cochimi first nation. The black and red images date back to 1200 BC. Besides human figures and animals, they also feature abstracts of unknown significance.Visit the town of San Ignacio with it’s famous 18. century mission church which is nestled among thousands of date palms.Anchorage in Laguna Ojo de Liebre.December 21 – day 7Sail around the cape of Punta Eugenia, visit Bahia Tortuga, and carry on south down the coast of the Vizcaino Peninsula.In the late afternoon, we will reach the Laguna San Ignacio, which is home to one of the largest breeding colonies of ospreys in the world. Elephant seals, sea turtles, and various kinds of seabirds can be watched here.Anchorage in Laguna San Ignacio.December 22 – day 8We head south for Bahia Magdalena, an inside passage through narrow channels, with a long string of islands protecting the mainland’s coast. Enjoy kayaking, fishing, or birdwatching in the bay.Mooring at Puerto San Carlos for the night, the only deep water port on Baja’s Pacific coast besides Ensenada.December 23 – day 9Watch for migrating grey whales as we carry on through Gaviota Canal or go for a hike in 30 foot sand dunes on one of our stops at the surrounding islands. You might want to try some windsurfing, as the canal has some of the best windsurfing conditions worldwide.This evening, we will arrive in Cabo San Lucas. Stroll the waterfront strip with it’s many bars and restaurants.Moorage in Marina Cabo San Lucas.December 24 – day 10Enjoy the sun on Lover’s Beach, accessible only by water, and framed by a rock archway. Other jagged rocks at the end of the peninsula are called Los Frailes (the friars). Or put on some scuba diving gear and explore the immense underwater canyon, where the Pacific Ocean meets the Sea of Cortes.This is our last night on board the MV Pacific Aurora, and we will be having our Captain’s Dinner.December 25 – day 11Cabo San Lucas is the port where we say, “See you later.”  Or do we? This is your trip so choose more perks and stay longer.  Why not stay for the winter?Merry Christmas to all!#3 - JANUARY 15, 20177-day cruise from Cabo San Lucas to La Paz & the many bays & islands along the east coast of Baja California, Sea of CortezThis part of the Baja peninsula is world-renown for it’s intoxicating beauty.You can feel the excitement building up. Your heart races as you swim amongst legions of rainbow coloured fish... or as you touch whale's snout. You feel triumphant as your inner you screams, “I did it! Oh my God I did it.” #4 - FEBRUARY, 2017Depending on interest we will offer additional cruises from Cabo San Lucas during the month of February.  Special CruisesIf you are part of a large family or group of friends, why not organize a special cruise? Where would you like to visit? What would you like to do? We can custom design a cruise especially for your group.  Future Pacific Aurora Activities & itineraries Check back often. Our future itineraries and activities will be posted on-line. Select your favourite segments of the itinerary and join us. It's time to get some sand between your toes!Your ContributionShirley and I appreciate your contribution but we ask that you only give an amount you are comfortable with. There is availability for 12 crew assistants and 70 adventurers at any given time so there is plenty of opportunity to accommodate everyone at various stages of our adventure. Check the perks to see which one fits you best. Risk AssessmentThere is no risk to our backers. Regardless if we reach our campaign funding target or not, voyages will start November 15. We have a backup strategy to make up the difference between donations and our target.Contribute as much as you are comfortable with. And more importantly share this program with all your contacts – the young and young at heart.  Be the messenger of something unique!!There is no risk because the perks... 
stay aboard in port
join a voyage, cruise, expedition or special project
make Pacific Aurora your home-away-from-home for an extended time period
...are all interchangeable and valid for 5 years. For those who need to plan their schedule and are budget conscious - acquire one perk at a time and when you’ve accumulated enough perks, treat yourself to a voyage. What a great way to make it happen!! Go for it.  Start acquiring your perks today.Your HostsShirley and I are fortunate to have gained many loyal friends over the years. Because of them our journey has been enriched and we are grateful for their friendship. It’s something we take very seriously. We believe as we journey through life each of us builds our reputation and creates our own karma. We strive to be worthy of the friendships bestowed upon us. Many have trusted us with their lives as we cruised the world together. We appreciate the honour of their trust and have never forgotten those who have helped us along the way.So don’t hesitate... Jump on-board! We won’t forget your patronage. We live by the rule of “going one step beyond” our previous achievements. We’d love to have YOU be part of this adventure and to gain another friend along the way.If you’d like to know us better, read about our travels in our book…THE UNSINKABLE SPIRIT, In Search of Love, Adventure and Riches.    Reviews & Past charter guests..."We first met Boris and Shirley when my wife and I eloped on their charter-yacht to get married in the Bahamas. 30 years and more of cruising together, we have become long-time friends. Thanks so much for your generosity of spirit that has made our adventures with you so remarkable." Warren & Josie  M., Vancouver."There is a man alive today who lives the spirit of Captain Cook, Marco Polo and Magellan! Boris King and his delightful wife, Shirley, bought a ship and sailed off to the South Pacific to discover the most exciting adventures. One of the best page-turners I've ever read. You won't be able to put it down. The best gift you'll ever receive!"... Dottie Walters, Author, Publisher, Sharing Ideas

story:
A versatile huge capacity of the outdoor power station that can charge or power most devices with the wireless speakers and LED lights.

:

CHARGING, POWERING, LISTENING, LIGHTING

The various featured power station for outdoor activity or the emergency!

It has dual USB fast charging ports, the universal AC socket, DC12V out jack, car jump starter, wireless stereo speaker units, LED light that can adjust the brighteness with 3 levels, flash LED light with red & white color.

 

                                                                                              

The moreStation is versatile...

Multiple Output Options for All Your Electronics & Value Added Various Functions!

The moreStation allows you the freedom on the go. Charge any devices that use a USB or a AC/DC charger.

 

 

1) Universal Voltage Power Outlet (110V~240V)
 

 

2) Dual USB Quick Charging with Qualcomm 3.0

Quick Charge 3.0, up from the 40 percent speed increase offered by its first generation technology. The major new feature with 3.0 is INOV (Intelligent Negotiation for Optimum Voltage). Quick Charge 3.0’s INOV communicates with the device to request any voltage between 3.2V and 20V at 200mV increments, allowing for a wider selection of voltages. INOV has the added benefit of being able to dynamically adjust the charging voltage over the battery charging cycle. This is useful as it reduces the amount of energy wasted during charging. By exerting more control over charging efficiency, less power is wasted, resulting in less heat. Qualcomm states that version 3.0 is up to 38 percent more efficiency than 2.0, which is a substantial energy saving.

 

3) DC12V Out with 10A

The universal barrel port can provide 12V DC output for most laptops, radio systems and other small appliances with up to 10A max current.

4) Car Jump Starter for 12V Car

The moreStation can jump start the car when the battery is run out and it has SAFETY PROTECTION: has over current protection, short circuit protection, overload protection, over-voltage protection, over-charge protection.

5) Fan for Air Recirculating

When the moreStation is used with various outputs at the same time, there may be some heat inside of the moreStation, however, no worry about this thanks to the built-in fan.

The fan operates all the time to ventilate the air out from the moreStation.

6) DC 15V 5A Input for Charging the moreStation

By using the supplied DC15V / 5A power supply, it may take about 6-8 hours for full charging and you can charge the moreStation during the night and take it out the next day morning.

7) LED Display

The LED display shows the battery remains and it alerts when the moreStation has the low battery remains and it shows [LO].

8) Wireless Stereo Speakers (40W Output)

Listen to music with the moreStation which has the high power stereo output (40W). Connect your phone and stream music to the moreStation.

9) LED Light with 3-Step Brightness Adjustment

The moreStation has LED light that can adjust with 3-steps (Bright=>Brighter=>Brightest) and you can adjust the brightness depends on the mood. It's 560~600 lumens.

 

10) Selectable Red or White Color Flashlight

The flash LED light is lighting or blinking with white or red colors by pressing the buttons and it's 190~220 lumens.

11) Qi Standard Wireless Charger

The wireless charger transmits maximum 1A current and it's Qi standard.

12) Convenient Carry Handle

13) Cover for Waterproof

 

What's in the Box?

 

Time Line
