story_txt: To be seen soon

story:
Short Summary

My name is Julien. I come from an extensive background of traveling. From a very young age, I moved a lot around the globe, being influenced by many different cultures. I've spent the last few years doing my own traveling, and developing passions such as music, photography, and film. I worked on a few projects with a organization called Polk County Film Initiative in Tryon, North Carolina. 
I've always had the crazy idea of going out, and making my own platform where I could combine multiple different art forms to show people the world. I wanted to inspire people to think for themselves, and see, that with good will, one can figure anything out. I wanted to go on a two month trip to meet people, and launch this platform I've been dreaming of. Traveling across the United States is just one of the many dream trips I've been wanting to do! I didn't know how I was going to afford going on this trip, but I knew that once I threw myself out there, I would have to find the means to make it work. I convinced a good friend of mine to believe in my crazy ideas, and invest partly with me on this gamble, to show the world what we can achieve, and we're making it work! 
Where you come into play with your contributions, is all about what I will be able to show the world as I go along. After two weeks of being on the road, my ambitions have grown. I want to show things to my viewership beyond just sleeping in a car. This takes a lot of funding to get the right equipment and for marketing, as well as funds for healthy food, places, people, and monuments to show off on "We'll Figure It Out's" pages. 

What We Need

In order to make more trips like this possible, we need to get people excited about following a platform such as this. We need funding to keep our content golden. When I first started this project, I decided to hold off on crowd funding because I really wanted to already have something to show for first. Now that we have built up a small following, and our pages and vlogs are being updated on a regular basis, it is time for us to take the next step. Originally, when I was talking about this project to some folks, I had people believe in what I believed in, and was about to get some good sponsorship. Unfortunately, this fell through, and it was being postponed way too much for my liking. I was so passionate about getting this started, I took matters into my own hands, and put myself into more debt to get the necessary equipment to at least get something started. Part of this funding is to pay that debt back, in order to be able to focus solely on this project. 

Here is where all the money goes:

The money goes towards keeping us alive. We have about 1500$ in debt we already put into this project and we would like to pay it back. Quite frankly I want to be able to keep projects going even when we come back to our home in January. 

If we don't reach our goals, we will do just what this project is all about. We will take what we have, and make it work. 

The Impact

Hopefully, at the end of this project, we will have an inspirational film to share with the world. We will be able to create a platform in which people can refer to, to find the strength to go forward with their projects. At the end of the day, I hope to get more people on board, start non-profit sub-organizations and projects under this idea, to help around the world with things like; environmental preservation, cultural protection, helping the homeless get back on their feet, pushing for non-violence, improving education, pushing for coexistence between religions, and overall improving the connection between people and their quality of life. 

Risks & Challenges

We want to move forward as fast as we can with this project, and the biggest risk and challenges I could see us running into, is becoming discouraged as we run into situations beyond our control traveling through the country. With your support, this minimizes that risk, for we will have something beyond us to protect and cherish. The more support this gets, the more easily we'll be able to figure things out. This platform should ultimately be a communitarian effort. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

We are always looking for passionate people who might be able to offer services to help us move further into this project. If you have any out-of-the-box skills, don't hesitate to contact us at wefiguretravel@gmail.com 

Otherwise, the biggest contribution any simple person could provide us with, is the power of word of mouth. If you believe in our ideologies, don't ever hesitate to share our adventures.

Here is where all the money goes:
The money goes towards keeping us alive. We have about 1500$ in debt we already put into this project and we would like to pay it back. Quite frankly I want to be able to keep projects going even when we come back to our home in January. 
If we don't reach our goals, we will do just what this project is all about. We will take what we have, and make it work.    The Impact Hopefully, at the end of this project, we will have an inspirational film to share with the world. We will be able to create a platform in which people can refer to, to find the strength to go forward with their projects. At the end of the day, I hope to get more people on board, start non-profit sub-organizations and projects under this idea, to help around the world with things like; environmental preservation, cultural protection, helping the homeless get back on their feet, pushing for non-violence, improving education, pushing for coexistence between religions, and overall improving the connection between people and their quality of life. 
    Risks & Challenges
We want to move forward as fast as we can with this project, and the biggest risk and challenges I could see us running into, is becoming discouraged as we run into situations beyond our control traveling through the country. With your support, this minimizes that risk, for we will have something beyond us to protect and cherish. The more support this gets, the more easily we'll be able to figure things out. This platform should ultimately be a communitarian effort. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
We are always looking for passionate people who might be able to offer services to help us move further into this project. If you have any out-of-the-box skills, don't hesitate to contact us at wefiguretravel@gmail.com 
Otherwise, the biggest contribution any simple person could provide us with, is the power of word of mouth. If you believe in our ideologies, don't ever hesitate to share our adventures.

story:
The Brand:

Hollow-Point Gear manufactures high-end valve caps, lifestyle accessories, and military-inspired apparel for BMX riders, car fanatics, and firearm enthusiasts.

In the ballistics world, hollow-point bullets are the uncontested champions. Expanding upon impact, these rounds provide an unparalleled level of transfer of momentum to your target. Hollow-Point Gear will equip you with the momentum to accomplish the main objectives: Style, Power, Confidence, and Success. 

The Story:

Hollow-Point Gear was born from the creation of our .40 Caliber Bullet Casing Valve Caps. These are car, truck, motorcycle, bicycle, and ATV replacement tire valve caps that have been handmade using recycled .40 caliber bullet casings. Upon launch, the valve caps received praise and an unexpected growth in sales throughout our Etsy, Amazon, and Ebay stores. During the early stages of production, all of the valve caps were created using personally fired .40 caliber casings ejected from a trusty Glock 23. Due to increasing demand (and sore hands), Hollow-Point Gear now sources and recycles bullet casings from law enforcement and private ranges throughout the country.

Hollow-Point Gear has evolved into a well-rounded BMX, car culture, and tactical lifestyle brand, offering a full line of military-inspired apparel, bullet casing lifestyle accessories, and our highly-rated valve caps. 

The Products:

Our Standard .40 Cal Caps are replacement valve stem caps that have been designed with an actual brass bullet casing and bonded with a fitted screw cap inlay. The bullet casings have been loaded, chambered, fired, and ejected from a .40 caliber firearm. The inlay protects valve stems from rust and corrosion, while the brass holds up well in all conditions and provides protection from dirt, rocks, and whatever other abuse you put your vehicle through. The caps are tough, rugged, and designed to show off your tactical side.

 Our .40 Cal Caps are also available in silver and feature nickel-plated brass bullet casings.

We keep it classy with our Swarovski inlay .40 Cal Caps. We start by removing the spent primers from our .40 caliber brass bullet casings. The casing is then fitted with a Swarovski Elements crystal.

We also manufacture paracord zipper pulls that are a great accessory for coats, backpacks, purses, hoodies, boots, and anything with a zipper. These zipper pulls are high-quality, handmade, and built with the most durable materials around. They are crafted using once-fired .40 caliber brass bullet casings and 275-lb tensile strength paracord.

We offer a full line of military-inspired BMX clothing for men and women, including t-shirts, tanks, v-necks, zip-ups, and pullovers.

Additionally, we manufacture novelty products that include bullet casing push pins and refrigerator magnets.

 The Objective:

We are launching this campaign to help bring our brand to the next level. We have developed our products, created a retail e-commerce platform, and now we need the world to see us in action. We want those interested in our brand and our mission to join us in propelling Hollow-Point Gear into a far-reaching lifestyle brand. Our main objective in launching this campaign is to secure funding to promote our products and expand our wholesale production. The majority of this funding will be used to support our transition into a wholesale supplier for bike shops, auto part stores, and other retail locations. 

The Budget:

•Wholesale Production Capabilities, $400-$500: We are currently able to produce enough of our products to keep up with retail demand. We have received great interest from bike shops throughout the country to stock our products on their shelves. We would use the majority of the funds to help increase our product production to support this wholesale demand. These funds will be used to facilitate the recruitment and training of an additional manufacturing employee, complete bulk purchases of our supplies, and develop in-store displays and promotional material.

•Marketing, $200-$300: We will use a portion of the funds for advertising our website and products. Prospective marketing activities will include search engine advertisements, social media marketing, event promos, and BMX sponsorships.

•Product Development, $200-$300: We are always looking to expand our product line. We would like to begin stocking new products including stickers, embroidered hats, dog tags, and additional BMX parts and gear.  

•Street Team Donation - $200: We intend to use this funding to give back to up-and-coming BMX riders that are involved in our "Street Team" program (see below). We will use this money to provide our riders with free gear! 

About the Street Team:

We have successfully recruited a group of BMX riders known as the "Hollow-Point Gear Street Team." The Street Team program is designed as a partnership between our brand and BMX riders of various skills levels throughout the United States and overseas. We provide the riders with free gear and exposure on our social media accounts and website, while riders promote our brand through word-of-mouth, community involvement, and social media interaction.  The riders submit BMX content to be featured on our website (www.hollowpointgear.com) and Youtube channel. With this program, we are building a sense of community and camaraderie among those riders interested in our brand.

To show our gratitude for these brand ambassadors, we would like to use a portion of this funding to give back to the riders in the form of free merchandise. 

See the Street Team in action:

Internet Presence and Social Media Pages:

We have designed a fully functional website providing e-commerce for our products. The website includes a page dedicated to BMX videos and user submitted content. Check it out at www.hollowpointgear.com

Our social media pages:

Instagram

Facebook

Twitter

Youtube

Google+


Risks and challenges

There is virtually no risk of non-delivery of the rewards. We are producing a large volume of our products weekly, and will begin to ship the rewards to our backers immediately at the conclusion of our campaign.

story:
Short Summary

In June 2015, The Nidaros Roller Derby Allstars are heading over to the US to do a tour of states, ending at the Beach Brawl tournament in Ft. Lauderdale, Florida. A trip to and from the States will end up on a minimum of 16.000 kilometers.
We are sending a total of 18 people, but need your help to get them there. 
The Allstars are currently around spot 160 of all WFTDA ranked teams in the world, but we believe we can do much better. The goal of this trip is to prove that.



What We Need

We are putting in lots of time and effort to make this trip happen, and are trying to put up events, have cake sales and sell special merchandise to gather funds for our long travel. We will still be relying on your support to make it happen.

This is what we have to raise money for:

  • Plane tickets
  • Rental cars
  • Hotels
In this fundraiser we are trying to raise 2.500 EUR/21.600 NOK/2.650 USD. It is not a huge amount, but it is an important piece of the budget. The fundraiser ends in the middle of May 2015.

Support us with 35 EUR and we will send you a one-of-a-kind Nidaros Allstars to Florida-tee, as well as a hand-written postcard!


The Impact

If we reach our goal, we will be able to cover all expenses for 2 (two) skaters.
If we reach 50% of our goal, we will be able to cover all expenses for 1 (one) skater.
If we reach 10% of our goal, we will have covered the hotel costs for 2 (two) skaters for the entire trip.

All contributions are highly appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That does not mean you can't help.

  • Share our Indiegogo fundraising page and video
  • "Like" our Facebook page and follow our Instagram (@nidarosrollerderby)
  • Show up at our home games
  • Buy merchandise at our web shop
  • Other ideas? Would you like to sponsor us? Get in touch with us at info(at)nidarosrollerderby.no


Thank you!

The Nidaros Roller Derby Allstars

story:
After decades of dreaming and 8 years of planning and permitting, the first backcountry hut on the world renowned Spearhead Traverse is close to becoming a reality. 

This summer, with your help, the Spearhead Huts Society will break ground on the first of 3 modern alpine huts linking the route and creating a year round adventure that will rival the classic hut-to-hut experiences offered in the Alps. In summer hiking and winter skiing will be greatly improved by access to these huts.

In order to break ground, the project needs a further $100,000 before Feb 1st to compliment a large and generous donation by the Kees Brenninkmeyer Foundation and other fundraising efforts we've made to date.

This is where you come in. By donating to this campaign, you can pre purchase hut nights, while also taking advantage of the other great gear rewards. Your donation will not only support the construction of the hut, but contribute to a rich alpine heritage here in Canada.

The first hut to be built will be the Kees & Claire Memorial Hut located at Russet Lake near the foot of the iconic Fissile Peak. 

On behalf of the Spearhead Huts Society, thank you for your support. Please share this video and a link to the campaign so that we can achieve the funding goal and begin to realize a world class hut to hut experience in the Whistler Backcountry. 

 

Guided Days and Ski with a Celeb

We know you want to get out there and what better way than having a local guide and legendary local skier with you? Local guides such as Brent Phillips, Chris Lawrence, Joe Schwartz and Simon Thomson have graciously donated their guiding services. By purchasing a day or overnight package you're guaranteed an amazing safe experience in Spearhead range. Another option is a day trip with a pro skier, like Eric Hjorleifson, this experience is guaranteed to up your level of stoke and performance to a whole new level.

 

Robin O'Neill Spearhead Prints

The landscapes throughout the Spearhead Traverse are jaw-dropping. We are thankful that the talented Robin O'Neill has donated some of her world-class photography to this campaign. For the two reward levels that include art prints from Robin O'Neill, you will be able to select from these gorgeous images below, as well as the Robin O'Neill images in the slideshow at the top of the page. 

The limited edition signed canvas print of one of Robin O'Neill's breathtaking images of the spearhead range is available as a 36" or 52" wide piece, depending on the donation level you choose. The image will be printed in fine art quality ink onto wallpaper canvas and mounted onto a 1.5" stretcher box. Resin is then hand poured onto the image. Price includes tax but not shipping.



 

See images at the top of the page for more options.

HUGE THANKS TO ARC'TERYX

We are incredibly excited to have Arc'teryx as a partner for this fundraising campaign. Their generosity and support for the project is invaluable. If we reach our targets at each reward level, they'll end up donating $30,000 worth of gear for you all to enjoy!

To claim this portion of the reward, we will email you a coupon code at the end of the campaign. You can redeem this coupon at the Arcteryx store in Whistler, BC on your next visit. 

The Arc'teryx Cierzo 18 Backpack is a bonus value that comes with the 4 night reward level. Get them while you can. Limited to first 150.


Arc'teryx toques are a bonus value that comes with the 2 night reward level. Get them while you can. Limited to first 250.


 

How Indiegogo works

Indiegogo is an internet platform which enables projects to accept online financial contributions. The principle on which crowdfunding rests is that it is possible to raise sizeable amounts of funds through a very large number of people donating small amounts of money.

You decide how much you want to pledge and choose an associated reward. When our campaign ends, IndieGoGo takes a 4% fee off the money we’ve raised. If we don't reach our goal, the fee is 9% (which is why it's very important that we reach our goal). Another 3% goes to money transfer fees. Every other dollar goes straight into building the hut.

 

CAMPAIGN FAQ's

Why is the Spearhead Huts Society doing this fundraiser?

After years of planning, permitting, and fundraising, we are at the final stretch to make the first of three huts a reality. As mentioned in the background information above, the project needs an additional $100,000 by February 1st 2017 in order to be able to proceed with construction this summer. 

What happens if you don't reach the $100,000 goal?

Alongside this Indiegogo campaign the Spearhead Huts Society will be hosting several fundraiser events as an additional channel to secure funding for the project. Unlike Kickstarter, this Indiegogo campaign does not require the goal to be met, so regardless of the total funds raised, all  proceeds will successfully go towards the project. But the more this campaign raises, the better chance of being able to build the first hut this summer. Thanks for your support!

Can I get a charitable donation tax receipt?

Not in this campaign since you're receiving a benefit. If you'd like to make a donation and get a charitable tax receipt in Canada or the United States get in touch with Andre Charland (andre.charland@gmail.com) on our fundraising committee.

How do I order order my Robin O'Neill print?

Once the campaign is complete we'll put you in touch with Robin and we'll sort out shipping, image choice etc...

How do I redeem the Arc'teryx gear? 

​See details above in the Arc'teryx section. 

How do I redeem my hut nights?

We'll follow up after the campaign once our booking system is live. At the end of the campaign, we will email you a coupon code for the number of hut nights that you donated for. These codes will work on the online booking system for the Kees & Claire Memorial Hut once the online booking system is configured and live in time for it's first operating season. 

When will the Kees and Claire Memorial Hut first open? 

We can't guarantee an opening date, but we are aiming to have it ready for next winter season, i.e. January 2018. 

Contact us with any other questions and we'll help you out. More info: http://www.spearheadhuts.org/contact/

SPEARHEAD HUT PROJECT DETAILS

For full details on the Spearhead Huts Project, please visit www.SpearheadHuts.org.

story:
Surviving In The Urban Jungle Just Got Easier!  Living in a rapid-paced urban metropolis can be really stressful, especially if you are constantly on-the-move. Now you can have a trusted sidekick that can help you organize and carry all your documents, devices and accessories effortlessly. And the best part? You will look super-cool too. Combining convenience with superior-quality materials, the Sopin Backpack is here to become the #1 accessory for modern, busy men! You will save your time, effort and above all, your peace of mind!

 

 

 

 

Designed with an eye for detail, the Sopin Backpack is the epitome of style and functionality. The high-quality, durable materials, will allow it to endure any abuse without skipping a beat. And the unique design will not only offer you unmatched comfort, but also you to protect your personal belongings and roam the city 100% carefree!

Think of your favourite supercar. Flashy and elegant on the outside and mighty on the inside. Well, our stunning and ergonomic urban backpack is the reincarnation of that supercar in the form of backpack.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Exterior: High quality polyester with water repellent coating
  • Interior: polyester
  • Zipper: YKK water repellent zipper
  • Size: 46 H x 28 W x 17 D cm (18" H x 11" W x 6.5" D)
  • Net Weight: 1.4 kg (3 lbs)
  • Capacity: 17.5 L

 

 
 

 

 

 

To make our unprecedented backpack project a reality, we’ll need your help with funding, but we’ll need something else, too—social promotion. From Facebook to Twitter, each and every one of us is active on at least on social network. Thank You!

 

 

 

Founded in 2016, Sopin Design is a design house based in the Victoria, Canada. The Sopin Team is composed of a team of talented and enthusiastic professionals. Our heart lies in creating original & functional products for affordable prices. We are passionate about bringing new ideas to market in a way they have never been experienced before.

 

As tooling and prototyping are all ready. What is left is to put the backpack into production. Although every project carries with certain risks (e.g. potential delays due to bad weather), with a team that has lots of experience, we are confident to reduce all risks within our control and deliver an outstanding product on schedule as we proceed to manufacturing.
story_txt:
Surviving In The Urban Jungle Just Got Easier!  Living in a rapid-paced urban metropolis can be really stressful, especially if you are constantly on-the-move. Now you can have a trusted sidekick that can help you organize and carry all your documents, devices and accessories effortlessly. And the best part? You will look super-cool too. Combining convenience with superior-quality materials, the Sopin Backpack is here to become the #1 accessory for modern, busy men! You will save your time, effort and above all, your peace of mind!    Designed with an eye for detail, the Sopin Backpack is the epitome of style and functionality. The high-quality, durable materials, will allow it to endure any abuse without skipping a beat. And the unique design will not only offer you unmatched comfort, but also you to protect your personal belongings and roam the city 100% carefree!Think of your favourite supercar. Flashy and elegant on the outside and mighty on the inside. Well, our stunning and ergonomic urban backpack is the reincarnation of that supercar in the form of backpack.                 
Exterior: High quality polyester with water repellent coating
Interior: polyester
Zipper: YKK water repellent zipper
Size: 46 H x 28 W x 17 D cm (18" H x 11" W x 6.5" D)
Net Weight: 1.4 kg (3 lbs)
Capacity: 17.5 L
 

 

 

 




 

 

To make our unprecedented backpack project a reality, we’ll need your help with funding, but we’ll need something else, too—social promotion. From Facebook to Twitter, each and every one of us is active on at least on social network. Thank You!   Founded in 2016, Sopin Design is a design house based in the Victoria, Canada. The Sopin Team is composed of a team of talented and enthusiastic professionals. Our heart lies in creating original & functional products for affordable prices. We are passionate about bringing new ideas to market in a way they have never been experienced before. As tooling and prototyping are all ready. What is left is to put the backpack into production. Although every project carries with certain risks (e.g. potential delays due to bad weather), with a team that has lots of experience, we are confident to reduce all risks within our control and deliver an outstanding product on schedule as we proceed to manufacturing.

story:
Have you ever dreamed of starting your own company or turning something you love to do into a business, only to be held back by lack of money to get started?  If you have, you know one of the largest challenges is funding to launch the idea into a business.  For those that have started a company, it may have been a difficult undertaking to leave the corporate world and start a new path in life, which reminds me of the Robert Frost poem, The Road Not Taken. 

 

The purpose of this campaign is to raise capital for a bicycle tour company, pre-sell tours and promotional items, and raise awareness of my company.  I’ve chosen The Road Not Taken as the name of the company because I think it represents the desire to make a choice and take a risk in life.  I also feel it’s appropriate since many times as bicyclists we look for roads that are not heavily travelled, where one can experience the people and unique sights of the areas we travel.

 

So what is a bicycle tour company?  How does it work?  What does fully-supported mean?

 

As a bicycle tour company, customers purchase a tour / vacation that typically lasts for 5-7 days to ride on bicycles from place to place. While experiencing the sights and points of interest in the region, tour guests stay overnight in the best local hotels and eat at top local restaurants.  Customers could be individuals traveling solo, couples, friends, families, or social/work groups.  Some customers bring their own bicycle but most use a tour company bicycle.

 

The tour company provides leaders on bicycles to guide the tour group turn-by-turn from start to finish each day and help if there are problems.  Being a fully-supported tour means the tour company is able to transport customers in a vehicle if they aren’t able to ride the daily distance due to fatigue, transport customer luggage throughout the tour, pre-arrange accommodations and meals each day, fix mechanical issues, provide drinks and snacks while riding, and any other logistics that make the customer experience memorable. 

 

As an example, I have planned a tour of the Erie Canal (about 350 miles from near Albany, NY to Buffalo, NY).  For this tour, we would ride a portion of the way each day while taking time to learn about the history of the Erie Canal, experience notable towns along the way, meet new people, and possibly try new foods too.  I have also planned a jam-packed, 3-day weekend tour of Charleston, SC offering customers the opportunity to bike to local attractions and experience many of the area highlights. I have created tour plans for three other areas in New York State, an epic New York – Canada tour, a South Carolina tour, and will add other States once launched.  The tours will be scheduled in Northern States during summers months and Fall, and in Southern States during non-summer months.

 

Who am I and what do I bring to this business? 

For much of my life, I’ve lived in New York State and have enjoyed biking in many areas of the “Upstate.”  I have been an avid and active bicyclist since 1991.  During that time, I’ve ridden over 50,000 miles including bike tours and 40+ fund-raising bike rides collecting many thousands of dollars for charities.  I often volunteered as a road leader for charity rides, to assist and guide other riders of varying ability while talking with participants to learn about them, why they ride, and why they supported the particular charity.

 

The feeling of adventure and excitement on a 25 mile ride as a 12-year-old with my best friend or the sense of accomplishment as an adult after completing a one-day, 145-mile solo ride never gets old.  I have always loved exploring new places by bike.  After moving to Charleston, SC almost two years ago, I continue to explore the Charleston, SC area, which has been voted one of the top cities to visit in the country with incredible history, amazing food, and places to see.  I’m thrilled to be turning my love of bicycling into a business that will allow me to experience the feeling of excitement and adventure that others have when discovering the new and interesting places we’ll take them.

 

In my career, I worked in the business world for over 30 years, including stints in sales, account management, project management, analytical roles in banking, and in my younger years customer service/hospitality/tourism.  I have a strong understanding of what it takes to provide detailed planning and attentive customer service, balanced with the financial acumen to manage a business.  I’m experienced with managing the details of a project, working with vendors, planning events, and keeping an eye on the budget; all of which are elements required to manage this business. 

 

I have performed market research to understand the competition and utilized that information to determine how to position the company in the market and what differentiators will set us apart.  During the process, I examined the daily details of what is required to provide a first-class customer experience.  All of the information went into creating a detailed 5-year business plan, which included examining legal and financial aspects of the business.  I am working with legal and tax accounting professionals, website developer, and marketing with the goal to be operational by July.

 

 

Contributions raised from this campaign will be used as follows (these goals include crowdfunding fees):

 

Foundational Goal = $15,680

  • $7,460 - Develop a web site with ability to accept credit card payments
  • $2,790 - Legal and tax consultation fees, business licensing, insurance
  • $4,490 – Marketing; Promotional items
  • $940 - Supplies, bike tools, and misc. costs
  • Under this option the business would rent a passenger van and trailer

 

Intermediate goal = $33,840

In addition to the above Foundational Goal use of funds, the business would be able to:

  • $2,630 - Apply a down payment to purchase a used 15 passenger van to transport customers and crew
  • $1,840 - Apply a down payment to purchase a used enclosed trailer to carry luggage, bikes, supplies; and modify it for this business purpose
  • $6,440 - Pay Insurance, licensing, taxes, and associated costs to purchase van and trailer
  • $3,520 - Strengthen web site SEO and CM, include additional tours
  • $3,730 - Expand marketing and branding

 

Stretch goal = $56,700

In addition to the above Intermediate Goal use of funds, the business would be able to:

  • $18,900 - Purchase 12 fully equipped, quality bicycles for customer use (including helmet, safety lights, bike computer, seat bag, mirror)
  • $3,950 - Purchase van and trailer with a larger down payment

 

If the campaign raises $33,840 or more by June 17, I will be able to purchase the passenger van and will volunteer to use the van to transport a local Boy Scout troop to a week long summer camp (300 miles away) at the end of June 2017 (they are currently searching for transportation options).  If in the future the van is not being used for a bicycle tour, I will offer the van as transportation for other Boy Scout camping trips.

 

If the campaign reaches the stretch goal of $56,700, I will be able to purchase a sufficient number of bicycles for customers so I would be in a position to offer an annual free tour to inner city kids to explore areas such as the historic Erie Canal, the Adirondack or Catskill mountains, or the Finger Lakes region.  This might be done in coordination with The Fresh Air Fund or similar program for kids.  I would also like to do this in Charleston and will continue to gather information.

 

Not only do I want to provide a high quality service by offering memorable, fun, outdoor vacation experiences for customers while promoting small local businesses, but it would be great to be in a position to help the organizations mentioned above.  Thanks so much for taking the time to visit this campaign.  Don’t hesitate to ask any questions you might have.  I would greatly appreciate your contribution to make this business a reality.  (Please note all perks will be delivered after the conclusion of the campaign.)

story:
Santa's Land USA is a small, family theme park in Putney, Vermont that opened 60 years ago in 1957.

Over the years Santa's Land had fallen on hard times. Now the property is scheduled to be back on track with new ownership so generations of children can experience what Santa's Land USA is all about; wholesome family fun in an atmosphere where the magic of Christmas can be experienced through the eyes of children and adults year round!

The property consist of a gift shop, saw mill, Igloo, Santa's Home,  Nativity, Snack & Sweet shop, train station, and much more.  After being closed for over 4 years, the property has fallen into disrepair. We need the help of others who would like to see this type of attraction thrive & not disappear as many have.

Contributions will fund necessary repairs, upgrades to the property to ensure that future  generations can experience Santa's Land USA & the Magic of Christmas!

Thank you and please share with others who may want to help.

story:
Inn The Trees

Have you ever wanted to spend the night in a tree house? Have you ever wanted to stay in an earthen dwelling like a hobbit? At Inn The Trees we want to make those dreams come true!

Inn The Trees is a place where fantastical ideas come true, especially for creators Joseph and Kathleen Vicars. As world travelers, they have been to many wonderful places and have met many interesting people.  Their adventures are what inspired them to share their love and passion of the outdoors. Inn The Trees will be a place for people to come together and re-establish their love of natural beauty and childlike wonder. The Vicars have a passion for bringing people together in natural environments and highlighting the uniqueness of the North Carolina Mountains.  

The dream began for the couple after many years of backpacking around the world. With a daydream that developed into a business plan, they set out in search for a suitable locale. After 5 years of dreaming, reworking the plan, and having many real estate heartbreaks, they finally found an amazing property complete with a mountainside, a beautiful stretch of forest and a tumbling, crystal-clear creek.  Since the purchase of the property, many hours, dollars and happy times have been put into preparing the land, with each step taking the Vicars closer to the amazing nature-inspired retreat that Inn The Trees is yearning to be.

Joseph and Kathleen have already invested over $50,000 of personal savings into the land preparation, plans, and ground work. Money is needed to finalize infrastructure and continue with construction. The $50,000 that is being asked for will aid in the construction of 3 treehouses, 4 earthen dwellings as well as the community bathhouse, kitchen, and lodge.The money will be put towards building supplies, labor, inspections and other costs related to construction endeavors. Whether the entire goal is met or not, the money will be put towards the completion of the project. 

A large portion of construction materials will be gathered from the local area. Lumber will be sourced and milled primarily from the property. Reclaimed wood is currently being gathered to help reduce waste and repurpose discarded materials. Water will be derived from a well on the property in addition to cisterns that will collect large amounts of rainfall each year. Electric energy for the resort will come from hydroelectric power, created by Hickory Nut Creek that flows through the property. Small wind turbines will be mounted on some structures and trees to harness the natural wind energy. Each rental unit will be equipped with a small woodburning stove to cozy up to in the cooler months. Concepts are currently coming together to use recycled plastic bottles and wrappers as insulation for structures. Progress is already being made on a garden facility on property that will grow organic vegetables, fruits, and herbs.Future plans also incorporate facilities for chickens, goats and potentially a trout farm.

Inn The Trees is located on a  beautiful 11-acre mountainside of old growth forest, with bold rock faces at the top and a large rushing creek at the bottom. There is currently a wood burning sauna and tire swing with plans for a wood-burning hot tub. Trails on the property lead you from a quick dip in the cool creek up through the forest to an overhanging cave and along the granite walls of Bear Wallow Mountain. There are many amenities nearby including the micro-brew capital of the USA, Asheville, NC, only 25 minutes away,  Lake Lure and Chimney Rock state park are 5 minutes down the street. The area is known worldwide for its amazing hiking and waterfalls; all in close proximity to Inn The Trees. 

Inn The Trees is a place for everyone to feel welcome. If you are unable to contribute you are encouraged to help by getting the word out there! Let people know what Inn The Trees is all about, hope that you will visit in the near future!

story:
This campaign is inspired from my brand new short- term goal to race in Megavalanche 2017. I am more than sure that with your support I will be able to do it!

More about me

I am downhill mountain biker for five years up till now and I am national champion in masters’ category for 2015. In 2016, because of a collarbone injury at the beginning of the season, I fought back the way the trauma allowed me to and  managed to stay in top 5 for the season. Currently I am a student in National Sports Academy Vasil Levski, trainer profile.

My nature is to accept brand new challenges! That’s why, one foggy day I tried the relatively new discipline, called enduro mountain bike. I had the chance to participate in enduro workshop leaded by the world champion Jerome Clementz in Borovetz Mountain Bike Park. …and #DownHellYeah, I’d love it! ….so the new idea was born… I decided to go without doubts to the rough downhill-enduro marathon called Megawalanche for the next competing season in 2017.

Where you will send me to race?

Megavalanche is a mountainbike downhill marathon style event since 1995. The most famous round is run from the French Alps town of Alpe D'Huez, starting on the glaciated summit of the Pic Blanc (3,330m) and descending to the lush meadows of the valley bottom at Allemont (720m), after some 2000 meters down and 30 km along, no matter the weather conditions, with mass start of 350 riders…. that’s event beyond my imagination! But hei, there is no but’s for the Butcher!

My country doesn’t provide funding for hardcore training preparation of my main sport downhill mountain biking, not even for such brand new discipline as enduro! And that situation urged me to work for this funding campaign. I will use the money for training racing camps, equipment, travel and accommodation expenses.

I have to admit I’ve never been so motivated to start something such new and challenging! I hope that with all your support along with my friends, family and campaign team help I can achieve it!

What I need

I need you! Lets together race in Megavalanche! To have the chance to race there is connected with a lot of expenses which I am looking to cover with your help in this campaign.

MegaEvent and MegaTraining needs

All sums in  US Dollars

Accommodation

300

Transportation

350

Insurance

100

Registration fee

170

Training camps + trainer

600

Enduro bike machine

3000

Components

600

Campaign perks and expenses

1100

Event photographer

400

Bike mechanic

380

TOTAL

7000

 

I would be forever grateful if you share and support my campaign and become and essential part of my jorney to its final destination Megavalanche. #DownHellYeah.

Other ways to support Milan to race in Megavalanche 2017

Beside financial support you can help Milan with a verbal support:

  • Shout out! Use the share tools and tell your friends about us and our project.
  • You could find Milan also at:

https://www.facebook.com/Milanstera

https://www.facebook.com/kasapakis800/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5kXAHbk0VAsto...

story:
Qui suis-je ?

Comme Nathalie célébrée par Gilbert Bécaud en 1962, j'étais sans doute prédestinée à guider les personnes à la découverte du patrimoine local. En effet, de nature curieuse, j'ai toujours fureté à la recherche de trésors méconnus pour agrémenter mes sorties sportives en pleine nature. Et c'est tout naturellement qu'à partir de 2005, j'ai eu envie de partager mes aventures culturelles et sportives avec des amis.

En 2008, j'ai franchi une étape en guidant des groupes, à pieds et à vélo, pour leur permettre de pratiquer leur activité favorite tout en découvrant la région parisienne, loin de la foule. Et ce sont les plus fidèles qui m'ont donné l'idée de professionnaliser cette activité en 2012. Mes expériences professionnelles ayant confirmé mes compétences administratives et commerciales, restait à concrétiser l'idée.

Mon projet

Après quelques années de maturation et une étude de marché approfondie, je souhaite lancer mon activité dans le secteur du slowtourisme en septembre 2018. Il s'agira de courts et moyens séjours (en gîtes, chambres d'hôtes et hôtels indépendants) et de circuits individuels ou packagés, tout d'abord en région Ile de France et limitrophes, et pays de la Loire. Plus qu'un projet professionnel, c'est un projet de vie, porté par des valeurs fortes, telles que le respect de l'environnement, le développement de l'économie en zone rurale, l'authenticité et le partage.

Les atouts de mon offre

  • hébergement et accueil par des acteurs locaux,
  • circuits en étoile, livrables en plusieurs formats,
  • assurance de découvrir le patrimoine régional d'intérêt,
  • possibilité de vivre des aventures au gré de ses envies.

Défis à relever

Atteindre un tel objectif est un réel défi. Le marché du tourisme en France est certes non délocalisable, mais les acteurs y sont nombreux ; je dois réussir à me démarquer, à me faire rapidement connaitre et à répondre positivement à la demande, sans pour autant renier mes valeurs.

Mon parcours professionnel m'a appris la prudence, et ma personnalité me porte à créer, organiser, mettre en oeuvre. A 50 ans passés, j'aspire plus que tout à vivre une vie qui me ressemble, tant personnelle que professionnelle. Sans votre aide, mon projet a peu de chance d'aboutir, mais avec vous, il a de forte chance de connaitre le succès. Alors... je compte sur vous !

A quoi servira la collecte ?

Pour lancer cette activité, j'ai besoin de financer la refonte totale de mon site et surtout, d'assurer rapidement son référencement sur le web. Cette étape est fondamentale pour la commercialisation de mes produits. Elle est donc décisive pour assurer le développement et la pérennité de mon activité.

Détail du budget

  • refonte du site web et personnalisation des applications : 9600€
  • recommandation et suivi du référencement SEO pendant 1 an : 11540€
  • commission de la plateforme : 1691€

Importance de votre rôle

Votre contribution témoignera de votre intérêt pour un tel projet et rassurera les banques, partenaires incontournables de toute entreprise. Elle participera au lancement de l'entreprise, qui prévoit par ailleurs d'embaucher 5 personnes dans les 4 ans. Grâce à vous, le maintien, voir le développement de l'économie des régions rurales sera favorisé dès la première année d'activité.  Enfin, vous donnez la possibilité à la fondatrice de réaliser un rêve sur lequel elle travaille depuis plus de 7 ans.

Si ce projet vous séduit, et que vous ne pouvez y participer financièrement, nul doute que vous avez des amis et relations avec lesquels vous pourrez partager cette information. Que ce soit ici, avec les outils de partage Indiegogo, ou sur vos propres réseaux sociaux, n'hésitez pas ! Il n'y a pas de publicité inutile !

Rappelez-vous ! La réussite de ce projet et l'atteinte des objectifs énoncés dépendent grandement de votre action. Alors maintenant, c'est à vous de jouer !

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Who am I ?

Like Nathalie celebrated by Gilbert Bécaud in 1962, I was undoubtedly predestined to guide people to discover the local heritage. Indeed, curious by nature, I have always searched for unknown treasures to enhance my sporting outings in the wilderness. And it is quite naturally that from 2005, I wanted to share my cultural and sporting adventures with friends.

In 2008, I took a step forward by guiding groups, on foot and by bike, to allow them to practice their favourite activity while discovering the Paris region, far from the crowd. And the most faithful of them gave me the idea of professionalizing this activity in 2012. My professional experiences having confirmed my administrative and commercial skills, remained to concretize the idea.

My project

After a few years of maturation and an in-depth market study, I wish to launch my business in the slowtourism sector in September 2018. These will be short and medium stays (in seasonal rental, guest rooms and independent hotels) and individual or packaged tours, first of all in the Ile de France and neighbouring regions, and Loire valley or Burgondy. More than a professional project, it is a life project, driven by strong values, such as respect for the environment, economical development in rural areas, authenticity and sharing.

Assets of my offer

  • accommodation and reception by local actors,
  • circuits organized around lodging, available in several formats,
  • insurance to discover the regional heritage of interest,
  • possibility to live adventures according to your desires.

Challenges ahead

Achieving such a goal is a real challenge. French tourism market is certainly important, but the actors are numerous there. So I must succeed in distinguishing my offer, to help my customers to find it easily and to respond positively to the demand, without denying my values.

My professional background has taught me caution, and my personality leads me to create, organize, implement. At 50 years old, I aspire more than anything to live a life that resembles me, both personal and professional. Without your help, my project has little chance of success, but with you, it has a strong chance of success. So... I'm counting on you!

What will the collection be used for ?

To launch this activity, I need to finance the total redesign of my actual website and especially, to quickly ensure its referencing on the web. This step is fundamental for the marketing of my products. It is therefore decisive to ensure the development and sustainability of my business.

Budget detail

  • of the website and customization of applications : 9600€
  • and follow-up of SEO referencing for 1 year : 11540€
  • platform commission : 1691€

Importance of your role

Your contribution will show your interest in such a project and will reassure the banks, essential partners of any company. She will participate in the launch of the company, which also plans to hire 5 people within 4 years. Thanks to you, the maintenance and even the development of the rural economy, will be promoted from the first year of activity.  Finally, you give the founder the opportunity to realize a dream she has been working on for over 7 years.

If this project appeals to you, and you cannot participate financially, no doubt you have friends and relationships with whom you will be able to share this information. Whether here, with Indiegogo sharing tools, or on your own social networks, do not hesitate ! There is no unnecessary advertising !

Remember ! The success of this project and the achievement of its stated objectives depend greatly on your action. So now, it is your turn to play !

story:
The concept of the Firemag was derived while watching the movie Castaway. The main character needed to create a fire and cut his hand trying to improvise a way to do so. I thought that if something like My Firemag existed, he would not have experienced the difficulties he did. 

The inspiration to move forward with the invention was by the memory of my mother, who had passed away and had a great deal of belief in me and my patent design.

My Firemag is a product designed to produce fire on demand. The device will be 2 inches long, about 3/4 inches wide and 1/2 to 3/4 inches thick. It will be shaped like a rectangle and will be concave to serve as a magnifier. 

The ease with which it can be carried and be anywhere on the user's person, My Firemag will be an invaluable tool for producing a flame when necessary. As long as there is sunlight, the magnifier on My Firemag will serve to create fire. 

Here is a prototype demo of the product making fire using nothing more that sunlight and flammable items.

story:
My name is Ray and, like many of you, I love to travel.  The only part about traveling that I do not enjoy is having to sit in a very uncomfortable seat in the Economy section of an airplane.

Recently, during a long flight sitting on what I would consider a "park bench," I remembered a self-inflating seat cushion that I had used on a camping trip.  I thought, “Man, I wish I had that seat with me right now!”  As I looked around the plane, I thought, “I bet the rest of these poor souls sitting here with me would love to have one as well.”

That was my "aha" moment.

That was the moment of inception for booty-rest.

Since then, my mission has been to create a product that will allow you and I to arrive at our destinations with the ability to still feel our "booties."  I have made great strides in accomplishing this mission, and once you receive your first booty-rest, I am confident that you will agree.

 

How Can You Help Support the Success of booty-rest?

We are reaching out to ask for your support in our efforts to make your air travel experiences more comfortable and enjoyable.

As you can see, the engineering is complete and the prototypes are made.  Now all we need is your help to raise the capital to begin full scale production of booty-rest.  If you are a flier in Economy and find your seat leaving you numb, please help us help you and thousands like you by funding our campaign today.

We are looking for a minimum of $24,000.00 to fund the initial booty-rest production run and to expand our marketing efforts to be able to bring booty-rest relief to others who may otherwise never know there is a more comfortable way to fly.

 

Funding Options

1. Straight Contribution

If you are not interested in receiving a booty-rest or a t-shirt but would like to help support the success of booty-rest, you can make a direct financial contribution by simply clicking the Back It button at the top right of this page.  All contributions are greatly appreciated!

2. Purchase The Perks

If you are interested in receiving a first edition booty-rest and a  "Don't be a numb ass!" t-shirt and would like to help support the success of booty-rest, you can purchase one or more of our Perks Packages located on the right side of this page.  All purchases are greatly appreciated!

 

Please Share and Support This Campaign

By backing the booty-rest campaign early, you will receive a discounted price of 26% off and the satisfaction of knowing the you helped bring booty-rest to the world.

Please help us spread the word about booty-rest by sharing our campaign with your friends, families, and colleagues either directly through Indiegogo or through your personal social media outlets.

Where will the funds go?

Funds from this campaign will be used to source the highest quality materials and manufacturing for booty-rest. The sooner we reach our goal, we will be able to place a volume order and get the product to you as soon as possible.

Who We Are

Everyone has heard about the difficulties and challenges that come with any start-up business,  as well as the challenges of introducing a new product to the world.  The members of our team are experienced business owners who have started many successful businesses from scratch.  With your help, there is nothing that we cannot accomplish or overcome!

​"Together we can bring back the cushion and comfort that the airlines have taken away."

Thank you for your faith and support,

The booty-rest Team

story:
New campaign here

Have you ever tried to find a liveaboard in a destination which suits your travel dates? What about matching those dates to the Manta Ray season? Difficult isn't it.

Well, Pelagic Dive Travel solves those issues!

My name is Terry Smith and I have been diving for over 16 years, 14 of those years as an active Dive Instructor. Pelagic Dive Travel was born out of my frustration, I just couldn't match a trip to my dates and to what I wanted to see, so Pelagic Dive Travel (PDT) was created.

How does the platform work?

With an ease of search by Marine species or type of trip ( we have Manta Rays, Whalesharks, Environmental/ Scientific, Shark - Cage Diving, Specialized - Photography, and more) you can match it to the dates of your travel, book, pay and get an instant confirmation.

So our search is unique, but so is our checkout. Any booking can be for one or two divers or we have an option for the Diver & Non-diver. The checkout is created so you choose your Liveaboard, then add any before or after accommodation, any transfers to/ from the airport to hotel & from the marina. This applies to Dive Resorts and Resorts, with the difference being you choose the nights you wish to stay, add the number of dives or days of diving, any meal options, transfers, and if your partner is a non-diver any spa treatments. This means that you can go into remote areas and know everything is taken care of.

PDT has contracts in place with all Liveaboards, Dive Resorts, and Resorts listed. We only source reliable, quality and safe operators. 

The Galapagos Aggressor  

How can you help?

Your contribution today will help us tidy the website and allow us to grow.

Our Perks are savings vouchers with a higher value than the purchase. This means you SAVE on your next dive trip anywhere in the world!

We are based in Australia which means we can only offer AUD. But, our suppliers are global so this changes for different currencies. For example, $150AUD savings voucher can be used on any booking $1600AUD or over, for any USD booking $1500USD or over, the $150AUD voucher is a $120USD voucher and for any EUR booking 1500EUR or over, the $150AUD voucher is a 100EUR savings voucher. This voucher is one per booking, no expiry and can be used on any of our website listed Liveaboards, Dive Resorts or Resorts, anywhere in the world. (If you have a favorite Liveaboard or Dive Resort, and it's not listed on our website contact us, and we will try to list it for you - we don't want you to miss out). This is a HUGE saving on any booking!

Or you could purchase a t-shirt. 100%cotton and shipped for free any where in the world!

Our goal is $25,000. This will allow PDT to tidy the website, make it flow, hire a person to help enter new dive operators and really drive the marketing.

How will this be used, you ask, well, $15,000 on the website, $7,000 for a new employee, and $3000 on marketing. If we do not make the goal we would use the funds for the website and marketing, and unfortunately, look at a new employee further down the track. Without the employee, we will just be a bit slower in loading new products.

The Company

Pelagic Dive Travel will be the leading Independent online Dive Travel agency, as we support the smaller dive operators and care about the Marine Environment.

Pelagic Dive Travel is a company based in Australia. We meet all local law requirements to operate as a Travel Agency and we have all the necessary insurance in place.

We have just launched our test website. 

Pelagic Dive Travel has recently completed the Slingshot Horizons Accelerator Program - an accelerator program for Tourism company's in Queensland Australia ( follow the link for our final pitch video). The selection process is hard as there were many applicants. 

Our future

Pelagic Dive Travel is passionate about education & preservation, of the marine environment.

Our future goal is charter liveaboards next year which travel into remote areas with a clear focus on the environment - how can we educate locals, local communities, and divers, about how caring for the marine environment, making it thrive and grow, but also making it sustainable for the local communities to still live from it now and in the future. With your help, we can start this!

Please share the link to any other SCUBA Divers, and make a saving on your next dive trip today!

Without the employee, we will just be a bit slower in loading new products.The CompanyPelagic Dive Travel will be the leading Independent online Dive Travel agency, as we support the smaller dive operators and care about the Marine Environment.Pelagic Dive Travel is a company based in Australia. We meet all local law requirements to operate as a Travel Agency and we have all the necessary insurance in place.We have just launched our test website. Pelagic Dive Travel has recently completed the Slingshot Horizons Accelerator Program - an accelerator program for Tourism company's in Queensland Australia ( follow the link for our final pitch video). The selection process is hard as there were many applicants. Our futurePelagic Dive Travel is passionate about education & preservation, of the marine environment.Our future goal is charter liveaboards next year which travel into remote areas with a clear focus on the environment - how can we educate locals, local communities, and divers, about how caring for the marine environment, making it thrive and grow, but also making it sustainable for the local communities to still live from it now and in the future. With your help, we can start this!Please share the link to any other SCUBA Divers, and make a saving on your next dive trip today!

story:
Short Summary
 

I’m in the process of setting up accommodation for backpackers and travelers, furnished and decorated using recycled and donated materials. There is far too much waste in the world and it’s my goal to draw attention to this issue and reduce waste! I also want to create a home-base for travelers to explore the amazing city of Jumunjin, South Korea.

 

Until we get fully operational, we need help to keep maintaining funding. By donating, you’ll not only be contributing to a worthy cause but reserving your bed for a future stay at Re-Do.

 


 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Re-Do needs to exist for two reasons: to help raise awareness about the environment and waste in Korea and worldwide, and to provide travelers in the Jumunjin area a home-base to explore since accommodations for international travelers are super limited here.

 

After several years of travelling, I was shocked to see the amount of avoidable waste that occurs in seemingly every country on Earth. All over the world, people take unwanted but otherwise functional items and doom them to a life in landfill where they will sit, sometimes for centuries. But nowhere is this problem more visible than in Korea where any waste is left by the roadside for all to see before being collected a few days per week. Walking down any street will see you stroll past tables, sofas, old style TVs, suitcases, and parasols. All slightly broken, damaged or faded but completely repairable and beautiful in their own way.

 

My vision is to draw attention to this wasteful system and to help in reducing the amount of unwanted items which are destined to sit in landfill, whilst providing fun and affordable accommodation to backpackers and travelers from around the world.


Jumunjin the small fishing town of South Korea at the east coast

The Re-Do project’s first establishment is located in the stunningly beautiful seaside town of Jumunjin, with the hostel itself directly overlooking the East Sea. Jumunjin is known for its beautiful beaches and traditional fish market. Take a stroll through the streets with the smell of sea salt filling the air. Merchants sell the latest and tastiest catch of the day and you can stop in for a perfectly crafted coffee in Korea’s most famous region for exquisitely crafted beverages.

If that isn’t quite your speed, take a dip in the East Sea from Jumunjin’s divine white sand beach. Or, hop on a bus to the Odaesan national park (less than one hour away) where during summer you can hike through pristine forest littered with temples and waterfalls. In the winter, same national park contains the town of PyeongChang, home of the 2018 Winter Olympics. Grab your ski’s and hit the slopes!





 

Traveler's Art Project

We’re also decorating the hostel with hand-made art, all created by our wonderful volunteers. The art they design will stock our art store and everything is made from recycled materials found or donated in the community.  When an artist makes a piece, it will decorate the hostel until someone comes along who wants to buy it. Then the money made from the art will go back toward the artist, wherever they are in the world.

Art work from Kate from England. 
from piece of Pallet




Art Work from Sara from Morroco
about air polloution.
ReDo backpackers sometimes joining the protest against local Coal Power Plant Plan. 



 


Art works from Lara from Italy. (3 p blue pan works)
 Emma from France (welcome jumunjin work)




Kasia from Poland "She's got anyone's get"





Mai's work from Argentina




Art work from Sara from Morroco



Sarah from USA & India from Australia
Recycled bottle cap sea and straw fish

Sarah from USA 
Sea Mandara









What I need funds for:

 

That brings us to the financial side of things, and why I set up this in the first place.

 

So far, the project is going well, but like all new businesses there are growing pains which are putting it in danger of failure. We’re running into investment problems, building maintenance difficulties, rent woes, and funding issues which unfortunately can’t all be fixed by volunteers or recycled materials.

I set this ReDo backpacker's hostel only with 2000 USD. 
The deposit is 30,000 and it is not paid yet. 
To keep this project going, We need your help with some fundrasing!

 

Any generously donated funding for our project will go toward these things:

  • Building rental and deposit costs
  • Full time staff wages (for positions which cannot be carried out by our kind volunteers)
  • Building maintenance costs
  • Food stuffs (to keep our volunteers happy and healthy)

 

By donating to our project, your funding doesn’t just get lost in the system. You will be, in effect, reserving your bed for a future trip to the Re-Do project. Any sized donation is greatly appreciated, however any donation of $25 USD reserves you a night in the Re-Do hostel for any point in the future. Are you planning a trip to Korea in one, two, even TEN years? Reserve your bed now whilst helping out a worthy cause in the process. Thanks in advance for all your help, and I can’t wait to see you in Jumunjin!

story:
About the Inn

Over the past few years, my partner and I have traveled to several different countries. During these trips, we discovered that the most special and unique experiences were brought on by staying in smaller, independent accommodations. 

Which is how my dream of opening a bed and breakfast came to be.

The Storybook Inn combines my passions for reading, hospitality, and dogs. I anticipate operations to begin on April 1st, 2020. My plan is to renovate a historic home located in Minneapolis or St. Paul. We will provide high-quality accommodation and full breakfast for both tourist and business customers alike. Accommodations will consist of five to seven dog-friendly, comfortably-furnished rooms, each with queen-sized beds. Full breakfast will be served.

The region in and around the Twin Cities has beautiful scenery, numerous places of interest, dog parks, and activities. Guests will have many opportunities to enjoy themselves in this area that is well-suited for getaway holidays.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking funds to assist with property purchase, renovations, furnishings, and initial operating costs. If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds will still go toward the inn, as any amount will help! Different perks of the contributors are:

  • Mention on the website
  • A paw-trait of your pup on the wall
  • A one-night complimentary stay
  • A complimentary massage from our contracted massage therapist
  • A five-day daycare pass
  • A $400.00 gift certificate from The Storybook Inn
  • A weekend retreat

Perks for the Pups

The Storybook Inn won't stop at simply being dog-friendly. My plans also include:

  • An elegant wash station for owners to use any time they please
  • A large fenced-in yard
  • A small daycare area where owners may leave their fur children while they're exploring the Twin Cities
  • Concierge service for any pup crated in the guest suite 

The Impact

Not only will The Storybook Inn offer comfort to those traveling with pets—for whom options are often limited—but as my partner and I are both avid fosters, we would like to donate a small percentage of our profits toward Spot's Last Stop, a 501(c)(3) non-profit canine rescue located in the Twin Cities. This rescue matches local families with homeless canines in need of forever homes by following an adoption process that is easy and fair to adopt a homeless dog in need.

What Else You Can Do

Please help spread the word and share this campaign with your friends, family, and other like-minded small business lovers. And remember, as long as we have dogs by our side… anything is paw-sible!​

Thank you so much for your support!
