story:
Original EverRatchet Campaign HERE - Backed by >4,500 Backers

 

Current Shipping Status

All New InDemand Domestic Orders: Currently shipping in 0-2 business days

All New InDemand International Orders: Currently shipping in 2-5 business days*

*Typically faster but we use a third-party facility that currently has limited staff to practice proper social distancing.

 

Our Blister Packaging Machine

Cooling Off After The Packaging Machine

 

World’s First Ratchet Keychain Tool

Back and Better Than Ever

We have shipped 11,500+ units of our first EverRatchet to 100+ countries. Thanks to the Indiegogo community, this unique tool has become a part of many individual's everyday carry. 

While we are extremely proud of the original EverRatchet, we know how important it is to our community to continuously innovate and improve.  You asked. We Listened. Based on your feedback we have added new features to EverRatchet that we think you will really enjoy. 

 

Our First EverRatchet Campaign

I am Brian Filko, a mechanical engineer/entrepreneur from Pennsylvania back for my 6th crowdfunding campaign. I have carried many different types of multitools on my keys over the years and have always been frustrated with their ability to tighten and loosen screws.  The constant lifting and repositioning of these tools/bits to only get a quarter turn makes these multitools generally impractical for most common fixes. I decided to channel my frustrations by designing a dynamic ratchet so you don't need to lift and reposition the tool between each turn on your small and large fixes. 

     

    The Ratchet Feature

    We created a one-of-a-kind dynamic ratchet beam that holds the bit in place while turning but flexes to allow the tool to rotate back to its starting position. To tighten a screw, put the bit into the ratchet and turn it back and forth like a normal ratchet.  To loosen a screw, just flip the tool over and rotate in the other direction. 

    .

    Left Image: Tighten, Right Image: Loosen

     

    Updates and Changes

    On EverRatchet Clip we have made upgrades in the following areas: 

    • New All-Metal Design with Bit Holding Side Catches
    • Main Body Upgraded to Grade 5 Titanium
    • New Pocket Clip, More Ways to Carry
    • Improved Bottle Opener
    • Ratchet Max Torque Increased
    • Tighter Fit Keeps the Bit in Place

     

    New All-Metal Design with Bit Holding Side Catches

    We really wanted to make EverRatchet Clip as minimalistic as possible. We accomplished this by removing the two bands which held the bit in place on the first tool. The side catches paired with the flexible dynamic beam are engineered to apply just the right amount of force to keep the bit in place but allow easy removal when needed.

    The bit being removed and replaced. The dynamic ratchet beam pushes down on the bit while the side catches ensure it is cradled and securely held in place.

     

     

    Main Body Upgraded to Grade 5 Titanium

    We are upping our game and moving from grade 2 to the highly desired grade 5 titanium.

     

    New Pocket Clip, More Ways to Carry

    The addition of a pocket clip allows you to easily hook the tool on to your pants, bag or add to your keychain. The no pass channel on the pocket clip was designed to ensure the keyrings do not pass through it to give you an alternative way to carry,

     

    Improved Bottle Opener

    We have made it easier to seat the tool on a variety of corner case bottle caps by increasing the radii on the leading and increasing the angle of the attack allow a better grip and additional leverage.

     

    Ratchet Max Torque Increased 

    With the upgrade to grade 5 titanium, we have increased the rated torque for the ratchet feature by 25% up to 25 in-lbs. Need additional torque? Use the static 1/4" wrench feature to loosen a stubborn screw and then swap over to the ratchet to complete the task.

     

    Tighter Fit Keeps the Bit in Place

    Based on customer feedback, we have improved the design to make sure the bit does not slip out of the tool when reaching into a hard to access area.

     

    Additional Tools

    Equip yourself with a 1/4" ratchet, pry bar, 7 wrenches, bottle & box opener, scraper, Phillips screwdriver, flat head screwdriver and more:

     

    Current EverRatchet Customers

    “Recently received my EverRatchet and am blown away by the quality. Usefulness only limited by my imagination. Quality. Quality. Quality.” - Dave C.

    “Click Click Click…I don’t know how I got by without one of these before, already helped me open a couple of boxes & adjust my brakes and bars and take a seat off my bike.” - Tim R.

    “Took my gold one with me to the woods this weekend, used it to make small screw adjustments to the mountain bike and to open that much-needed beer at the end of the day.” - Paul W.

    “I’d like to say a big THANK YOU to the whole team there for a fantastic product. It looks great, a conversation starter even, and they feel solid and great quality. Really pleased with them.” – Richard W.

    “I’ve received mine last week and couldn’t be happier with my purchase. It is top quality, and works exactly as described. I’d recommend this to any handyman or gadget junkie” – Frank F.

    “I got it yesterday and it's already come in handy, I'm an appliance technician and the front panel of a washing machine was blocked by uneven flooring. The head of my go-to quarter-inch ratchet was too far but the EverRatchet fit just right! Thanks guys!” - Michael B.

    “Got mine yesterday and used it multiple times since. Great little pocket tool! Well thought out. Brian is service driven to, nothing but good to say about the product and the service of this company” – Justin G.

    “Nice feel in the hand, nice construction. Laser engraving is sharp and good looking.” - Samuel S.

    “Just got mine in South Korea. Excellent quality. I've already used it 3 times since I got it. I just have to remember all the things it can do Lol” - Daniel M.

     

    Specs and Dimensions

     

    TSA and EverRatchet Clip

    The blade about as thick as a dime, making it less sharp than a knife, This allows you to fly with your EverRatchet without running into security issues.

     

    A High-Quality Manufacturing Process

    Our sleek design may look simple but the manufacturing process is anything but. To achieve the level of precision needed to meet our high quality and engineering standards we use a complex manufacturing process.

     

    Below we detail out all the steps the tool goes through to be transformed from raw titanium into the EverRatchet Clip:

     

    Wire Electrical Discharge Manufacturing (EDM) - A high-precision robot moves an electrified wire electrode about the diameter of a human hair through several sheets of titanium which causes the surrounding metal to vaporize leaving a cut in the metal. The path is takes is specified by the engineering models and drawings. This process is used to cut the outline of the tool body, to cut the interior static ¼” driver and dynamic driver areas.  Then the tool is repositioned on its side to cut the box opener/score tool.

    Sinker EDM -  To create the side catches we added second EDM process. A high-precision robot pulses an electrified pad into inner wall of the tool. This vaporizes the metal under the cut-out for the side catches to create the space for the bit to be secured under the catch. The position and depth of the feature is specified by the engineering models and drawings.

    Tumbling -  The tools are then placed in a vibrating bowl filled with deburring media to remove the sharp edges on metal parts.

    Blasting - Next, a machine applies our special glass blast finish. This process is used to apply the surface finish to the tool. EverRatchet Clip will be featuring our latest glass applied finish to keep it nice and new every time you reach for it.

    Lasering -  Finally, a CNC gantry laser etches graphics on to the tool. This process is used to apply the EverRatchet Clip name and functional markings to the tool

    Assembly/Packaging - We do a final inspection prior to packaging the unit with a blister-packaging machine.

    The Final Result

    Left: Current Shipping EverRatchet in Packaging

    Right: EverRatchet Clip in Proposed Packaging. Plastic will be updated to contour the EverRatchet Clip tool and cardboard surround will be professionally printed.

     

    Featured On

    PRESS/MEDIA KIT

     

    Comments on Past Campaign Management

    We know that there are certain concerns around transparency, communication, and delivering on crowdfunding campaigns. We think it is important to share some reviews we have received in the past to further emphasize the importance we place on keeping our backers updated. You are putting your monetary trust in us and it is our goal to make sure that you know exactly where we are in the delivery process.

    “This has been the most professional IGG campaign I’ve participated in. Thanks for doing it right!” - Josh G.

    I’ve backed nearly a hundred crowdfunded campaigns over the last six years and this is, by far, the best-run one I’ve backed. I wish that some of the radio-silent creators I’m still waiting on would take to heart Brian’s approach to communicating what’s going on, as in update #9. (And, of course, that things appear to be going really well doesn’t hurt matters… ;)” – Andy D.

    “Reordered.  Just wanted to let you know, I’ve contributed to over 10 Indiegogo campaigns.  You were by far the best in terms of communication and project management.”  – Mike P.

    “Not only a great product you are providing, but also formidable campaign management. I encouraged everyone I know with interest in such tools to support the campaign. Again, thank you very much for such a great tool.” – Manuel T.

    “This is staying on my key ring forever! Overall this has been the BEST run campaigns on Indiegogo. Brian is simply fantastic! He’s the gold standard for developers and campaigners. There are many who could learn from him.” – Anand J.

    “The quality of this tool is very nice and it will definitely fit in well with my EDC. Thanks for showing good production, operation and delivery standards.” – John W.

    “3 HUGE, LOUD CHEERS for Brian and family on the wonderful progress! Thank you all for your commitment, long hours of hard work, and vision. You’re creating a support useful tool for EDC.” – Dean W.

    "You are the exemplar in how to run an Indiegogo campaign. If the ratchets arrive on time, this will restore my faith on crowdfunding. Great communication, very professional!” – Theray W.

     

    Shipping and In-Depth Campaign Updates

    On our previously funded campaigns, we have started shipped anywhere from On Time to 1.5 weeks ahead of schedule. We make our timelines honest, transparent, and realistic to ensure that we deliver on our promises. We provide extremely clear and concise updates throughout the entire manufacturing process to ensure that you are aware of what is going on behind the scenes. We understand the investment and trust you have made by backing us and believe that you should be involved in the process along the way.

     

    Custom Lasering

    Looking for 10x or more custom branded EverRatchet Clip Tools? Reach out to us via Indiegogo messages or contact@GearInfusion.com to get a visual of your logo on our tool. We can set up a secret perk up for you!

    Above is a rendering/approval image showing the GTUK logo and name

     

    Please Help Us Spread the Word

    We are working hard to get our project out there but if you can help us share it could make all the difference in bringing EverRatchet Clip to life.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    Keeping on track with the timeline is our main goal. We have a great relationship with our vendors but as always there can be manufacturing delays or unforeseen issues. We will be working closely with all our vendors during production to minimize the chance of any issues. We have delivered all our past funded crowdfunded projects on time and plan to do the same for this project as well!

    Please Note:

    The term "EverRatchet" is a Registered Trademark belonging to Gear Infusion/Concept 180, LLC

    The term “Gear Infusion” is a Registered Trademark belonging to Gear Infusion/Concept 180, LLC

    The EverRatchet design is patent pending

Need additional torque? Use the static 1/4" wrench feature to loosen a stubborn screw and then swap over to the ratchet to complete the task. Tighter Fit Keeps the Bit in PlaceBased on customer feedback, we have improved the design to make sure the bit does not slip out of the tool when reaching into a hard to access area. Additional Tools Equip yourself with a 1/4" ratchet, pry bar, 7 wrenches, bottle & box opener, scraper, Phillips screwdriver, flat head screwdriver and more: Current EverRatchet Customers“Recently received my EverRatchet and am blown away by the quality. Usefulness only limited by my imagination. Quality. Quality. Quality.” - Dave C.“Click Click Click…I don’t know how I got by without one of these before, already helped me open a couple of boxes & adjust my brakes and bars and take a seat off my bike.” - Tim R.“Took my gold one with me to the woods this weekend, used it to make small screw adjustments to the mountain bike and to open that much-needed beer at the end of the day.” - Paul W.“I’d like to say a big THANK YOU to the whole team there for a fantastic product. It looks great, a conversation starter even, and they feel solid and great quality. Really pleased with them.” – Richard W.“I’ve received mine last week and couldn’t be happier with my purchase. It is top quality, and works exactly as described. I’d recommend this to any handyman or gadget junkie” – Frank F.“I got it yesterday and it's already come in handy, I'm an appliance technician and the front panel of a washing machine was blocked by uneven flooring. The head of my go-to quarter-inch ratchet was too far but the EverRatchet fit just right! Thanks guys!” - Michael B.“Got mine yesterday and used it multiple times since. Great little pocket tool! Well thought out. Brian is service driven to, nothing but good to say about the product and the service of this company” – Justin G.“Nice feel in the hand, nice construction. Laser engraving is sharp and good looking.” - Samuel S.“Just got mine in South Korea. Excellent quality. I've already used it 3 times since I got it. I just have to remember all the things it can do Lol” - Daniel M. Specs and Dimensions TSA and EverRatchet ClipThe blade about as thick as a dime, making it less sharp than a knife, This allows you to fly with your EverRatchet without running into security issues. A High-Quality Manufacturing ProcessOur sleek design may look simple but the manufacturing process is anything but. To achieve the level of precision needed to meet our high quality and engineering standards we use a complex manufacturing process. Below we detail out all the steps the tool goes through to be transformed from raw titanium into the EverRatchet Clip: Wire Electrical Discharge Manufacturing (EDM) - A high-precision robot moves an electrified wire electrode about the diameter of a human hair through several sheets of titanium which causes the surrounding metal to vaporize leaving a cut in the metal. The path is takes is specified by the engineering models and drawings. This process is used to cut the outline of the tool body, to cut the interior static ¼” driver and dynamic driver areas.  Then the tool is repositioned on its side to cut the box opener/score tool.Sinker EDM -  To create the side catches we added second EDM process. A high-precision robot pulses an electrified pad into inner wall of the tool. This vaporizes the metal under the cut-out for the side catches to create the space for the bit to be secured under the catch. The position and depth of the feature is specified by the engineering models and drawings. Tumbling -  The tools are then placed in a vibrating bowl filled with deburring media to remove the sharp edges on metal parts. Blasting - Next, a machine applies our special glass blast finish. This process is used to apply the surface finish to the tool. EverRatchet Clip will be featuring our latest glass applied finish to keep it nice and new every time you reach for it.Lasering -  Finally, a CNC gantry laser etches graphics on to the tool. This process is used to apply the EverRatchet Clip name and functional markings to the toolAssembly/Packaging - We do a final inspection prior to packaging the unit with a blister-packaging machine.The Final ResultLeft: Current Shipping EverRatchet in PackagingRight: EverRatchet Clip in Proposed Packaging. Plastic will be updated to contour the EverRatchet Clip tool and cardboard surround will be professionally printed. Featured OnPRESS/MEDIA KIT Comments on Past Campaign ManagementWe know that there are certain concerns around transparency, communication, and delivering on crowdfunding campaigns. We think it is important to share some reviews we have received in the past to further emphasize the importance we place on keeping our backers updated. You are putting your monetary trust in us and it is our goal to make sure that you know exactly where we are in the delivery process.“This has been the most professional IGG campaign I’ve participated in. Thanks for doing it right!” - Josh G.I’ve backed nearly a hundred crowdfunded campaigns over the last six years and this is, by far, the best-run one I’ve backed. I wish that some of the radio-silent creators I’m still waiting on would take to heart Brian’s approach to communicating what’s going on, as in update #9. (And, of course, that things appear to be going really well doesn’t hurt matters… ;)” – Andy D.“Reordered.  Just wanted to let you know, I’ve contributed to over 10 Indiegogo campaigns.  You were by far the best in terms of communication and project management.”  – Mike P.“Not only a great product you are providing, but also formidable campaign management. I encouraged everyone I know with interest in such tools to support the campaign. Again, thank you very much for such a great tool.” – Manuel T.“This is staying on my key ring forever! Overall this has been the BEST run campaigns on Indiegogo. Brian is simply fantastic! He’s the gold standard for developers and campaigners. There are many who could learn from him.” – Anand J.“The quality of this tool is very nice and it will definitely fit in well with my EDC. Thanks for showing good production, operation and delivery standards.” – John W.“3 HUGE, LOUD CHEERS for Brian and family on the wonderful progress! Thank you all for your commitment, long hours of hard work, and vision. You’re creating a support useful tool for EDC.” – Dean W."You are the exemplar in how to run an Indiegogo campaign. If the ratchets arrive on time, this will restore my faith on crowdfunding. Great communication, very professional!” – Theray W. Shipping and In-Depth Campaign UpdatesOn our previously funded campaigns, we have started shipped anywhere from On Time to 1.5 weeks ahead of schedule. We make our timelines honest, transparent, and realistic to ensure that we deliver on our promises. We provide extremely clear and concise updates throughout the entire manufacturing process to ensure that you are aware of what is going on behind the scenes. We understand the investment and trust you have made by backing us and believe that you should be involved in the process along the way. Custom LaseringLooking for 10x or more custom branded EverRatchet Clip Tools? Reach out to us via Indiegogo messages or contact@GearInfusion.com to get a visual of your logo on our tool. We can set up a secret perk up for you!Above is a rendering/approval image showing the GTUK logo and name Please Help Us Spread the WordWe are working hard to get our project out there but if you can help us share it could make all the difference in bringing EverRatchet Clip to life. Risks & ChallengesKeeping on track with the timeline is our main goal. We have a great relationship with our vendors but as always there can be manufacturing delays or unforeseen issues. We will be working closely with all our vendors during production to minimize the chance of any issues. We have delivered all our past funded crowdfunded projects on time and plan to do the same for this project as well!Please Note:The term "EverRatchet" is a Registered Trademark belonging to Gear Infusion/Concept 180, LLCThe term “Gear Infusion” is a Registered Trademark belonging to Gear Infusion/Concept 180, LLCThe EverRatchet design is patent pending

story:
Stealth stealing is a very widespread issue. Your bag is a target of choice for thieves and they won't hesitate to snatch it if they get a chance to. Because a second of inattention is all it takes to lose everything, Loopit protects your bag absolutely everywhere.  

 

 

 

 

Thanks to LOOPIT, you can protect your bag in under 3 seconds. Your belongings are protected from theft and you can focus on what really matters.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A thieve that would try to snatch your bag would have to get ready for a BIG and well-deserved surprise. Don't underestimate their ability to steal your bag discreetly even in your presence. They are smart but you can be smarter and one step ahead.  

 

 

 

This awesome patented buckle locks one way and opens another. It is robust and highly reliable. You will also love its very satisfying clicking sound.

 

 

 

The safety lock developed by Loop with another French company makes sure the buckle is always securely fasten. It is a 3D printed part designed to perfectly fit the Fidlock buckle. It is made of extremely strong PETG, a material known to be very resistant and durable. 


 

 

 

 

You just have to push down the notch to lock the buckle completely or to lift it to unlock it. Its lateral slide opening makes it not so easy to open at first if you don't know how to.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Dyneema®  fiber is produced in a patented gel spinning process which leads to molecular alignment, high crystallization, and low density. Not only is it very lightweight, it is 15 times stronger than steel on a weight to weight basis and 40% stronger than Kevlar. 

 

 

 

 

 

This little habit can prevent the nightmare of being stolen. The compact format of LOOPIT makes it easy to carry everywhere you go and to protect all your belongings. 

 

 

This little habit can prevent the nightmare of being stolen. The compact format of LOOPIT makes it easy to carry everywhere you go and to protect all your belongings. 

 

 

You can also carry LOOPIT on your backpack. It is an easy way to always have it ready to protect it.  

 

 

 

 

You can read the following articles to better realize how fast it happens:  '$8000 In Camera Gear Stolen From Photographer' by 3KSN, 'How I Had My Gear and 3 Months of Photos Stolen in One Brief Moment' by Petapixel and 'My Bag Was Stolen In Germany' by Bucketlistly.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you suffer from back pain, LOOPIT allows you to relieve your shoulders without having to bend over to put it on the floor or take it back. It's also great to keep your bag clean!  

 

 

 

 

Looking for your camera, your tripod or something else ? Just loop it and find it. Your device can handle heavy weights and won't let you down.  

 

 

 

 

 

Visiting tourist sites and carrying a bag are both factors that substantially increase the probability of being stolen. LOOPIT is about helping you enjoy instead of worrying.

story:
Meet Optimus.

Premium hard-case luggage that costs a fraction of what most companies charge. And don’t worry, we never skimp on quality. Ever. We’ve sourced the best materials and most well-equipped manufacturer to create a durable piece of luggage that is timeless in both design and function. We’re here to transform your travel experience for the better. 

This is our promise.

Seriously. Check, check, check...

We asked. You told us.

We surveyed hundreds of travelers about what features matter most when it comes to luggage. This is what you wanted – plus top quality and value, of course – so that’s exactly what we’re giving you.

Scratch-Resistant Polycarbonate Shell

Impact and scratch-resistant hard shell made from 100% pure polycarbonate. It’s as durable as it gets, while still being ultra-lightweight. 

TSA-Approved Lock

All Optimus suitcases come with a secure TSA-approved lock system for added security and peace of mind during your travels.

360-Degree Hinomoto Wheels

No matter how far, fast or long you’re traveling with your Optimus, our 360-degree Hinomoto wheels will take you there effortlessly. Widely regarded as the best in the industry – these wheels simply don't exist on luggage under $250. Except for ours.

Adjustable Handle System

Customizable trolley handle easily extends and locks to accommodate people of different heights.

Interior Organizational Pockets

Space-maximizing interior organization system with multi-functional pockets to simplify your packing.

Waterproof Laundry Bag

Sealed waterproof compartment with removable bag separates clean clothes from dirty – also works great for swimsuits!

YKK Zippers

15x more resistant to abrasions than a standard coil zipper and specifically treated to shed water quickly – YKK zippers provide an impenetrable seal that you and your belongings can rely on. 

USB Port

The Optimus Carry-on comes with an integrated USB port located right next to the handle. Simply insert your own battery pack into the easy-access interior pocket and you’ll be able to stay virtually connected whenever your travels take you.

 Built-In Expansion System 

Everyone’s an over-packer, including us. We’ve got you covered with a flexible zippered expansion for maximum wiggle room 

Corner Protectors

Your luggage takes a pounding whether it’s the TSA, baggage handlers, or your impatient kids literally kicking it (we've all been there). That’s why we gave the Optimus the added protection of corner guards. 

Self-Correcting Zippers

No more worrying about busted zippers. Ours are self-correcting, so all you need to do is slide the pullers back to fix any traction issues.

So, why'd we do it?

Our why is simple. We’re tired of watching travelers get duped into thinking they need to spend $200+ for a quality piece of luggage. We promise to uphold the same standards in style, function and durability you expect from your suitcase, and leave the bullsh*t behind.

Are you listening yet?

Cool. Now let's get you better acquainted with your new (future) favorite luggage.

Three sizes for every type of modern adventure.

Three colors for everyone and everywhere.

We’re launching with three unique colorways that are anything but boring, but still classic enough to outlast any passing trend or season. Once our campaign wraps, you can choose the color for each bag in your tier, and also submit requests for future ones!

Charcoal Grey

A modern take on the traditional black suitcase.

Dark Lake Blue

A bright navy blue inspired by the sea.

Lavender

A dreamy blend of soft pink and purple tones.

Functional features provide you with…

SAFETY

CONNECTION

SPACE

Too good to be true?

We thought you might think that. Don’t worry, we understand that we still need to earn your trust, so we put our top features to the ultimate test, then took it even further.

And here's how we stack up against the competition.

Still skeptical?

What if we told you all orders come with a 100-day guarantee? You try it for 100 days and if you love it, great – it also has a 10-year warranty. If you don’t, we’ll give you a full refund and cover the return shipping costs back to us. No questions asked. 

OK. Let's take it one step further.

Crowdfunding rocks; you know that and so do we. We’ve seen some fantastic products launched with crowdfunding, resulting in happier customers and developers. What could go wrong? Well, there’s delivery delays, products not living up to their design renderings, shipping fails, and so much more. 

We don’t want you to worry about any of that, which is why we’re guaranteeing to ship out all product out by November 1, 2019, or we give you a full refund. If you don’t receive a tracking number by that date, we will automatically file a refund to your account. Yes, really.

Now here’s where you come in.

Our direct-to-consumer model allows us to keep costs down, but we can’t go to production without your help. Whether you’re ready to pre-order now (and score the best price) or want to give us a thumbs up, you're helping to make luggage great and travel fun again. 

Ready to roll?

Awesome. Scroll down for even more details and available projects rewards. In the meantime, we want to share a bit more about who we are and what led us to create Optimus.

The Story of Optimus.

The internet has changed the way everything around us is sold, from pizza to properties to eyeglasses and beyond, so isn't it time that luggage got the 21st century upgrade, too? This is why we decided to step in. Consumers like you are still expected to pay for expensive storefronts, tremendous sales force and mega advertising campaigns, only to receive a sub-par product at best. 

We’re going to change that, why not join us? 

We are a small team of industry veterans working directly with the best factories in the world, using the best materials to bring you high-quality luggage at a price you won’t believe. Our direct-to-consumer model allows us to keep costs down and pass the savings directly onto you, where it belongs.

The Making of Optimus

 

Let’s refresh.

Why should you support Optimus?

  •  QUALITY  | We invested in premium materials that truly matter – think smooth-as-butter Hinomoto wheels, resilient YKK zippers, and a tough, but ultra-lightweight polycarbonate shell – and waved bye to needless extras.
  •  VALUE  | By taking a direct-to-consumer approach and eliminating middlemen markups, we’re able to give you a designer-level product for a fraction of the cost you're used to paying.
  •  TRUST  | All orders come with a 100-day guarantee. You try it for 100 days and if you love it, great – it has a 10-year warranty. If you don’t, we’ll give a full refund and cover the return shipping costs back to us.

story:
Short Summary

I am a business owner operator, a Kiwi who has been living in Aus for more than 10 years now. I am very concerned with the plight of Kiwi's in Aus. When trans Tasman relationships fail for Kiwi's, Australia leaves severe failings in social security entitlements, the children of these families will suffer. Nobody should have to live on the streets because of domestic abuse and the inability of Australia to respect the trans Tasman/ANZAC agreement. 

  • Since 2001 legislation has discriminated against Kiwis residing in Australia.
  • Contributions to this cause will help NZ expats suffering financial hardship in Australia find a way home.

Since 2001 NZ'ers are refused any right to citizenship, social security, domestic abuse protection, disability pension or education funding. Ever. Much misinformation about this issue has been and continues to be paraded in the media.

What We Need & What You Get

This is about looking after our Whanau in Australia and offering a way home to those who cannot otherwise afford it.

  • This is a huge problem with more than 680,000 Kiwi's in Oz.
  • Over 150,000 Kiwi's will never have any social security rights in Australia.
  • These funds will be designated to helping Kiwi's find a way home and avoid a life of abuse and of living on the the streets in Austalia because of the draconian legislation passed against Kiwi's by the government of Australia in 2001.

The Impact

Your contribution will help those Kiwis who find themselves destitute, desperate and who cannot access a pension in Australia, by providing them a way back to NZ in times of hardship.

  • Australia has made all Kiwi's ineligible for citizenship since 2001 - despite the ANZAC's and the Trans Tasman agreement.
  • I have previously started a petition to reverse these laws. Many issues have been raised with much misunderstanding surrounding the severity of this issue.
  • Due to much propaganda, slander, stereotyping and misinformation much of this issue is still not properly understood. This is a serious issue of disenfranchisement. Kiwi's in Aus are accused of being dole bludgers when this could not be further from the truth. Kiwi's working in Australia since 2001 pay tax but cannot vote and are not entitled to any social security. This becomes a problem when domestic abuse occurs with children caught in the dilemma. Abused women find themselves caught in a system with no support where they cannot leave Australia. Men find themselves in a position of being sent back to to NZ and potentially losing contact with their children.

Risks & Challenges

I will work closely with Iwi n Aus ( on Facebook) to help those who need it most.

These funds will be used to help victims of abuse, those seeking refuge and those who have children born in Australia needing to find a way to escape severe hardships caused by the draconian 2001 legislation against New Zealanders living in Australia since 1994. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might feel you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Tell all your friends about this campaign which is aiming to help right a huge wrong in the history of Australia's Trans Tasman relations with New Zealand.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Share this on Facebook and other social media sites such as Twitter.

And that's all there is to it. Donate as much as you can afford.

What We Need & What You Get This is about looking after our Whanau in Australia and offering a way home to those who cannot otherwise afford it.  This is a huge problem with more than 680,000 Kiwi's in Oz. Over 150,000 Kiwi's will never have any social security rights in Australia.
These funds will be designated to helping Kiwi's find a way home and avoid a life of abuse and of living on the the streets in Austalia because of the draconian legislation passed against Kiwi's by the government of Australia in 2001.    The Impact Your contribution will help those Kiwis who find themselves destitute, desperate and who cannot access a pension in Australia, by providing them a way back to NZ in times of hardship.  Australia has made all Kiwi's ineligible for citizenship since 2001 - despite the ANZAC's and the Trans Tasman agreement. I have previously started a petition to reverse these laws. Many issues have been raised with much misunderstanding surrounding the severity of this issue. Due to much propaganda, slander, stereotyping and misinformation much of this issue is still not properly understood. This is a serious issue of disenfranchisement. Kiwi's in Aus are accused of being dole bludgers when this could not be further from the truth. Kiwi's working in Australia since 2001 pay tax but cannot vote and are not entitled to any social security. This becomes a problem when domestic abuse occurs with children caught in the dilemma. Abused women find themselves caught in a system with no support where they cannot leave Australia. Men find themselves in a position of being sent back to to NZ and potentially losing contact with their children.    Risks & Challenges I will work closely with Iwi n Aus ( on Facebook) to help those who need it most.
These funds will be used to help victims of abuse, those seeking refuge and those who have children born in Australia needing to find a way to escape severe hardships caused by the draconian 2001 legislation against New Zealanders living in Australia since 1994.    Other Ways You Can Help Some of you might feel you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Tell all your friends about this campaign which is aiming to help right a huge wrong in the history of Australia's Trans Tasman relations with New Zealand. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Share this on Facebook and other social media sites such as Twitter.   And that's all there is to it. Donate as much as you can afford.

story:
Summary.

I got the idea to build FreakyCheap.com (under construction) because an active e-buyer and seller I was always looking for best deals online; of course only from trustworthy sites like eBay, Amazon or Overstock etc… but I couldn't find a descent website where I can compare prices from these guys only, that's why I decided to build it.

                                     

How it works.

Who’s going to be the cheapest?  Let’s find out. 

Open this provisional link http://miguel.kr.cisinlive.com/ , 

Type your product on the search bar and hit the search button, our search engine will craw Ebay and Amazon’s servers to pull out the info you are searching for, 

pick the cheapest and buy it if you want :))

Why we need your support?

We are seeking $100,000 to give the best user experience and that is very expensive and hard to accomplish but not impossible.

Speed:

One of the first and main issues that we need to attack is speed, users has 0 tolerance with slow websites and having this issue is not an option for us.

Accuracy:

Accuracy is another main factor here, so there’s no an option to give irrelevant results.

Re-Design:

We might need to redesign the entire store to make it simple but beautiful, user friendly and responsive.

App:

We are going to build our own free app to do the same thing from your smartphone.

Marketing Campaign:

We are going to run a full online marketing campaign necessary to earn brand awareness.


What you get.

Benefits for users:

  • Find best deals quick and easier.
  • No more waste of time searching on different stores.
  • Hassle free.
  • No annoying sign ups.

                  

             Benefits for Supporters:

Learn more here: http://freakycheap.com/about 



FAQs:

·  Where can I try how FreakyCheap.com works ?

Here: http://miguel.kr.cisinlive.com/

·  Why only Ebay and Amazon?

Since is hard to find another e-store who can beat these guys, there’s no make sense to add another competitor so far. We are considering to add other important online stores in the phase3.

·  Why is taking too much time to show the results?

This is one of the main issues that we need to fix in these phase 2 to give a better user experience.

·  Is it only for new products?

Yes it is for now, FC will only compare prices of brand new products from Ebay vs Amazon, but we will compare used products soon. 

·  What about auctions?

Amazon doesn’t have auctions so FC cannot compare in this category.

·  How FC will earn money?

3 ways:

-  Affiliate program with Ebay and Amazon.

-  Google AdSense.

-  Sponsor Ads.


Risks & Challenges

Risks:

We are subject to eBay's and Amazon's policies, so right now are favorable for our business model but we cannot control what decisions they are gonna make in the future.

Challenges: 

Deliver faster and accuracy results are the key for success.


Disclaimer:

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and are not guaranteed." 

We are very confidence that if we can deliver an excellent user experience a huge success will follows; but this success won’t come without your support, and that’s why we are going to honor our deal with those who believe in us from the very beginning.


“Your beginnings will seem humble, so prosperous will your future be”.

Job 8:7

story:
Who Are We:

For 30 years, over 700 devoted individuals have been selected each year to participate in the Tempe Leadership Program. In partnership with the Tempe Chamber of Commerce Foundation, Tempe Leadership’s focus is to make a lasting impact in their community. 

This year, the board selected 25 individuals to form the largest class in its history-Class XXX. These 25 dynamic and passionate individuals have been chosen to represent their community within an array of industries and backgrounds, professional experience and expertise that live, work or play in Tempe, Arizona, and most importantly, want to give back to this vibrant community. 

Our Mission to Give Back: 

Provide a permanent bike parking and valet facility that gives back to the community it serves offering non-profits the vehicle to generate needed funds for their organization while promoting bicycling ridership as a safe and healthier sustainable mode of transportation to meet the growing demands of bicycle use.

The Cause:

Project Location: 

Located along the shoreline of Tempe Town Lake.

The Project - The Bike Corral at Tempe Beach Park

With the largest university, Arizona State University, in the United States located across the street from Tempe Beach Park and home to 65,000+ students, Tempe Leadership's Class XXX is raising the funds to construct a permanent bike parking and valet facility in Tempe Beach Park called the Bike Corral.

The facility will be dual-use by providing every-day open bike parking and a permanent staffed bike valet during special events for Tempe Beach Park-the largest park and event space in the city that averages 350 events per year!

Upon completion and in partnership with the City of Tempe, the municipality will take on the bike parking and valet facility providing a bike facility model for private-public partnerships that could be replicated around the country, and throughout the world!

To that end, the secured property from the city and the design and initial construction for the project is already underway, BUT we cannot do it without your help!  

Your impact:

Help us complete Phase 1 – grade and construct bike facility fencing and purchase bike racks by the end of March!

Your Money Goes to: -Placeholder - Breakdown

Keep Us Rollin':

•Be a fan of our project. Go to our website:             https://www.tempebikecorral.com

•Like us on Facebook. Share with your friends:                               https://www.facebook.com/tempebikecorral

 •Follow us on Twitter. Tweet to your peeps: @tempebikecorral       https://twitter.com/TempeBikeCorral 

•Spread Word of Mouth. Share the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools

•Keep riding! Support your local bike community activists and groups. Bicycle ridership is increasing, and more bicyclists on the road will create a greater demand for amenities alike

story:
Hello!

We are Irene and Dimitris,  a young couple from Greece.

 

We start a small company in Santorini Greece.

It’s going to be a ebike tour company.

Our difference from all the other rental / tour companies in Santorini is that we also have electric bikes, which are eco friendly and of course much more fun!

In Greece electric transfer is not very popular yet. So we want to be the first in Santorini and make a good start!

We really don’t need to say how beautiful the island is, because Santorini is very famous about it’s beauty.

We really need your help to gather some money to continue our dream, because the situation here in Greece (as you all know) is not the best, financial speaking.

For the young people is very difficult to start their own business, or even find work.

We need 30000 € , so please support us.
And check out the perks! You will be rewarded for your donation, and you get the chance to see this beautiful island, not to mention that you are helping to continue this environmental movement in Greece.

We already work one season we have found our place,  in Thira the capital of Santorini.

But we need money for the special license that we need, build a website with online booking, for equipment (electric bikes, etc) and of course rent and other bills

We hope that you like our idea and that you will donate us

Thank you very much

Greetings from Greece.

 

 

 


 


 

 

 

Sightseeing & Attractions

story:
http://www.dannieliebergot.com/

About:

After completing my B.F.A in photography, I was awarded the Listhus artist residency in Óafsfjörður, Iceland. The residency will be a 6 week program that allows for me to work solely on my photography. I proposed to create a new project working in the isolated dark winter photographing the landscape, creating sound art, and making a short documentary from interviewing residents. Ólafsjörður is located in Northeast Iceland, between a couple of fjords (mountains formed by glacial erosion.) The residency will be from October 17  - November 30 this year. My husband, Chris, will be joining me since he is my assistant and 7 weeks away from him is way too long!


Our trip:


To make the airfares cheaper and to break up the flight time, we have decided to fly to Brooklyn, NY October 6th - 11th and stay with friends. On the 11th, we will head to Reykjavik, Iceland and tour the country (exploring and creating work outside of the residency) until the 17th. Then we will be off to North Iceland by bus! From then on we will be in a tiny apartment and share a bathroom without a kitchen until November 30th. It's quite the challenge but we are so ready for it!
During our stay we hope to connect with artists and the community. We will interview many residents about the landscape and their stories. The landscape can be beautiful on its own, but the story behind it is far more compelling and worth sharing. 


Finances:

At this point, I think it is important to communicate the reason why we are seeking your assistance. Initially, the terms of the residency would have awarded me more financial support, however; due to funding restrictions, I agreed to accept their proposal that offered less funding, leaving Chris and I to cover a majority of the trip's financial requirements. Despite this obstacle, I feel the opportunity to work in a foreign country, and to have my art showcased in an international exhibition is worth all of our efforts. 
So I am asking for help to fund this project and my career path. Chris and I have been working so hard to save for this opportunity. We moved out of our apartment and now live with family to help and we can't wait to go on this adventure!
Your funding will go towards:
  • Airfare
  • Camera Equipment
  • Audio Equipment
  • Rent during our stay
  • Food 
  • Car rental
  • Tours (to find the perfect composition)
  • Bus fares
  • Exhibition costs (printing + framing)

If you are interested in a T-shirt, please specify which T-shirt Design you would like and size at dannieliebergot@gmail.com

Flower of Life by Chase Kahn: 

OR
Icelandic Adventure by Aaron Baltierra:



Please spread the word and share this campaign. Support your artist friends! 

Thank you!

story:
Updates- we've had a lot of great things going on: We are getting closer- right now, we need $40,000 to break ground!!! We've been able to reduce the construction estimate and with what we have already raised- WE ARE SO CLOSE!!!!!!
  • Fundraisers at Eaton Elementary School and Fermental
  • Submitted grant applications to the Tony Hawk Foundation and Vans
  • Gathering items for an online auction that will kick off soon
But we still need your help! We've been able to reduce the cost of some materials, so our goal is now 


Why Now?

For years many groups have tried to build a skatepark in the northern part of New Hanover County with no luck. Then, in 2014, the County Commissioners made it clear that they embraced skating by allocating $265,000 to build a skatepark in Ogden Park- answering the call of the community to bring a facility to this part of the county. 

  • So we started gathering skaters and BMX riders together to plan the skatepark and form a committee. 
  • We put out a request for proposals for the design and the committee selected Grindline Skateparks out of Seattle , Washington
  • Once Grindline was selected, we started getting input- what did the skaters and bikers here want in a new park? The result? The design you see in the video- a park that is fun for beginners and challenging for advanced skaters too!

  • So we have a rare opportunity to build the park of our dreams in New Hanover County- but we need your help!
  • Your support will mean that hundreds of skaters will have a new outlet for their sport in New Hanover County. You'll be part of the first true public/private partnership to bring this skatepark to life! 


We need your help- we need money to match the County's contribution so we can open Phase I and Phase II together.

So we started with $265,000 and spent $50,000 on design and $4,000 on soil testing to make sure the site was still suitable. That leaves $201,000 of County money- the dream design the community wants will take another $250,000 to make happen. 

  • Be the first to sport Ogden Skatepark gear- from bumper stickers, to t-shirts, to Wilmington's own Freakers- help become an ambassador for skateboarding in the County when you wear the gear!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we still get the money we have raised so far- which is why we chose IndieGoGo. We are going to keep trying until we meet our goal!


The Impact

The new skatepark will make skateboarding and BMX riding accessible for thousands of people in the County. Right now the closest skatepark is more than 12 miles away- which might as well be Mars if you are kid and don't have your driver's license:

  • Skaters and BMXers are athletes- and they deserve the same quality facility that we provide for soccer, tennis, football, disc golf, and more.
  • We know how to build great parks- in the past 5 years we added Smith Creek Park, expanded Castle Hayne Park and renovated countless other County parks. Our commitment to quality shows in our facilities and we take pride in having the best parks in the region.
  • The community has been with us from the start- now we need your help to finish this off and make this dream a reality!


Risks & Challenges

We have to have help- this skatepark won't become a reality if we can't raise the money.

  • We know this community wants a skatepark- now there is literally a concrete way to make it happen- your donations!
  • We'll be asking individuals, foundations, and businesses for their support too!

Other Ways You Can Help

Know a business that can donate materials like rebar, shotcrete, concrete, fill dirt- we need all kinds of stuff!

  • If you are interested in donating in-kind materials, please contact us at ogdenskatepark@nhcgov.com
  • Share this link with your friends and family- this is a group effort and we need all the help we can get! Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram @ogdenskatepark

Together, we can make this happen- thanks for your help!

story:
ETHIOPIA!!! The horn of Africa, Abyssinia Empire, THE ONE place that was never colonized by oppressors, land of His Imperial Majesty; Haile Selassie (Ras Tafari), genesis of life, Orthodox Christianity, Ark of The Covenant, Bebere spice & Injera, and of The Oromo, The Amhara people and much much more...

What and Why?!?!

The $1200 raised will go directly into traveling (mostly commuting, places to rest and resources for projects during and after the trip). My goal is to reach the country from my own investment, yet contributions will help me to balance moving around and then head outward.  I am aiming for 2.5 total weeks this round. I am grateful for anything I receive financially, and new projects within photography, music, education and even food will be created from this campaign.

This is an experience of cultural exchange; I have roots within Ethiopia and am not going for just myself, I also want to tap into the music and art communities there, to further establish a bridge/connection within my communities within the USA and other parts of the world, that I've already established with little to no resources. This is a big picture excursion. I will also be incorporating elements from my super recent trip to Morocco, which is a superb country in its own right! Morocco gave me new insight and strength to go even deeper into the motherland. I've also visited Nigeria when I was younger with family, I have roots there as well, I'm very curious and excited to reach and embrace Africa from the OPPOSITE side.

I am eager to establish a strong bond with my people in Ethiopia and present new ideas, art, music and other elements of culture to others worldwide. 

 

 

The Impact

This Abyssinia excursion is a powerful one to me, because it will be during the time I was born on this planet (March 24th) and is a pilgrimage/return to my and family origins. I have a strong deep inner bond to Ethiopia, for the food, music, embrace of the people no matter which city I encounter them within, my connection to Rastafari spirituality and lifestyle via Haile Selassie, Marcus Garvey, Bob Marley and more toward repatriation and Pan Africanism. 

Art, music and food I feel are the strongest ways to break the chains of oppression collectively. I want to introduce those in my journey, to what I've learned and how I create, and see if there is a way to incorporate that for the youth both in Ethiopia and within the USA as well. We are one people collectively, and all of our origins, one way or another are rooted within these lands.

 

Risks & Challenges

I'm always a risk taker, or "rebel", I've been called a nomad, or a gypsy, a monk, I've been told I'm spontaneous, and some have told me they are jealous or envious in the way I choose to not live like the "avg" or "normal" people...WELL I really just love life and want to be a big part in helping to bring joy, happiness, love and inspiration to myself and others near and far. I see the world as a big picture and borders, walls, genres, race and all that as the epitome of the problems within our society. We are born creators, meant to connect with one another by any means, no matter what so called governments try to do to prevent us from shifting our dreams to reality. 

Just over the past few  months, traveling through Europe and Morocco, i've had my bank card misplaced and none resent to me from my bank (Chase is garbage!!!), my phone taken from me, not been able to access the internet, or money without a card, there have been times I wasn't sure if I'd have a place to rest as well, yet have experienced waaaay more gold from just staying focused and forward, and making new friends and family along the way. The true wealth is within the community, I appreciate you highly and am grateful that we inspire one another! ;)

With more resources at my disposal, it will be much easier to reach said goals and be able to do more with others, no matter where.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to this specific campaign financially, no worries! Sharing this with others through social media, grabbing music from my label site (etcrecords.com) and/or checking me or artists on the label at one of our showcases will be highly appreciated and respected.
story_txt:
ETHIOPIA!!! The horn of Africa, Abyssinia Empire, THE ONE place that was never colonized by oppressors, land of His Imperial Majesty; Haile Selassie (Ras Tafari), genesis of life, Orthodox Christianity, Ark of The Covenant, Bebere spice & Injera, and of The Oromo, The Amhara people and much much more...
What and Why?!?!
The $1200 raised will go directly into traveling (mostly commuting, places to rest and resources for projects during and after the trip). My goal is to reach the country from my own investment, yet contributions will help me to balance moving around and then head outward.  I am aiming for 2.5 total weeks this round. I am grateful for anything I receive financially, and new projects within photography, music, education and even food will be created from this campaign.
This is an experience of cultural exchange; I have roots within Ethiopia and am not going for just myself, I also want to tap into the music and art communities there, to further establish a bridge/connection within my communities within the USA and other parts of the world, that I've already established with little to no resources. This is a big picture excursion. I will also be incorporating elements from my super recent trip to Morocco, which is a superb country in its own right! Morocco gave me new insight and strength to go even deeper into the motherland. story:
The SkyWing

(from Concept to Prototype)

 

The SkyWing results from many years of personal aeronautical studies, infinite sketches and a powerful belief that the human can fly. It will be a custom-made suit composed of Dracon (sailcloth) and two lightweight profiles 3D printed in Carbon Fibre on each arm. These extensions plus the entire area of the body creates a surface that allows the user to generate enough lift to take off! 

With your support, not only I could keep working to the next stage, but we may improve it! Please let me introduce you to my idea and also my dream!

 

 

3D of myself with the two profiles and the extension of the fabric. Note the long zipper on the chest, lets the user fit in easily 

 

A long time ago...

I had two car accidents that almost killed me; by coincidence, three days before the anniversary of the first accident I had the second one. I am certain God and The Universe send me those experiences to change how I was living, I definitely did!

The last recovery made me start to think cars are not safe at all. Indeed, I could not even have a ride for a while. Such a scary feeling which went away a long time ago. Sparked my mind!

After that realisation which was around 1995, it started my journey of knowledge, my non-stop daydreaming and the origin of a great story to tell to my grandchildren.

 

 

            “He who has overcome his fears will truly be free”

Aristotle

 

My first attempt

Was naive, bold and funny! I made a balsa wood model with plastic wrap. Yes, I did not know what I was thinking to be honest!

The influence of the design was the structure of the fingers of bats. It had five curved beams joined on each hand and the plastic all the way-up between the elements. When I finished the project, I walked to the closest hill on a very windy day, and then I opened my arms. The wind blew me away making me fall into a bush full of thorns! 

A few days after the silly accident I changed the remains in a new configuration, this time similar to the dragonfly’s wings. Of course, it did not work!

 

Above, I sketched the three models back in 1998. Note, that the first model I had to recreate in this drawing, it is the one at the back from that one I made the far on the left.

 

 

By that moment, I started reading the bible for pilots Van Sickle’s Modern Airmanship. My approach was more conventional. I decide a bird shape with internal fixed sections, same as we build aeroplanes. It was very rigid and heavy.

I used micro-corrugated cardboard. I painted in black and white, the darker side on top which makes the air hotter and sucks it up into the air. Imagine a humongous condor, but with less graceless. 

I grabbed my invention, and I walked to a hillside... Long story short, I failed!

 

“Be alone, that is the secret of invention; be alone, that is when ideas are born.”

Nikola Tesla​

 

Life goes on

After that failure, anything was more important than my dream, parties, birthdays, movies, endless activities… Then, I decided that I have to fulfil my destiny. 

I stepped back; I took a better approach to recap the project. It was a good decision made by God and the Universe that put me in an English spoken country.

I bought a couple of books on aeronautics. I studied and I understood all available concepts along with formulas for designing a wing. This knowledge changed everything!

On these two pages are the three well-known formulas for wing design.

I ended up making a rationalisation between the formulas and concepts which let  me decide the size of the wing, Top right square.

 

 

And on

Once, I had an idea of a suit that looks like Flying squirrels... I did nothing about it, and many years after they invented the Flying Suit! I freaked out! I did not want to see my project made by another person. 

But later on, I found out that the inventor worked for over 10 years before succeeding with his invention, and he gave me a lot of hope!

 

Idea from 1999, on the same year the inventors of the Flyingsuit were showing their invention in a Skydiver Convention!

 

 

Finally, I found my path

To be sincere I do not know if I am making history. If not, at least I am making my own story, whichever is, is great! Right? One day I was showing and explaining my idea to my wife, she already knew that I have been working for many years without much advanced, and she said: “That looks good but when you will be going to make it?”. Then I realised that she was right!

I was wasting my time and I did not want to feel the same feeling that I had when someone else had the same idea, it worked on it and achieved it! Ideas are all over the world! 

Sketch. 2016

 

I put myself on track again. I researched the alternatives in materials and also how to get this invention out for everyone that wants to fly and feel the freedom of being in the air!

I redesign the whole SkyWing, I went to the basic of all shapes. Since I was little, I loved dinosaurs; then, one day I came up with the idea of a similar shape.

The Quetzalcoatlus was the biggest and heaviest of all animals that could fly in our planet, with 250 kg of weight and 10 m of wingspan it was able to fly across the sky.

 

Exploring the design of the entire suit 2019

 

I extrapolate the same concept that Pterodactyls used to fly which was using their elongated pinky finger to hold a thin membrane of skin (called Brachiopatagium) then I came with the first rational design that might let the human fly.

In the future, we might use SkyWings to commute to work or even travelling to other countries. Thank you to everybody supports I can dedicate my entire time and energy to this dream.

 

 

“You are today where your thoughts have brought you; you will be tomorrow where your thoughts take you”.

James Allen

 

Jump or not to jump

The reason that makes me jump into this amazing crowdfunding website. Is that I shall raise capital to make this venture happen and I will give The SkyWing to the world in return! 

But before, I was very protective of my idea, just a few of my friends and family knew about this novelty; is because I already read too many stories about inventors or even architects that left our world in poverty after people without moral values stole their grand designs; others copied their products and made the founders lead to bankruptcy.

One thing is straightforward to me, doing this by myself all alone it will get me too much time, money and energy. Please join me on this quest and we build this together!

 

Printing off  the right-side profile on a 1:1 scale from The Blackbelt 3D printer

 

 

Different scales and models of the profile from the right side

 

To create the profile of the wings, I previously bought the only 3D printer that can print continually in a straight line. The Blackbelt from https://standardprintco.com allows me re-model before the final design in one to one scale.

 

 

“Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.”

Norman Vincent Peale

 

What I need to do

At the moment I am printing the 3D models in the Blackbelt, but I require to print them at 1:1 scale. I have to test tension and compression. I am using PLA filament which is a non-structural material at all, but sooner, I need to implement carbon fibre, which is stronger than steel and is lighter than fibreglass.

 

This is my creative corner at home! 

 

After testing and improving the structure. I need to buy a sewing machine and put together the suit, after the next learning curve...  I must try it!

 

“Set a goal that's meaningful and compelling enough, and your skills, your knowledge and your effectiveness will expand in order to reach that goal.”

 Less Brown

 

Where all the founded money will go

At this stage, there is no crew… Indeed! My lovely family, but besides them is essential a squad of professionals to encourage me out to push further!

With these funds I will consult and adopt other professional skills to build the SkyWing:

  • An Aeronautical Engineer that helps me to calculate the profiles more accurately
  • An Industrial Designer for developing more efficient new designs
  • An Accountant, Social Marketer and a Web Designer  
  • A Sewing Machine plus sailcloth fabric from https://www.sailrite.com
  • And the most two important safety accessories, a Helmet and a Parachute Canopy from http://www.chutingstar.com

  If you desire to be part of the team please ask!

 

Render image of The SkyWing 

 

“If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.”

Jim Rohn

 

If you never heard about me

Please let me start with a phrase… “A modest man does not talk about himself”. However, I feel the commitment to let you know more about my background and myself. Please let me share some of my personal achievements!

I will start basically with my name, John Henry Lange Ponce​, I was born in Venezuela in 1973, it was an outstanding country to live and grow up; where I have the opportunity to learn and practice the activities that caused me joy! 

When I was 11 years old, I started mixing music with my neighbours, each of us had a mixing device. I had one deck that I used to take with me everywhere, without my mum approval of course! When I was a teenager, I was part of a “Miniteca”; we used that term to refer to a bunch of guys playing with DJ equipment’s, our main job it was creating an atmosphere for families to get to dance in their birthday parties! Early in the 2000s, my career as a Psychedelic DJ begun. Nowadays I still enjoying mixing and creating electronic music at home. Reason and Traktor DJ are my beloved ones.

Beside that hobby which grew up into a profession. I have another odd ability, which came out just because I was good at drawing! In 2nd grade, I won the second place to best drawing, by 4th grade I was making money from selling drawings that I used to make! The kids’ favourite was Mazinger Z running to catch up the Jet Scrander! Also, the Big Dragon from The Gladiator cartoon.

I had 17 years old back 1990 when I ensemble a razor electric machine with an adaptation for needles. I started making Tattoos to my buddies for fun, and eventually, I became a Tattoo Artist. I won the 1st Prize for a Best Tribal in an Expo-Festival. Today I am still enjoying tattooing to myself, family and friends. Please check this page to check out my work! https://www.facebook.com/The-Universe-Tattoo-Studio-105294401062467/

In 2004, I finished my degree of Architecture from The Central University of Venezuela (UCV) after many years of persistence and a lot of discipline. Since then I have been working on several exciting projects here in Australia and also back home. Learning, mastering and getting over daily issues in Autodesk Revit (which is the leading software in the Architecture and Construction Industry) made me reach the title of BIM Manager (which stand for Building Information Modelling) which is the professional that looks after the data and the 3D model within a project. This was the profession I choose to makes a life. https://www.behance.net/johnlange1221

I got an incursion as an Entrepreneur; I created LCream21 which is a cream that smooths marks and nurtures the skin. This story started with the same car accidents that I had! On the first accident, I broke in several pieces the bone that supports the eye; the intervention was minimal but inside was huge; I have two titanium plates with 7 bolts holding all those bones together and also a wire in my chin; the doctors left two tiny scars… I did not need help there, but in the second accident, I was disfigured! Please check my story and also the product I offer to people to smooth their marks or ageing lines in the same way that I did: http://LCream21.com​

In 2010, I won the 3rd prize for the best invention in the Association of Inventors of South Australia with The Tree Fog Catcher, I had to explain my idea also the proposal to a room full of inventors, the concept was the same used by the Namibian Beetle, which was of how it collects water from the early morning fog with it wings facing the wind from the top of the dunes, it has two chemical components that allow to the water to condensate (hydrophilic) and another component that let the water runs (hydrophobic) to the mouth, I put in place the same approach that nature did, but using a steel column with 2 enormous dishes with elevated planes of fishing nets that collect the water droplets from the early morning mist. Just recently, I introduce The SkyWing to The Inventor Association of Australia (VIC). I had to explain my idea to a panel of 5 Senior inventors! Scary, right? They gave me good tips though. Besides these two real approaches with experts, I had to learn a few extra software to allow me to design the profiles; an enormous challenge was learning Autodesk Inventor which is my favourite software so far! 

In all this process I have to rebuild myself. For a while, I have listened and read about personal growth, parenting, love and mindfulness from well-known speakers and authors. My favourites are Craig Beck, Jim Rohn, Joseph Murphy, Jim Quick, Less Brown, Napoleon Hill, Norman Vincent Pale and Zig Ziglar to name a few of the best ones.

Without extending me much, this is my background! 

 

“Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway”

Earl Nightingale

 

Concept and Proposal A1 sheet of The Tree Fog Catcher​

 

 

Please, contribute with a small amount because every dollar will help!

 

 

And please, spread the voice, make some noise for me and share this campaign over your network! ​​​

 

Thank you very much for your time and forthcoming response!

 

 

 

“If you are looking for perfect safety, you will do well to sit on a fence and watch the birds.”

Wilbur Wright, 1901

 

Personal Milestones!

 

  • I printed off the left profile!

On the first accident, I broke in several pieces the bone that supports the eye; the intervention was minimal but inside was huge; I have two titanium plates with 7 bolts holding all those bones together and also a wire in my chin; the doctors left two tiny scars… I did not need help there, but in the second accident, I was disfigured! Please check my story and also the product I offer to people to smooth their marks or ageing lines in the same way that I did: http://LCream21.com​In 2010, I won the 3rd prize for the best invention in the Association of Inventors of South Australia with The Tree Fog Catcher, I had to explain my idea also the proposal to a room full of inventors, the concept was the same used by the Namibian Beetle, which was of how it collects water from the early morning fog with it wings facing the wind from the top of the dunes, it has two chemical components that allow to the water to condensate (hydrophilic) and another component that let the water runs (hydrophobic) to the mouth, I put in place the same approach that nature did, but using a steel column with 2 enormous dishes with elevated planes of fishing nets that collect the water droplets from the early morning mist. Just recently, I introduce The SkyWing to The Inventor Association of Australia (VIC). I had to explain my idea to a panel of 5 Senior inventors! Scary, right? They gave me good tips though. Besides these two real approaches with experts, I had to learn a few extra software to allow me to design the profiles; an enormous challenge was learning Autodesk Inventor which is my favourite software so far! In all this process I have to rebuild myself. For a while, I have listened and read about personal growth, parenting, love and mindfulness from well-known speakers and authors. My favourites are Craig Beck, Jim Rohn, Joseph Murphy, Jim Quick, Less Brown, Napoleon Hill, Norman Vincent Pale and Zig Ziglar to name a few of the best ones.Without extending me much, this is my background!  “Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway”Earl Nightingale Concept and Proposal A1 sheet of The Tree Fog Catcher​  Please, contribute with a small amount because every dollar will help!  And please, spread the voice, make some noise for me and share this campaign over your network! ​​​ Thank you very much for your time and forthcoming response!   “If you are looking for perfect safety, you will do well to sit on a fence and watch the birds.” Wilbur Wright, 1901 Personal Milestones! I printed off the left profile!

story:
Introducing the worlds first minimalist fire starter wallet: 

The Webbing Wallet!

In an emergency, fire can be the difference between life and death. Heat or hypothermia. Cooked or raw meat. Don't leave it up to the "outdoorsy" people to be prepared, everyone should be prepared in case of an emergency. You're not interested in carrying matches everywhere you go? Well then, the Webbing Wallet Survival Edition is exactly what you need. 

The Webbing Wallet Survival Edition is made in the USA using heavyweight polypropylene webbing with a breaking strength of nearly 2,000 pounds. Each wallet has an attachment loop made out of 550 FireCord with a 1 inch ferro rod and a minimalist credit card knife.

HOW IT WORKS  

  • Carry The Webbing Wallet everyday, everywhere. Just in case.
  • Remove all contents and carefully open the credit card knife. 
  • Using the knife, cut the 550 FireCord and remove the red tinder strand.
  • Tease about 1 inch of the tinder into a fluffy ball. Save any excess tinder. 
  • Use the blunt edge of the credit card knife to scrape the ferro rod aiming the sparks at the teased tinder. It may take several tries to produce sparks on a new ferro rod. 
  • Once tinder is aflame, add kindling and wood.

WE NEED YOUR HELP

Now we need your help to run the first production of The Webbing Wallet. Whether you are looking for a minimalist, no frills wallet built like a tank or a minimalist wallet that could save your life, back us today.

Project Timeline

Back us and we'll make it happen!

 

The Fine Print  

Fire and knives are dangerous. Use your head. Keep knives away from children. We are not responsible for accidents or injury related to the use of our products. Be aware that while the wallet, FireCord & ferro rod are allowed on planes, the knife needs to be checked.

Shipping to the US will be USPS First Class. There will not be any tracking numbers supplied unless you choose to upgrade your shipping to USPS Priority by adding $4. International shipments will be sent by USPS First Class International and will not include tracking numbers. Upgrading to USPS Priority International will cost an additional $25 (international shipping is not cheap). Buyers will be responsible to pay all applicable import taxes and fees. We will not list the product as a gift to avoid those fees so please do not ask.

Risks and challenges

While they do exist, our exposure to risk on this project is very minimal. All the necessary equipment and capacity to produce the Minimalist Survival Wallet is in place. Material shortages are a little more out of our control and our biggest concern. Each of our suppliers have assured us that material will be available. We're ready to go, now we need your help to make the Minimalist Survival Wallet a reality!

story:
Hi, I'm Aaron Cruz, I love to travel, but I also know how hard it can be on your body.

Between my personal travels and countless business trips, I’ve visited 42 states in the U.S. and 46 countries around the world. Now that’s a lot of flights, trains, buses and cars.

Throughout all these trips, I bought travel pillows. A lot of travel pillows. One day while packing for a trip to Argentina, I laid out all the travel pillows I’d bought throughout the years to pick the most comfortable one for my trip – and realized that none of them were good enough! Some made me sweat a lot, some were too bulky, some were just plain uncomfortable, and a couple actually caused pain in my back or neck.

I knew I could do better, so I set out to make my own travel pillow – one that is compact, comfortable, and affordable – and up to my very high standards.

The first complete prototype took me 11 months - not an easy task but it was a ton of fun. I purchased my first sewing machine, learned about different fabrics and pillow filling, and studied how to make 3D models. While I was proud of my first inflatable design, I also realized that the more complex the design, the more expensive the pillow would be, so I developed more versions to keep the great features and still make it affordable for you. While manufacturing and patents were a whole new world to me, as a mechanic, electrician and traveler I knew I could make a better, more comfortable travel pillow that could help me and my fellow travelers on our journeys.  

Five versions later, I’m excited to share this travel pillow with you, so you can get to your business or travel destination well rested and ready to go. Here are the features I'm so proud to share with you:

  • Softly supports head, neck and chin.
  • Comfortably prevents head from rolling off to the side or falling forward.
  • Easily accessible compartments to store phone or MP3 and small travel accessories.
  • Conveniently opens around the neck and cheeks to limit perspiration.
  • Reduces sound for a pleasant and quiet journey.
  • Folds into a portable, compact and practical bag, easy for travel. 
  • Prevents skin contact with seat materials.
  • Pillow cover is machine washable.

It's a great gift for any frequent traveler, or a present to yourself for all your travels during this holiday season!

“My review! Best travel pillow yet! It addresses my two mayor problems with other pillows: it eliminates bulk behind the neck and the pillow itself is close to your head (no more neck strain) I’ve used it twice on road trips and slept great – can wait to try out on a plane!”

Kely S

“Definitely more stable all around for keeping a comfortable position. In fact, I slept a little more than I intended to on the trip over! 

The material is definitely of higher quality so it’s thicker and it is larger given the design, so some of that is to be expected”.

Susan D

“This is a thoughtfully designed travel pillow that is easy to pack into a side pocket of any carry-on bag very comfortable pillow that fully supports the neck and chin.

First time I slept and rested on a fly, It’s by far the best pillow on the market”.

Joseph M

I'm trying to raise $25,000 to:

  • Invest in even more sustainable materials
  • Start a philanthropic fund to give back to the community
  • Have working capital to hire people
  • Increase current inventory

I'm guessing you like (or need) to travel a lot just like I do, so I put together some perks I know you'll enjoy. From one travel pillow to a full travel kit to packages with multiple pillows (for great gifts for your favorite travelers), we've got you covered - check out the perks to the right!

And if you like what you see and know others who would too, please share this campaign using the nifty Indiegogo share tools - Thank you for your support, and happy travels!
