story:
What is the ChakyaGo?

Inspired by nature, the ChakyaGo is an all-in-one backpack that instantly converts into a 60" soft blanket and cushion. Multi-purpose and suitable for all ages, this wearable carry-all safely secures personal items inside. 

INSTRUCTIONS

Inspired by nature, the patent-pending design is practice of unfolding from the inside, out.

USES

Ideal for vacation, beach, travel, airplanes, trains, subways, buses, road trips, shopping carts, hiking, picnics, public places, sporting events, bleacher seating, festivals, concerts, movies, amusement parks, fitness, yoga, meditation, dance, cycling, hiking, swimming, skiing, mountaineering,  office, school, car, home, birthday parties, corporate events, retreats, playtime, napping, etc.

ECO-FRIENDLY

As part of our mission to reduce plastic consumption and keep our oceans, rivers, parks, and mountains clean, we carefully chose the highest quality, athletic-grade fabrics derived from recycled plastic bottles and fishing nets. Intended to withstand the forces of nature, fabrics offer UV protection, ultra chlorine resistant, sunscreen and oil resistant, stretch yet retain shape, anti-microbial, anti-static, machine washable, suitable for all ages.

FEATURES  

  • Instantly converts from a 13” diameter soft, cushioned backpack into 60” cozy blanket 
  • Cushion provides lower back,  neck, joint support  
  • Blanket provides warmth and comfort creates a clean, sanitary surface  
  • Sleek zipper design is pick-pocket-proof and safely secures wallet, keys, personal items inside  
  • Straps draw shoulders down and back, improving posture and prevent slippage when running, hiking or when affixed to luggage  
  • Athletically-engineered, designed for high performance
  • Dry-Fast technology open cell polyurethane allows fabric to “breathe” reducing mold and odor
  • Eco-friendly printing
  • Machine washable
  • Made in Los Angeles, CA
  • 23 oz. 

COMPOSITION

EXTERIOR:  • 78% Recycled polyamide  • 22% Elastane  • Derived from recycled plastic bottles and fishing nets  • Breathable, stretches to fit without compromising shape  • Ultrachlorine resistant  • UV protection  • Sunscreen and oil resistant

INTERIOR:  • Ultra suede microfiber anti-microbial, anti-static  • Resists sand, sweat, stains, dirt,  moisture-wicking, quick drying  • Dry-Fast technology - open cell polyurethane allows fabrics  to  “breathe” reducing mold and odor


TESTIMONIALS

Los Angeles-based Yoga Instructor, David Romero, lectures on mindfulness meditation at UCLA and leads corporate group classes, retreats and Meditation Sound Baths around the world using Chakya products.

 

World traveler, Emily Mitchell, toured over 50 countries on 6 continents. She travels with a ChakyaGo and loves the convenience and portability of the all-in-one backpack as an eco-friendly replacement for airline pillows and blankets.

A popular piano teacher in Hermosa Beach, Miss Emily and her students practice piano while sitting on comfy Chakya cushions.

 
Founded in Hermosa Beach, California, Chakya began gaining popularity through social sharing on Instagram and Facebook. Awareness of the Chakya brand has grown organically through social media. Follow @chakyalife

 

AS SEEN ON

OPTIONS & VARIATIONS

Products are available at 28 boutique studios and stores throughout Los Angeles and Southern California. All products are manufactured in Downtown Los Angeles using eco-friendly and recycled materials.

  • Additional sizes, colors, shapes and prints available.
  • Private label options for business and corporations.
  • Customize for your party, home, business or special event.

NOVELTY

The process is the practice of "unfolding" every time you use it. The ChakyaGo ™ is a convenient all-in-one backpack and simple reminder that we can find inner peace anywhere, anytime. Products are athletic-grade and designed to sustain the elements of nature.

Designed simply, for life.

 

ABOUT THE ARTIST

Born on a farm in rural Pennsylvania and raised in a family of artists,  Evanna Shaffer studied Fine Art at the Institute of Art and Design in Colchester, England and graduated Summa Cum Laude from Kutztown University of Pennsylvania. In 2004, she relocated to Los Angeles, CA to apprentice with typographer and designer, David Carson, Art Director for Ray Gun and Surfer Magazine. 

A journey around the world inspired the idea for the ChakyaGo™ and Chakya; a lifestyle brand that links meditation to movement through color and sound. A certified yoga instructor, Evanna is a guest speaker at Yoga Journal events and contributes to industry journals on mindfulness meditation and chakras. 

Her products and curriculum are designed to engage the senses, making meditation fun by helping us reconnect with our inner child and re-discover our gift. 

The ChakyaGo™ gained early popularity with moms and yoga enthusiasts through social media. Early adopters began sharing and the ChakyaTribe Affiliate and Reseller Program was launched in June, 2017 enabling stay-at-home moms and fitness instructors to earn additional income through product sales and shares. To apply, visit: www.chakya.com/tribe

MISSION

We are committed to delivering tools and training that encourage a path to inner peace and self-discovery. 

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

Chakya is entirely self-funded and run by the artist. With your support and action, this movement will spread. Our goal is to encourage the next generation of peace-makers to make mindful choices about the products we consume, and the way we care for ourselves, each other, and the environment. Please help by contributing to our campaign and SHARING with your network.

 

CHALLENGES

On July 4, 2017 fireworks set off a fire at our Los Angeles factory and 2/3 of our inventory was lost.  We are seeking support from the Indiegogo community to help replenish what insurance would not cover in the loss. We also hope to reach a wider audience with a unique product that is multi-purpose, versatile, convenient and carries within it a message of gratitude.

Q/A

Do you ship internationally? Yes. 

How should I care for Chakya products? For backpacks, blankets and cushion covers, we recommend washing and drying in low temperatures. Fabrics may soften with each cycle. Hang dry to extend product life and conserve the earth’s energy. Fabrics may soften with each cycle.  For mats, we suggest taking your mat outside and rinsing down with water. Use a few drops of mild dish soap and sponge to spot clean. Rinse and allow to air dry.

Will I receive by Christmas? Quantities and colors are limited, so we highly recommend ordering now for guaranteed Christmas delivery.

story:
Glotter is THE social network for the travellers. You can find your perfect tour, share what is exciting, what you love in your city and reciprocally get insights on curiosities and happenings from cities you don’t know, which no other guide or app will tell you.

To be able to give as much info as possible, we need an app that supports lots and lots of users. So let's make it happen all together!

Your contribution will let us finish design the app, make it work and known around the world to ensure you, travelers, the best experience possible in any city you visit.

Let us create the best travel experience for you and design for you the most user friendly and trustful app!

Be part of the Glotter community, explore the world, share your experience and help us make it work... and we promise you'll never cross any crowded tourist bus or flag again!!! 

To make us fly and be ready to pack for your next travel, get one of our super cool goodies :

 

For EUR 20.- Just  because our app is great and you know it and because you want to be the first to use it! 

For EUR 50.- Get a respectful cotton  string bag for your travel Schnick-Schnack.

For EUR 150. - Look like an eco-friendly Star and get a top trendy pair of sustainable sunglasses made of recycled ocean's plastic.

For EUR 350.-  Stand out from the crowd on the tarmac thanks to this amazing personalized suitcase with your name on it.

For EUR 2’500 be our guest, we'll organize for you an all inclusive (3-5 days) travel in these cities (New York, Amsterdam, London, Barcelona, Vienna, Singapore). 

If you contribute you will also be personally informed about the app launch, and in the meantime Glotter will give you a hot tip for your next trip!

Feel free to just donate without expecting anything except our infinite gratitude !
story_txt: Glotter is THE social network for the travellers. You can find your perfect tour, share what is exciting, what you love in your city and reciprocally get insights on curiosities and happenings from cities you don’t know, which no other guide or app will tell you.To be able to give as much info as possible, we need an app that supports lots and lots of users. So let's make it happen all together!Your contribution will let us finish design the app, make it work and known around the world to ensure you, travelers, the best experience possible in any city you visit.Let us create the best travel experience for you and design for you the most user friendly and trustful app!Be part of the Glotter community, explore the world, share your experience and help us make it work... and we promise you'll never cross any crowded tourist bus or flag again!!! To make us fly and be ready to pack for your next travel, get one of our super cool goodies : For EUR 20.- Just  because our app is great and you know it and because you want to be the first to use it! For EUR 50.- Get a respectful cotton  string bag for your travel Schnick-Schnack.For EUR 150. - Look like an eco-friendly Star and get a top trendy pair of sustainable sunglasses made of recycled ocean's plastic.For EUR 350.-  Stand out from the crowd on the tarmac thanks to this amazing personalized suitcase with your name on it.For EUR 2’500 be our guest, we'll organize for you an all inclusive (3-5 days) travel in these cities (New York, Amsterdam, London, Barcelona, Vienna, Singapore). If you contribute you will also be personally informed about the app launch, and in the meantime Glotter will give you a hot tip for your next trip!Feel free to just donate without expecting anything except our infinite gratitude !

story:
Short Summary

I started my career opening and managing restaurants for a decade after graduating from NYU.  For the last 20 years I was a project director for a public media company.  After they gave me 2 months’ notice, I visited a big box store and needed to use the restroom.  I walked into the stall and thought, “There has to be a better way!”  And the SCMITT was born.  The trademark name came from the words Super Cleaning Mitts.

There is nothing like it available in the marketplace and I thought there are probably a few more people like me that do not like contacting germs, dirt and filth in public areas. 

As a contributor you can be part of this ground floor company with other new projects in the pipeline using the patented mitt as the base for a foundation for protection.

Also, you will be listed on the website with your name (or anonymously), city and state as part of your perks package.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for just under 60K to cover manufacturing, legal and regulatory obligations. The product design, graphics, packaging and testing is complete, and manufacturing has already begun. The perks would include one of each retail SCMITTS product (Home Container and Portable Packets) from the first production batch and your name (city,state) on the Contributor page of www.CleanFreakLLC.com  If the goal is not reached, your funds will go to the manufacturing of the two products and you will still receive your products.


The Impact

An empty container for home use (or a baby changing bag) is BPA-free and food safe, so I am hopeful that buyers will reuse the stackable containers for organizing small items such as nut and bolts in the garage, goldfish snacks or crayons for the kids on the road.  The containers can also be used to make great arts and crafts projects and keep them out of landfills.

Risks & Challenges

For the past two years I have been working with CAD designers, graphic artists, prototyping companies and searched for the perfect partner to handle all the logistics of manufacturing.   
I believe strongly in this product and with a contract secured for production it will be successful.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Do not forget to inform your friends and family by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for being part of this new clean revolution.

SCMITTS: Clean, Reinvented!

Sincerely yours,
Joe Hagen
Founder and CEO

story:
Visit GoFindMe website: www.aiblue.com

 

Outdoor Adventures

One of the biggest challenges for outdoor activities is undoubtedly the communication and safety problem in the wild. GoFindMe comes as a good assistant, by allowing you to split and group up later easily, interact efficiently and explore safely. 

Crowded Events

Attending crowded events can be full of frustration, when the network is congested with too many users and you find it really hard to describe where you are or find your peers. With GoFindMe, you can connect with your peers instantly and find each other quickly. 

Traveling Abroad

Whether you're on a business or family trip abroad, communication is most crucial. GoFindMe saves you the hassle of buying a SIM card and enables you to stay in touch without worrying about roaming charges, making international communication a lot cheaper and easier.

Emergency Situations

During emergency situations when the grid has been crippled and network towers destroyed, GoFindMe gives preppers and survivalists a critical, potentially life-saving off-grid communication network, making the search-and-rescue work smooth and convenient.

 

 

Real-time Location Tracking

Track each other instantly by real-time position, distance, direction and trace display. Connect with your group and find every group member easily at all times. 

Off-grid Chat via Text & Voice

Send texts, locations & pre-recorded voice messages to your people even without cell service, making communication a lot easier. No worry about message security since it’s all encrypted.​

One Button Emergency SOS

GoFindMe SOS button allows you to send an emergency alarm to other members, even if the paired mobile fails. Others can find the best route to you by shared traces or by the maps.

Automatic Trace Record

Traces are saved automatically, which help you find the correct direction to go back to where you come from if you don’t remember the way going back, e.g. when hiking in the woods.     ​

Link up Group Activities

 

Set up Customized Safe Zone

Preset a variably sized virtual circle and receive alerts with flashing light and voice broadcasting once anyone leaves that circle, which ensures that no one wanders too far away.​

Expand Communication Range by Mesh Network

Turn on Mesh in the App to relay messages among all members when you share locations or send SOS,  enabling you to connect over greater distances and reach out-of-range recipients.

Waterproof, Dustproof, Shockproof & Weather-resistant

IP67-rated dustproof and watertight. Being robustly engineered, it is shockproof, and stands up to extreme weather——no trouble handling temperatures ranging from -4°F to 140°F.​

Built-in Accurate GPS Module

Integrated GPS module enables independent location tracking with an accuracy of 3-5 meters. Moreover, you can locate it easily by the tracking record even if the device itself is lost.​

Free Offline Maps

Download high-resolution offline maps, whether geographical or topographical, and then plan your trips with detailed paths and contours, totally without any need of cell coverage.​ 

Ultra Portable

Coming with a convenient strap, GoFindMe is super easy to wear, even for your kids or pets. Being lightweight, small and compact, it helps you travel light.​

Stable & User-friendly App

GoFindMe seamlessly pairs to a companion iOS and Android App. The intuitive interface is quite simple, and it works stably in good speed and response time.

Keep an Eye on Your Loved Ones

GoFindMe is a nice and discrete way to help keep an eye on the pets, the kids, the elderly, or the people with special needs (such as the ones who suffer from Alzheimer's Disease), giving them the freedom to explore and experience the exciting world on their own. ​

Works Anywhere Under the Open Sky

Working range is up to 5 miles (8 km) in your line of sight, 3 miles (5 km) in the downtown. 

High capacity rechargeable battery allows you to use it for 72 hours upon one single charge.

FCC & CE & IC approved, tune to proper frequency band and power output based on country.

 

Taking advantage of the built-in GPS modules and the low-power wide-area network LoRa technology, GoFindMe devices work independently by creating a localized network between all users within range, without needing any cellular network or Wi-Fi.

✧ When turned on, GoFindMe devices keep receiving GPS signals from a range of satellites to obtain latest location information. 

✧ Nearby GoFindMe devices will join in a default group automatically. You can also create a new group code to encrypt your communication.

✧ GoFindMe devices in the same group transmit all data (GPS coordinates, texts, voice messages, SOS, etc.) via LoRa technology.

✧ Install GoFindMe app, pair GoFindMe device with smartphone via Bluetooth, and download offline maps of the target area before you go. 

——Now it’s up and running! You can start to check locations and communicate with other group members freely.

 

GoFindMe GPS Tracker*1, Attachment Strap*1, Micro USB Cable*1

 

 

 

At AIBLUE, many of us are outdoor enthusiasts ourselves. We love exploring the backcountry and experiencing the thrill of adventures, but we truly don’t like it when we have difficulty staying in communication and finding each other when there's low-to-no cell coverage. Aiming to offer an all-around tracking & communication solution to outdoor adventurers, and to the larger group of people engaged in all kinds of off-grid activities, we created GoFindMe.

We have confidence in GoFindMe, which is the result of combined efforts of our Product, Design, Engineering, Software Development and QA team, on the basis of deep understanding on users’ problems and needs. Our team has tested GoFindMe a number of times in different terrains with reliable performance results. Moreover, to get a fresh and unbiased perspective from end users, we had also worked with beta testers to identify possible flaws and improve accordingly to ensure what we bring consumers is a ready-for-market product.

We choose crowdfunding before we shift into commerce, because it provides us a great opportunity to work with early adopters first, so we may receive more valuable feedback in the fastest way; and in return, we’d like to reward our early fans with special discounts. Currently, prototype has been turned to MASS PRODUCTION, and FCC & CE & IC(certifications required for international shipping) are completed, so the most exciting thing is that all orders will be shipped out really fast! 

 

 Update: Now all orders were shipped out as promised:

story:
Short Summary

We are all dependent on power. Often times we want to take some with us. Generators are clunky, USB Power Banks simply don't provide enough, and battery-based Power Stations are simply too heavy. 

Our goal is to provide a significant amount of energy (400Whr) without any unnecessary weight or size. As a bonus of our technology, the MicroRaptor 400 is also completely silent and splash-proof!

Your contribution will help us begin mass-producing the MR400 and provide powerful, yet small Power Stations around the United States and the world! 

The developed technology is a stepping stone to next-generation power grids that will be based on DC voltage, which is proven to be more efficient and reliable than existing AC-based power grids.

Yellow Power Systems is funded by Anton Bakker, a veteran in the Power Electronics Industry with over 25 years of experience in IC Design and Production. Anton holds a Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from Delft University in the Netherlands. 

Judith Bakker is our head of Marketing and Sales and she is pursuing a BSc degree in Aerospace Engineering at San Jose State University.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your funds will kick start production of the MR400, which is the world's first High-Voltage (120V) DC-based Power Station. Prototypes of the MR400 are currently being beta-tested and the goal of this campaign is to produce 50-100 products to gauge user experience with this new concept that could define future microgrids. 

Our technology enables the removal of inefficient DC-AC converters and cooling. Resulting in lower weight, smaller size, and higher efficiency. To give you a few numbers: The MR400 is half the weight and half the size of its closest competitor of similar power capacity, while at the same time being 15 times more efficient! (The MR400 has an efficiency of 99%, while competitors are typically at 85%)

If you decide to fund us, you will receive an MR400 with a 20% rebate and up to $100 in accessories that we have carefully selected for you that work perfectly with our technology.

 

The Impact

Renewable energy is the way to go for a better future in this world. All engineers and scientists agree that homes and microgrids should be based on DC instead of AC. By funding us or buying our Power Station you will contribute to a better environment, while at the same time own a piece of equipment that is twice as good as anything else that is on the market today. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The MR400 development has taken 4 years and is on its fifth prototype and has been proven functional and useful by a handful of users and beta testers. It is now ready for mass production and we believe it is ready to be shown to a bigger audience.  We use high-quality, original Samsung 35-E batteries that are used in numerous e-bikes that are mass-produced in the USA. 

We also give a 1-year replacement and a 5-year life-time warranty on this first batch of our product.  

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to help is to fund us by buying an MR400. However, if you don't have the funds available, you can also support us by spreading the word and informing your friends who might be interested in owning this piece of equipment! It is a lifesaver during a blackout, a great upgrade for a camping trip, and a perfect tool for professional use when no electricity is readily available.

story:
ParaBatur Modular Water Storage System

Patents Pending!!! ParaBatur.com

Hi, I'm Gavin, Founder and Proprietor of ParaBatur LLC.

I'm a US Navy and Marine Corps Veteran that has traveled to every continent (except Antarctica), and lived on three. I've never really worried about manmade or natural disasters before I became a father. I never considered trading in my "lone wolf" credentials for a reliance on neighbors, until I completed my Masters in Resilient Communities. And I certainly never thought about preparing in terms of water, food, and medicine, with a perspective on young children or the elderly.

This is the founding principle and drive of ParaBatur: blend "preparation" with mainstream needs and customers.

Our first project, the Modular Water Storage System, is inspired by my father preparing for a hurricane by stocking up on thin, plastic, one-gallon water jugs from a "big box" store. "Why so many small jugs," I asked.

"I'm 76 years-old, dumb ass...how many 5 gallon jugs do you think I can carry?" was his reply. 

Touché.

 

The Next Step

ParaBatur is working with a cutting edge design and engineering firm that helps develop not only the best product, but also one ready for large-scale production. Additionally, the firm can produce the first run, in-house, allowing for complete vertical integration of the process. And...allowing for the entire system to Made in the USA!

After several Covid conference calls, the owner provided me with a quote (attached below).

I've included a copy in the spirit of transparency and to better explain the monetary goal: ~$14,000 from 3D model to rapid prototype, $1,000 for cost overrun, and $5,000 to produce the first run of the Modular Water Storage System.

 

Initial Design and Inspiration

The design process started with a number of sketches in order to play with the idea of nesting crates for stacking large amounts of water; however, also creating a way for the easy use of small amounts during an emergency, while camping, or a day at the soccer fields.

Additionally, the large mouth allows for long-term storage of dry, bulk foods, oils, and dehydrated/freeze-dried foods (recommend adding food-grade silica packets).

Finally, I handed over my drafting sketches to a CAD friend in order to create easier-to-read 2D models (see below). 

With these in hand, I reached out to a Swedish engineer who owns and runs his own industrial design and engineering firm. After hashing out my goals for the project, he excitedly jumped onboard and is patiently waiting to start.

The exterior crate, will be fashioned from a highly durable polymer; the primary functions being to hold the water modules and protect them for the elements.

The interior modules will be fashioned from a pba-free polymer and nest within the protective crate.

I've also included a 3D representation showing the bottom of the Module Jug; as you can see the lip will nest inside the recess on top of another jug. The crate also has this integrated feature.

 

Risks, Challenges, and Rewards

This design and engineering project is in great hands. The design firm I am using has managed thousands of projects from sketch, to mass production, and for over 20 years. 

Additionally, if we only raise ~$6,000; we will still use that as a deposit (see quote) and move forward, funding the project as required.

The exciting fact is that I won't need to search for another manufacturer or company to produce the final design or the rapid prototypes to ensure the MWSS is ready. Additionally, this scaled prototype will be available as a perk, and an interesting conversation starter, for your office desk or coffee table.

The ultimate goal is to provide our IndieGoGo sponsors with the first run of the MWSS; the same version to be sold in stores and eCommerce sites.

story:
Introduction:

 

 

Problem:

It is known that airplane pockets & backseat tables are the most unsanitary places on an airplane. There is no way to know how the previous passengers use them. With this in mind, it is really hard to have a completely chill & relaxed flight.

 

Solution:

Introducing Co-Air, an airplane hygienic organizer made by antibacterial copper.

We are millions of people looking for the same thing: How to air travel with a clean space and easy access to all personal belongings on board.

We have the solution! Co-Air helps prevent you from touching airplane pockets & seatback tables simply by replacing them. You can now dine with a clean table and access all your in-flight essentials right in front of you, germ-free.
story_txt: Introduction:  Problem:It is known that airplane pockets & backseat tables are the most unsanitary places on an airplane. There is no way to know how the previous passengers use them. With this in mind, it is really hard to have a completely chill & relaxed flight. Solution:Introducing Co-Air, an airplane hygienic organizer made by antibacterial copper.We are millions of people looking for the same thing: How to air travel with a clean space and easy access to all personal belongings on board.We have the solution! Co-Air helps prevent you from touching airplane pockets & seatback tables simply by replacing them. You can now dine with a clean table and access all your in-flight essentials right in front of you, germ-free.

story:
Touch it. Pin it. ACTION. 

 

CubeLamp Overview:

 

Change your Situation with a simple Touch

With just one touch you can change the desired light mode, ranging from 800 Lumens to an Eco-Flash mode for longer runtime. 

 

Reliable & Powerful

Running off a 2000mAh battery, CubeLamp is a 5-watt, high-powered LED designed for adventurers.

 

CubeLamp comes in Two Versions

 

A Simple and Sturdy Design

 

Easy to Use and Easy to Charge

 

Take Your Adventure Anywhere

Snap it in anywhere and everywhere:

your bicycle handlebars

your seat-post

your seat-stay

your backpack

your belt

your jersey pocket

your saddlebag

your dog

your purse

There's nothing you can't attach CubeLamp to. With the versatile GoPro mount you have mounting possibilities you didn't know about.

 

 

BEST SELLING PERK

OTHER PERKS

 

We can't wait to see what adventures you will experience with CubeLamp

story:
​​Nommi is an LTE hotspot with virtual SIM technology and dual wifi for seamless global internet access.

  

 

Nommi keeps your personal data safe and your costs low while giving you access to millions of networks so you always stay connected.

 

 

​Worldwide Use - Nommi's virtual SIM solution removes the need to buy a local SIM in every country you visit or use expensive data roaming. You will be online in 132 countries with fast LTE data and relevant plans. We do also have wi-fi hotspot coverage in 160 countries globally. 

Wifi Optimization - Nommi’s unique dual wifi feature saves your cellular data by seamlessly connecting your device to public wifi networks. It also provides a separate guest wifi network that you can share with family and friends. Lastly, it serves a wifi range extender so you can enjoy wifi in a cozier part of your home.

Smart Charging - Nommi's Power version allows you to charge your phone using its Qi Wireless charger by simply placing your device directly onto the charging pad. No more wall chargers, adaptors or USB ports when you're on the go. It's compatible with all Qi-certified devices so "shoot, my phone battery is dying" syndrome is replaced with a full charge and more online time.

  

 

  

  

Nommi is the world's first hybrid device that provides a new kind of connectivity experience in one sleek and portable design. No need to hassle with SIM cards, carry old-fashioned personal hotspot devices or remember to bring your powerbank. To get online, all you have to do is activate a data plan via the app.

 

 

 

 

 

  

Traveling is exciting, but often stressful having to worry about data vs. wifi coverage, roaming fees, and whether or not you’ll be able to contact friends or family. Nommi was designed to solve these added stresses, so there’s little to no change in how you move, communicate, or search in your everyday life.

   

Nommi offers high quality, global connection for all travel lovers.

While traveling, Nommi allows you to focus on the ‘travel’ part. Nommi acts as a wireless hotspot for all your devices in over 132 countries. This means wherever you are traveling, you can stop stressing about buying, activating, or inserting SIM cards. Of course, if you already have your favorite data plan from a local operator, feel free to use your SIM. Simply insert it into the micro slot on the side of Nommi like you would on an iPhone.

The easier way is to use a data package via the app and ditch the SIM. That’s right, as soon as you land you can post your selfie from the plane, email your boss or text your Mom with zero lapse in connection!

   

Customize your Data - Nommi’s user friendly app makes it easy to update and keep track of your usage.

With the Nommi app, you can easily access and manage your device from your smartphone.

You will be online in 132 countries with fast LTE data and relevant plans. We do also have wi-fi hotspot coverage in 160 countries globally. 
   

Prevent unauthorized access to your network and conceal personal data.

By default, Nommi is configured to automatically encrypt all your data through secure servers when you connect to public wifi networks. Although VPN brings extra security, it can make connections slower, so feel free to disable it via the app for the networks you trust.

 

  

 


 

Making the most of your networks - Nommi only offers the best wifi connection for fast downloading and browsing.

 

Data is expensive and constantly searching for a local wifi network is exhausting. With Nommi, you’ll never miss out on a strong wifi connection speed and the best part is, you’re simultaneously saving money and data.

  

Nommi gives you unlimited access to it's worldwide Wi-Fi database and tests surrounding wifi networks before taking you off 4G. 

Nommi’s dual-wifi feature is on by default and constantly scans available wifi networks as a background process. When it finds a quality wifi network, it will check to see if our crowdsourced password database contains a password for it. If a password matches, Nommi will try to connect, testing the speed of the network without interrupting your current cellular connection. Once everything checks out, Nommi initializes VPN over the network, tests it one more time and only then starts to route your traffic over public wifi. Ultimately this feature saves your cellular data allowance. As a Nommi user, not only do you have access to a large existing database of passwords, but you can also help curate this global database and share passwords with others by adding them via the app.

 

Keep your personal network private but still share Nommi with friends.

Similar to professional wifi routers, Nommi will provide two wifi networks (SSID) connections. The primary is your own private wifi network, secured by a strong password and encryption, to which you connect your own devices: laptop, ipad, smart watch, printer, etc. The secondary is a guest wifi network made specifically for your friends and colleagues. This guest wifi allows them to connect without password, but only after the app has notified you and asked for permission. Never again will you have to read the alphabet off the back of your router or spell out complex symbols for your visiting friends. When they are connected, they will be isolated from your primary private network space. Via the app, you’ll also be able to see who is currently connected and how much data they’ve used.
 

Your long distance relationship solved - Nommi provides a wider reach for low signal areas.

It’s fairly common to have low wifi signal depending on where your home router is located. Let’s say you get bad connection in your room because your router is downstairs. Nommi will automatically extend to the fastest available nearby network, doubling your wifi signal range. You can also specify which signal you want to extend to in the “Wi-fi Extender” section via the Nommi app. This feature is useful not only at home, but more importantly at hotels, where you only get good wifi signal near the door, because there’s 1 wifi router per floor. Leave Nommi halfway between you and the wired router location and enjoy strong wifi signal.

 

  

 

  

 

Nommi keeps up with the latest technology by combining power and connectivity in one device.

No need to carry that old-fashioned personal hotspot device or a power bank any more. The Nommi Power version combines both.

 

Place and charge - Remove the burden of disconnecting and inserting a charging cable every time you need you pick up your phone.

Charge your phone using our Qi charger by simply placing your device directly onto the Nommi Power charging pad. Compatible with all Qi-enabled devices, there is no need to plug your device into a wall charger or USB port. It’s extremely convenient and avoids having to buy new USB cables every time your old one breaks. Qi wireless charging is supported by most Android flagship smartphones (Samsung Galaxy, Google Nexus and Pixel, etc) and Apple’s latest iPhone 8 and iPhone X models.

 

Nommi’s strong battery is intended to keep your charge high over long periods of time.

Nommi’s Slim version has a high performance 3500mAh battery that can deliver more than 16 hours of battery life when 4G/wifi sharing. Nommi’s Power version has a 10000mAh battery that can operate around 48 hours with 4G/wifi sharing. When using the wireless charging function on the Power version, the battery will last long enough to charge your iPhone twice and still work for 24 hours as a 4G/wifi sharing hotspot.
 

Nommi is the perfect accessory for your next trip. 

Finally, the bulky, boring brick that we know as a Power Bank has been revamped to one sleek, portable design. Nommi is convenient and comfortable to hold in your hand and still flat enough to put your smartphone on it. Both the Slim and the Power version are lightweight and compact, designed to take up minimal space in your already packed suitcase, carry-on or purse.

 

  

Which model is right for you?

   

  

 

  

   

   

 

We both [Alyona and Kairat] love traveling. As soon as you exit the airport doors, you smell new scents, feel the temperature, and hear street sounds. You see what people look like, how they dress and know you’re about to have a new life experience. All the feels aside, we also like to stay hyper connected with easy access to our email and social media. It’s the first thing we check in the morning and the last thing we scroll through before bed. When the plane lands, we want to be connected instantly.

 

Why wasn’t there a device that kept us connected abroad?

Kairat and I met for the first time at an IT conference where we discussed this recurring issue and so, the idea of Nommi was born.

 

  

What about one that is equally useful at home to avoid multiple devices?

We spent hours brainstorming the idea in cafes, with friends, even boring our relatives with talks of Nommi. Finally, we decided to start a business to figure out if we were the only ones with this problem.

    

 

We ended up learning there are plenty of people like us - people who are not satisfied with the current solutions, who don’t want to buy a monthly data plan when coming to a country for just 3 days, who want to pay just for what they use. We brought up a team around the concept and did tests for more than a year.

 

  

Now we’re here, launching our crowdfunding campaign with our first working prototype which you can check out live in action below:

 

 

For more detailed information on how to use Nommi, check out our educational videos below. We thank you for your support and are extremely excited to share Nommi with you!

 

  


7+ years of experience in corporate segment, with focus on eCom/digital. Works on popularizing of STEM among women. Marketing and business development expertise.
 


MIPT graduate, 15+ years in ICT industry, started first company 12 years ago, now leading KZ smart-city company, 100+ staff. Telecom, hardware and software expertise.

 


Interested in hardware from 6 years old. FInalist of international math/robotics competition in Sweden. Degree in IT and certificate at Korean UNIST with the focus on architecture and hardware.

 


Degree in IT, additional certification at Malaysia Multimedia University. Manages corporate (some are Forbes 500) clients within multiple CIS countries.

 


5+ years in design. Participant of Salone Satellite Moscow (2014,2015,2017), Salone Satellite Milan (2015), London Design Fair (2016). Her style focuses on sensuality and minimalism.

 

 

 

  

 

  

How does Nommi work?

It acts as usual personal hotspot (mifi), but without need to get new local sim card when you travel. Also it saves your data plan allowance by routing your traffic over wifi networks. The Power version has 10000 battery to provide power bank with with QI wireless charging.

 

Do I have to buy a monthly subscription in order to use Nommi?

No, not at all. Besides, if for any reason you don’t want that option, you can still insert your data sim card into the standard sim slot that Nommi has, or use Nommi only as dual wifi repeater and range extender (plus powerbank feature in Powerbank version). Please keep in mind, that if you've purchased Nommi via crowdfunding, we provide you with updated wifi passwords in our crowdsourced database free for life. In short, you can still get better wifi experience even without any subscription.

What if I want to return the device?

 Your device has warranty policy and if there's anything broken/missing or there's other case indicated in the policy - please reach out to us on this. 

 

Are there hidden extra/fees I should know about?

No fees from our side. However, you may still want to keep your current phone SIM, especially for GSM phone calls and texts. Your current operator will still charge you, but you can lower your bill by switching to a smaller data plan.

 

How does the Nommi Power wireless charging work?

Charge your phone using built-in Qi charger by simply placing your device directly onto the Nommi charging pad. No need to plug your device into a wall charger or USB port. Compatible with all Qi-enabled devices. (iPhone 8 and X, Samsung S5-S8, Note 5-Note 8. Full list here: http://qi-wireless-charging.net/qi-enabled-phones/ )
 

How many devices can we connect to Nommi?
Up to 5 devices - for Slim Nommi and up to 8 devices for Power Nommi
 

What is the top speed for the device?
Max. Wireless Data Rate - 150Mbps

 

How long does your device battery last?

Nommi Power has 10000mAh battery - 48 hours of non-stop hotspot operation;
Nommi Slim has 3500mAh battery - 16 hours of non-stop hotspot operation;
What is the weight of your device?
Nommi Power - 250g
Nommi Slim -  150g
 

How long does it take to fully charge the device?

Nommi Power - about 5 hours
Nommi Slim - about 2 hours

 

How far does the wifi range extender go?

Generally speaking, Nommi doubles your current wifi range. It will catch another network at 30-50 meters if no concrete walls between and interference (other closed wifis around) is not too much. For example, if your current home wifi router is on the 1st floor, covers the 2nd floor nicely but doesn’t work on the 3rd floor at all, then put Nommi at 2nd floor, it will cover 3rd floor nicely.
 

Which 3G and 4G frequencies, bands and technologies device support?

Support TD-LTE/LTE FDD/WCDMA/GSM;
Bands: B1/B2/B3/B4/B7/B17/B20/B40/B41; 850/900/1900/2100; 850/900/1800/1900
    

How do I manage the device and data package from the mobile app? 

In the main menu of nommi mobile app you can see the data traffic consumption, data package, battery life and connected devices.

 

How much will shipping cost? How will my order be shipped?

Free shipping to the US and 20$ for international shipping. It will be shipped directly from the factory to your door.
 

Can I take Nommi on an airplane?

Yes, it can be with you in your carry-on or checked luggage.

Is there a Warranty?

We will carefully test our devices before shipping. But if it is malfunctioning somehow and our mobile app’s advices doesn’t help, we’ll be happy to send you a new device. Just download and print warranty envelope sticker from our website, put your nommi to this envelope, and drop it at nearest Fedex office. We will send you a new device. Standard warranty is 12 months. Good news that it is automatically renewed as long as you’re subscriber to our  monthly global data plan.

story:
What is BaseCamp

Yes, one or two people can go off hammocking by themselves. But what of hammocking with ALL of your friends? Scoop up the dog! Invite the mailman! BaseCamp is a hammock experience for extroverts. String it up at a picnic! Bring it to the park! Fill it up at farmers markets, summer camps, beach parties, camping trips, anywhere that people gather and connect.

The Problem

HOW'S THE WEATHER OVER THERE? ...it's not always possible to hang multiple hammocks close together.

Get your feet off my face ...two people per hammock is limiting in a group and can be a bit too snug.

Who brought the ratchet? ...platform hammocks and tents hold more people but are heavy, less portable, and require tools.

The higher you hang the farther you fall ...Stacking hammocks can be inconvenient and dangerous.  

Why BaseCamp is Awesome

Like beards, BIGGER is just BETTER when it comes to hammocking! You have more space. You can fit more people. BaseCamp only weighs as much as a box of wine (56oz) and is the size of a watermelon. Yet it holds 550lbs!

You can fit...

3 full grown burly men OR

4 recently reconciled opposing teammates of a beer pong tournament OR

5 glittery girls with flowers in their hair OR

6 middle school students and all of their angst OR

Too many kindergartners!

 

Our Handmade Advantage

Our hammocking community is empowering women and their families in Northern Thailand. We are a small operation, employing a team of seamstresses making each hammock by hand from the comfort of their own homes. No mass factory manufacturing, no child labor, and no outsourcing...we operate completely in-house!

We focus on cottage-construction techniques rather than mass factory production. The result is superior craftsmanship and a ripple effect of positivity and empowerment. Good vibes from our community to yours! 

 

Featured In:

 

Materials & Hardware

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Rewards  

 

"No to Plastic" Reusable Tote Bag

  • Upcycled nylon leftover from hammock making - very strong!
  • Packs into 2-inch pouch - can put on keys
  • Additional pocket on each bag
  • Weight: 1-1.5oz
  • Carrying Capacity: 20 kg - 44 lbs
  • Single Strap (2.9ft x 1ft)
  • Market Bag (1.9ft x 1.4ft)

1 Person Hammock

  • Weight: 11oz
  • Weight Capacity: 350lbs
  • Unfolded Dimensions: (L x W) 8.2ft x 5ft
  • Material: 70D high tenacity nylon taffeta
  • Steel S - Hooks: Lighter weight
  • Adjustable webbing tree straps

2 Person Hammock

  • Weight: 22oz
  • Weight Capacity: 450lbs
  • Unfolded Dimensions: (L x W) 9.8ft x 6.5ft
  • Material: 70D high tenacity nylon taffeta
  • Steel Carabiners: Smooth no snag - won't tear material!
  • Adjustable webbing tree straps

See how to hang the 1 & 2 Person Hammocks

 

And the new kid on the block...

BaseCamp!!!

  • Weight: 56oz
  • Weight Capacity: 550lbs
  • Unfolded Dimensions: (L x W) 21ft x 12ft
  • Material: 70D high tenacity nylon taffeta
  • Steel Carabiners: Smooth no snag - won't tear material!

  • Adjustable webbing tree straps

 

What Folks are Saying

What is Flying Squirrel Outfitters?

Flying Squirrel Outfitters is a small camping hammock manufacturer working to create positive social impact by helping the world relax!  

We operate in a small garment manufacturing village in Thailand where seamstresses generally work in factories that recognize minimum wage laws. However, some women are physically unable to work in factories or simply can’t leave home for 10+ hours each day. Some local garment manufacturers will hire stay-at-home seamstresses knowing they can pay exceptionally low wages almost unnoticed – sometimes paying as little as 8 cents per pair of pants sewn, well below Thailand's legal minimum.

Flying Squirrel Outfitters strives to break this cycle of limited opportunity by creating jobs that are sustainable, location and schedule flexible, and fairly compensated. At-home hammock making has become a growing source of income for our team of seamstresses and their families. As our company grows, we look forward to expanding these opportunities for more women in the village.

Rest easy in your hammock knowing that the hands that made it are thriving as a result of its creation.

 

 

   

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Flying Squirrel Founder

Hi, I’m Brian. Four years ago I quit my comfy job in Seattle, sold my stuff, and headed abroad seeking something new. While traveling, I fell in love with Chiang Mai, Thailand and decided to sink some roots. I began working with local seamstresses, making travel hammocks for tourists. What started as an idea became an experiment and grew into a passion project called Flying Squirrel Outfitters.

I’m inspired by travel and the outdoors. Seeking lush natural beauty has guided me through many stages of my life, including the move to Thailand. I am also inspired by ‘do good’ companies that are defined by their impact. They challenge the status quo and raise standards of quality and compassion. Flying Squirrel Outfitters combines my love of the planet with my love of the people on the planet.

I have a background in marketing and sales at a prominent startup in Seattle. I have personally been managing the Flying Squirrel team and operations for the past year and a half. It has been a wild ride and an enormous learning experience with lots of good vibes along the way.

 

Asking for Help

We are enticed by the vision of GIANT hammocks hanging all over the world. We are asking for help because our small company doesn't yet have the capacity to launch such a capital-intensive new product alone. The hammocks purchased in this campaign will allow us to buy materials in bulk and offer more opportunity to our team of seamstresses. One small step for the hammocking community, one GIANT step for Flying Squirrel Outfitters!   

If you are not into hammocks ...what's wrong with you? Just kidding, We are sure you have your reasons (childhood trauma from being forgotten in a hammock on a family vacation?). But you can still help! 

Sharing our campaign page with your friends is massively helpful!

   

 

 

Risks & Challenges

If we don’t reach our goal, we absolutely will fulfill all items ordered.  There may, however, be delays depending on what is possible with the amount we raise. We will keep you updated and promise quick and clear communication.

In the case that we do reach our goal (fingers crossed!), there will still be risks and challenges. We have been in business for over a year, we are not so idealistic that we are not prepared.

In either case, we are committed to getting this right, that's a promise! In the name of preparation, here are a few risks and challenges that we've already thought of:

 

Manufacturing Delays

• We've already done large production runs before so we're confident in our seamstresses and team to continue to follow our finely oiled production line; however, securing the material from our sources can have unforeseen setbacks, but generally not.

• We stay in constant communication with our team from prototype to production to assure the highest quality end product.

• We always work on-site with our seamstresses for new products to resolve any challenges quickly and efficiently.

Shipping Delays

• We exclusively use DHL Express when shipping from Thailand which offers us the lowest cost per piece we could find at our modest sales volume. They have been tried and true so we believe we should continue to receive the same level of service.

• We will do our best to ship to the earliest backers first!

Lost Packages

• We’ve had some experience shipping products internationally, which means we know things can get lost. Again, we believe DHL will continue to provide the highest level of service in the event of a missing package - no worries, we’ll make it right!

Please email us at support@flyingsquirreloutfitters.com if you have any direct questions or concerns.
story_txt:
What is BaseCamp
Yes, one or two people can go off hammocking by themselves. But what of hammocking with ALL of your friends? Scoop up the dog! Invite the mailman! BaseCamp is a hammock experience for extroverts. String it up at a picnic! Bring it to the park! Fill it up at farmers markets, summer camps, beach parties, camping trips, anywhere that people gather and connect.

The Problem
HOW'S THE WEATHER OVER THERE? ...it's not always possible to hang multiple hammocks close together.
Get your feet off my face ...two people per hammock is limiting in a group and can be a bit too snug.
Who brought the ratchet? ...platform hammocks and tents hold more people but are heavy, less portable, and require tools.
The higher you hang the farther you fall ...Stacking hammocks can be inconvenient and dangerous.  

Why BaseCamp is Awesome
Like beards, BIGGER is just BETTER when it comes to hammocking! You have more space. You can fit more people. BaseCamp only weighs as much as a box of wine (56oz) and is the size of a watermelon. Yet it holds 550lbs!
You can fit...
3 full grown burly men OR
4 recently reconciled opposing teammates of a beer pong tournament OR
5 glittery girls with flowers in their hair OR
6 middle school students and all of their angst OR
Too many kindergartners!




 
Our Handmade Advantage

Our hammocking community is empowering women and their families in Northern Thailand. We are a small operation, employing a team of seamstresses making each hammock by hand from the comfort of their own homes. No mass factory manufacturing, no child labor, and no outsourcing...we operate completely in-house!
We focus on cottage-construction techniques rather than mass factory production. The result is superior craftsmanship and a ripple effect of positivity and empowerment. Good vibes from our community to yours!

story:
The roadtrip 

Its the adventure that resonates with all of us. The roadtrip is the beauty of stepping into the unknown, exploring unfamiliar surrounds and going just that little bit further beyond your horizon. Its meeting new cultures and contexts with openness and curiosity. Its that sketchy wrong turn you did that ends up being the best choice you ever made. The roadtrip is that crammed space you hate, but with the right people is that much sweeter.

Its that journey that ends up being just as good as the destination.

But unfortunately, roadtrips come to an end. until now..

The What

We are Once in Cape Town, an all-star South African hostel, and we're creating the worlds first never ending social road trip. "Once on a Roadtrip". Its a touring hostel bus that will journey through South Africa. A hop on, hop off style bus (sleeping 16) where guests can book online depending on where and when its travelling. The routes will be designed around the most amazing destinations, cultural initiatives, NGO projects, festivals and events. 

The Why

We are firm believers that travel is a powerful medium that can bridge the gap between different cultures, people backgrounds and their passions. Travel lets you flirt with life in ways you never have before. So we want to cultivate the power of bringing like minded people together in the same space, to create and leave a positive impact on the areas they travel in, the people they meet and ultimately themselves.  

The How

To make this the social incubator that bridges different people, cultures, places and events together, we need your support!

"Once on a Roadtrip" will be a cultural catalyst that will explore how travellers can leave a positive impact and still see the many sites and sounds that South Africa has to offer. 

We will curate our year round trips, based on up and coming cultural projects, festivals, NGO partnerships, community initiatives and popular destinations. The guests on board will get the opportunity to assist the projects we partner with and bring their own skill sets, knowledge and passions. 


The Need

We are seeking help from you! from the eager travellers to the well travelled. We need you to make this dream come alive.

  1. We need $35,000 to purchase the first functioning bus prototype in South Africa (April 2015)

  2. We need to Transform it from a 60 seater "School Bus" to a 16 bed "Social Roadtrip Bus" (June 2015)

  3. We need fully functioning basics onboard. Eg. Beds, co-working space, kitchen, toilet, shower, water supplies etc

  4. We need to employ a full time bus driver and a guide/facilitator

  5. We need to design, develop and curate impactful routes and partnerships

  6. We need to design and produce a fully functional website and booking system

This is a passion project we believe resonates with travellers and change makers alike. To help us with this cause we have designed some perks for people around the world to support the project. Everything from coffees, rituals, accommodation, roadtrips and more.

Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute, you can still help us out by spreading the word though social media and using the hashtag #onceonaroadtrip. Like us on facebook, twitter and instagram! Post all you favourite photos of roadtrips and spreading positive vibes!

story:
Summary

Hi, Myself Soumya Sumitra, from Pondicherry, India. I'm a Enthusiastic Photographer, doing photography for past three years. I got myself very close towards Kite Aerial Photography.

The idea of this project is to create a major photo-documentary record of Mother Nature and its Landscapes  from Bird Eye View. India is covered with a vast landscapes, Cultural Heritages and wide spread green serenity. This will help me explore the art that lies below the skies and above the land.

Getting inspired from lots of Aerial Photographs takes me to a greater imagination of Earth from a Aerial View. Have you ever Imagined. I believe that I can do this. This what pushes me forward. Financial is my only barrier.

 An so I need your help.

Aerial View either attained by Helicopter or a Unmanned Drone, but I'm doing with a Kite, a large kite that can lift a heavy camera.

This can be made possible by using a Large Kite to lift a camera and make photographs from a high altitude. This is called Kite Aerial Photography.

  • Inexpensive way to reach the altitudes of skies
  • Domestic drones or Quad-copters violate right to privacy 
  • With drones being unmanned flying machines, can malfunction at anytime and can cause severe damage to public.
  • Heli Copters are expensive, burning fuels and hard to attain low altitudes.

It's very harder to get the right materials in India. So everything has to me shipped outside my country.

What have I done till now?


Kite Aerial Photography - Aerial View of Sea Shore Attained by KAP.



For Kite Aerial Photography, all we need is Obliviously a Kite, a Rig that takes the camera, a Radio Controller to control the rig and a Video Transmitter to Frame you picture.
 For all these thing, I took knowledge from various place and managed to make my own rig.

In this way, I have fried two of my radio controllers, some of the motor parts etc. In this ways I have put all my money of around $300, which I  saved for future education. Now I'm out of money to proceed further. This I was doing since a year, bit by bit.
All this needs is a Kite. This rig needs a big kite to lift it off the ground. Together I have also stitched a Rokkaku Kite. All it need is to be get framed.

What  I need?

1. This traditional Chinese kite needs to be framed using sticks. For that I need to get Carbon Fiber Tubes, which is not available in my country. 
2. Stronger kite lines to avoid breaking of line during flight. I have to go for stronger kite lines which can withstand high pound strength.
3. A good Video Transmitter to frame a picture. A video transmitter set will help to downlink the view, what the camera sees.
All these above things a need to be shipped from USA.

What is still need to be done?

1. Built two more kites that suit to different wind condition.
2. Set up a live view downlink from the camera to ground

Expenses Required to Complete the project:

1. Carbon Fiber tubes from goodwinds.com
                 16 pcs - .375" x 40" Pultruded Carbon Tube             -            $172 ($11 each)
2.External Aluminium Ferrules from goodwinds.com
                  16 pcs  - .375" Aluminum Ferrule                                 -             $61($3.8 each)
3. Braided Dacron - Kite Line from goodwinds.com
                         250lb x 3000ft White Braided Dacron               -              $67
4.FPV Kit from hobbyking.com                                                     -               $80
5.Shipping the above products to India + Duty                       -               $125
6. Pekabe Pulley from ebay                                                           -                $50

Transparency: 


EXCEEDING MY GOAL

Exceeding my goal will enable me to:

  • Travel the length and breath of the beauty of the Nature
  • Go forward and make a book on it

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share it with you friends and family. Your help can make me go far and reach my dreams. 
  • Indigogo has simple easy to use tools for sharing take a moment to share with someone you think might like our ideas!

EXCEEDING MY GOAL

Exceeding my goal will enable me to:

Travel the length and breath of the beauty of the Nature

Go forward and make a book on it




Other Ways You Can Help
We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Share it with you friends and family. Your help can make me go far and reach my dreams. 
Indigogo has simple easy to use tools for sharing take a moment to share with someone you think might like our ideas!

story:
We live in a digital time where handwriting is constantly debated in the media and lamented in conversation. Everyone over a certain age learned to write cursive in school, and believe in the power of handwritten communication to capture and evoke the moment. The investment of self is confirmed by taking pen in hand, and still has the power to convince, confirm, and convey authenticity in an entirely personal way. 

Letterform Archive  Nouveau Livre Ecriture La Parmentier engraver

Before printing, texts were all copied in longhand. Books have been mass-produced for the last five hundred years or so, but printing wasn’t the end of handwriting. Beginning in the 16th century, manuals for teaching how to write became best-sellers. A newly emerging scrivener class sprang up to address non-printed documentation: the recording of legal documents, briefs and personal correspondence. Writing manuals discuss ink recipes, paper selection, the cutting of a quill pen and holding it properly. These writing manuals were equal parts part tutorial and illustrated example.

Printed, illustrated manuals enabled scribes to elaborate calligraphic hands of great fluidity and freedom. New lettering styles evolved as a result, in part because an engraver could reproduce even the most exquisite strokes of the writing master's hand. The writing manual was an advertisement for the master’s skills and from the beginning, they embellished, flourished and drew “command of hand” conceits to show off their skill.

Letterform Archive  Palatino writing manuals


I believe that these manuals serve an important function in contemporary design. Today letterforms evolve constantly for new media, but their historic predecessors provide the armature for contemporary lettering and type design. Digital typography is grounded in this history, inheriting the flexibility, beauty and immediacy of hand-wrought communication. 

The Bancroft Library   Palatino's 1588 edition of Compendio del Gran Volume....

However, the cross-over character of these manuals keeps them hidden in libraries and archives. How, exactly, should they be described? Are they published books or art works? Will they be catalogued as publications, or described as engravings? Writing manuals in the collection of the Drawings and Prints division at the Metropolitan Museum of Art are described by the medium: either woodblock or engraved and classification as books. The information is geared towards the image making process, and bibliographic information is second to that. The Bancroft Palatino is the same title and date as the Metropolitan’s copy of Compendio del Gran Volume dell’Art del bene Scrivendi. Finding books in museum print rooms takes a different set of research tools to access them. Their online “catalog” is found in a museum’s art collection catalog, not their library catalog. 

In addition, there are items that cannot be found easily without some additional searching. Libraries are honest in describing misfiled or misidentified material as "lost”. Sometimes a new discovery is as a simple as “finding” what was there all along.

Harry Ransom Center  Neudorfer the Elder


This is where I come in: one part calligrapher, two parts biblio-sleuth, my goal is to track down and document these manuals in US libraries. By researching special collections I plan to document and inventory these calligraphy manuals, laying the groundwork for a much-needed database for researchers, scholars and designers.

And I plan to do it on a motorcycle.

I began riding when I was 13. In my 40s, I realized this was a long-term love; it has become a major part of my life. I regularly ride long distance to library trade shows, exhibitions, and workshops. Riding lets me discover what lies between the major cities I travel to – and to be fully present in those places. It gives me the same feeling of immersion and discovery I get from research as a rare books librarian, calligrapher, and bookbinder. In both pursuits, a lot of the most interesting stuff is hidden in the details. Those details can usually only be uncovered up close and in person.

The Motoscribendi project brings together my greatest passions: books and motorcycles. In the summer of 2015, I’ll combine these seemingly unrelated pursuits by riding across the United States in search of 16th-19th c. writing manuals.

By contributing to the Motoscribendi project, you’ll sign on for the ride of a lifetime and join me in tracking down the location of these hidden writing manuals and copybooks. You will also be contributing to the creation of an online research tool for designers, calligraphers and historians.

Get on and I’ll fill you in on the way!
story_txt:
We live in a digital time where handwriting is constantly debated in the media and lamented in conversation. Everyone over a certain age learned to write cursive in school, and believe in the power of handwritten communication to capture and evoke the moment. The investment of self is confirmed by taking pen in hand, and still has the power to convince, confirm, and convey authenticity in an entirely personal way. 

Letterform Archive  Nouveau Livre Ecriture La Parmentier engraver

Before printing, texts were all copied in longhand. Books have been mass-produced for the last five hundred years or so, but printing wasn’t the end of handwriting. Beginning in the 16th century, manuals for teaching how to write became best-sellers. A newly emerging scrivener class sprang up to address non-printed documentation: the recording of legal documents, briefs and personal correspondence. Writing manuals discuss ink recipes, paper selection, the cutting of a quill pen and holding it properly. These writing manuals were equal parts part tutorial and illustrated example.
Printed, illustrated manuals enabled scribes to elaborate calligraphic hands of great fluidity and freedom. New lettering styles evolved as a result, in part because an engraver could reproduce even the most exquisite strokes of the writing master's hand. The writing manual was an advertisement for the master’s skills and from the beginning, they embellished, flourished and drew “command of hand” conceits to show off their skill.




Letterform Archive  Palatino writing manuals
 


I believe that these manuals serve an important function in contemporary design. Today letterforms evolve constantly for new media, but their historic predecessors provide the armature for contemporary lettering and type design. Digital typography is grounded in this history, inheriting the flexibility, beauty and immediacy of hand-wrought communication. 


The Bancroft Library   Palatino's 1588 edition of Compendio del Gran Volume....However, the cross-over character of these manuals keeps them hidden in libraries and archives. How, exactly, should they be described? Are they published books or art works? Will they be catalogued as publications, or described as engravings? The information is geared towards the image making process, and bibliographic information is second to that. Get on and I’ll fill you in on the way!

story:
About Wild Guide Inc.

Wild Guide Inc. is a media brand dedicated to all things hunting and fishing. It was birthed from the realization that Canadians lack a solid, definitive source for all the hunting and fishing information they seek.

Many people believe that more hunters means fewer animals. We firmly believe that the key to a healthy, sustainable ecology that we can all enjoy, is education. This is why it is so important to us to provide that outlet. We want to see more people living off the land while teaching them ethical practices that will help sustain our animal populations.

Our media outlets will surpass others in the market by providing nothing less than high calibre, informative and educational content including:

  • Multi-species articles from industry professionals including tips, techniques, location info, gear and more.
  • Survival techniques and gear.
  • Gear reviews.
  • Interviews.
  • Reader-submitted stories.
  • Foraging guides.
  • Local outfitter info.
  • Recipes.
  • & MORE

Wild Guide Inc. will launch in 3 different media platforms; Wild Guide Magazine in print and digital formats, Wild Guide TV (initially as a web series) and www.wildguide.ca

We will aim to build an online community for users to connect with other sportsmen/women in their area to chat about and share helpful information.

In short, Wild Guide is taking a 'hands-on' approach where readers and viewers will take away practical information to put to good use in the field.

Our Goal

Our immediate goal is to release the first issue of Wild Guide Magazine on newsstands across Canada, February 2016. We are on track with reaching the deadline. We are asking for your donations to help with production and printing costs.

Our overall objective is to boost the hunting and fishing industry, promote conservation and aid in ensuring sustainable resources by promoting environmentally friendly practices. We want our readers to become better informed hunters and anglers. We also want to create a passion for those who are new to the sport. We aim to tear down peoples inhibitions to hunting and fishing through meaningful, informative, interactive and entertaining media.

Who is Wild Guide Inc.?

Meet Brad McCann and Tony Griffiths, founders of Wild Guide Inc. We are avid outdoorsmen and media professionals, with many years of experience in both fields.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for an initial start up fund of $50,000. This money will allow us to move into full time production of Wild Guide Magazine and Wild Guide TV.

We have some great offers for you based on your donation amount which include:

  • $5 Get the first issue of Wild Guide Magazine
  • $30 Get a 1 year subscription to Wild Guide Magazine
  • $50 Get 2 year subscription to Wild Guide Magazine
  • $500 Receive a lifetime subscription to Wild Guide Magazine
  • $1000 Receive a lifetime subscription and have your name and photo published in the premier issue of Wild Guide Magazine in a special contributors section.

The Impact

Wild Guide Inc. is pro-industry, pro-conservation and pro-environment, which means that your donations will have a vast impact in those areas across Canada. Through our media outlets we will provide information on the following:

  • Canadian travel and tourism industry - which benefits our economy
  • The hunting and fishing industry - which benefits many large and small businesses
  • Conservation - which benefits our wildlife and the sustainability of our ecosystem for generations to come
  • Environmental issues - which benefits everyone

Risks & Challenges

Entering into any business venture has it's inherent risks. We have some unique obstacles we need to cross. These include getting a Canadian magazine distributor to take on our title and getting retailers and wholesalers to place it on their newsstands. We are pleased to announce that we have crossed obstacle #1 by signing an agreement with Coast to Coast Distributors who have taken on our title.

Your donations will enable us to provide an attractive product with high caliber content, helping ensure our success.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. We are always going to be looking for content and your ideas and input are ALWAYS valued. Please feel free to share your ideas, suggestions or stories with us and who knows, maybe you'll end up featured in one of our magazines.

    Another way you can help is by being a social media ambassador for our brand. Please like our facebook page and follow us on twitter and share us with everyone you know.

      www.facebook.com/wildguidecanada

      @wildguidemag

story:
Unconditional mission 

I am 18 years old with a serious passion for mission work. Now with a business and bio-engineering course under my belt, my dream has started taking shape. Burundi is a landlocked country in central Africa. This country has been stuck in a constant cycle of civil war since 1993 due to ethnic violence between the Tutsi-dominated army and armed Hutu rebel groups. Through the fighting, about 550,000 displaced persons have been left without homes and struggle to find just one meal a day. Thus largely depend on international humanitarian assistance. Things in this country have started to turn around with new leadership and a peace agreement. Even with things getting better not a lot is being done by Burundi's government to help the 550,000 displaced people. This is where Unconditional mission’s comes in, we plans to give a home to 40 to 50 kids under the age of 18 or as seen needed. 

Benefactor assumptions

Unconditional missions only needs 30 people on board to give the average annual donation amount of $2,974, that's just $7.65 a day. Yearly cost for food, schooling, and first aid will only take 11 people to be on board to fulfill our yearly needs. We are assuming we will have unseen costs that will become apparent once we are up and running but has yet been accounted for.

Start up cost 

·  Cargo tank-$16,800  
·  Welder-$400  
·  Excavator Rental daily-$45.50
·  Green house Roof-$300  
·  Door/Window-$500  
·  Hammocks-$400  
·  Land-$6,000  
·  Car-$2000  
·  Nonprofit fees-$10,000-$30,000  
·  Food year-$25,000  
·  Medical Equipment-$500  
·  Unexpected-$4000
·  Total -$86,600  
The Impact

Unconditional missions will be a light in the darkest places, helping to care for the orphans of an almost forgotten country. Unconditional missions wants to give the kids a chance to live a stable life, not having to wonder about their safety or how they’re going to get their next meal. Each kid will be sponsored by international humanitarian assistance to provide schooling and other daily life essentials.

Orphanage layout 

The first activity at the orphanage will be to build and operate the new orphanage. The building will be two floors made out of cargo tankers. We will have around 9000 square feet inside of our facility.  

The ground floor will provide the activity rooms, a nursery, kitchen, dining room, study room, sleeping area, and office/first-aid room. The second level will provide a garden and additional storage. 

Funds Management

Unconditional mission’s guarantees that all funds donated are devoted to pre-authorized projects or activities that you as benefactors have a contributing voice in. Donations can be given through our online website, LinkedIn, Indiegogo or directly to unconditional mission account. In order to keep accountability with the resources given, benefactors will have the ability to help decide where the money is spent.

Trends in Burundi

·  Infant and maternal mortality rates are among the worst in Africa.

·  Poverty increased from 48 to 67 per cent of the population between 1994 and 2006

·  In 2005, up to 53 percent of children under five suffer from stunting due to inadequate food, low-quality diet, poor infant feeding practices, poor household management of childhood diseases and the general decline of the health system.

·  Children are victims of corporal punishment in their families or their schools.

·  During the civil war, numerous children were forced to join rebel groups

Future Plans and Development

The current plans already represent a significantly sized project which will take a number of years to establish. However once the organization is set up and running, we will be working to establishing a boom in Burundi’s exportation industry.

As we learn and develop together, we are excited to bring other people on board to help this cause. Hopefully beginning a short term mission program as well as perusing the exportation industry by taking locale cash crops such as coffee, cotton, and tea from Burundi’s local farmers to exporting their product to the UK and America. By doing this we will have the ability to slowly raise the overall national income, in turn heightening the standard of living and education.
