story:
The KANKA® Grill (KANKA = BBQ in a native language of Southern Patagonia): A revolutionary electric rotating spit grill (and full rotisserie system), designed to take your BBQ into a whole new level...and virtually anywhere!

A whole different grill: Upgrade your cooking experience without the hassle and cost of having multiple tools: Now, ONE TOOL is all you need to complement any BBQ at home or at any outdoor cooking adventure ALL YEAR ROUND.

The future of outdoor cooking and BBQ: With so many places to go and opportunities to enjoy good food with family and friends, why limit yourself by only having a bulky, stationary grill? The KANKA Grill also guarantees perfect and consistent results BBQ after BBQ!

Why to buy it now? First: We are ready to increase our mass production capabilities using the funds raised trough this campaign. Help us translate thousands of hours designing, prototyping and innovating into smiles and deliciously happy moments with friends and family all around the world! Second: SAVE UP TO 60%* compared to future retail price! And third, last but not the least: be one of the lucky few to have it this BBQ season (summer 2017 deliveries guaranteed!) Limited quantities available. Don't miss it!

*Savings depend on country / region.

Motorized Rotation: Spend more time socializing rather than being "stuck at the grill"! The KANKA Grill features a high-torque energy-efficient geared motor that rotates the food at constant speed and heat doing the hard work for you and ensuring perfect BBQ results!

Perfect and consistent results BBQ after BBQ: It’s no secret that slow cooking = better results, juicier meat, and tastier bites! Imagine enjoying this amazing Sriracha & honey ribs, a perfectly grilled Salmon or a delicious stuffed meat at home. Everything is so simple, yet so perfect with The KANKA Grill! 

Power it using a solar rechargeable battery (30+ hours of operation), regular AA batteries (12+ hrs), car/boat 12V plug or regular 110V outlet at home. Designed to carry it anywhere!

An advanced geared motor system that fits in your pocket!

RELAX....and let the KANKA Grill do the job!

Fully demountable + compact + 100% portable. Take it to your fishing, hunting or any outdoor adventure! Carry it like a backpack inside its 30" carrying bag or just leave it in the trunk of your car (it won’t take up much space ;). Suddenly, any place seems to be a perfect spot for a perfect BBQ! Don't let your big, old-fashioned grill limit you...Go out and enjoy!

 

Easy to assemble and use. No need for manuals, tools or bolts! Now, anyone can master this ancient BBQ or outdoor cooking technique. NO experience needed, BEST results guaranteed!
 

Fun and convenient accessories: Why pay a fortune at a Brazilian Steakhouse if you can do it at home with better ingredients and far better results? Well, now you can surprise your family and friends with a gourmet experience in the comfort of your own home.

Extremely versatile: Load it up with ANY of your favorite foods (up to 15 Lbs) and place it over ANY gas grill, charcoal grill, fire pit or open fire flame for that delicious, roasted flavor! 

Tough and Durable: Manufactured in high-quality 304 AISI stainless steel it endures impacts, extreme heat and dirt. This also makes it extremely easy to clean: just wipe it down with a wet cloth or paper towel and it is ready to be put back in its bag. Unless you enjoy brushing your old-fashioned grill, this will make a BIG difference!

Innovation + design: We gave the KANKA grill a modern and sexy look so you will be proud to showcase it! The KANKA Grill is a US PATENTED INVENTION...100% INNOVATION!

THIS IS YOUR OPPORTUNITY TO START THE REVOLUTION OF BBQ! 
HELP US SPREAD THE WORD! (Let's share and tweet! Click below ;)

PRESS LOVED IT!

 
 

Southern Patagonia (Chile)

Where tradition meets innovation: South America is a land of astonishing beauty and a deep-rooted culinary culture with a great passion for food. In the most southern areas like Patagonia, local BBQ experts - The Gauchos - have mastered, over the ages, the technique of slowly roasting food by rotating it over a fire until is perfectly and evenly cooked. The results? Incredibly juicy, soft and tender meat and veggies. But this method hasn't change in centuries...nor have their tools. This inspired us to create a product that could replicate this ancient technique and results in a completely fresh and innovative way, adapted to modern-life needs featuring automated rotation, complete portability, and designed to be so simple to use that it would be accessible to all!

With the KANKA Grill, you’ll never worry again about burning or overcooking your food! You can cook a "traditional" BBQ or innovate preparing a fancy Brazilian style BBQ and those colorful and tasty shish kebabs that everyone loves! All of this without having to attend the grill: Just relax, and let the KANKA Grill do the job! And not just any job. You will get perfect and consistent results BBQ after BBQ...guaranteed!

 

YOU CAN carry it ANYWHERE! 

The prefect complement for your RV...Just imagine that perfect setting!

​

Enjoy while fly fishing, hunting, camping or at any outdoor adventure! 

Road trip ready! (Just imagine carriying your old fashioned grill with you ;) 

Camping or picnic? Instantly earn the respect of anyone within a 1,000-foot radius :)

When at home: Just relax and let the KANKA Grill do the job!

Click below ;)PRESS LOVED IT!   Southern Patagonia (Chile)Where tradition meets innovation: South America is a land of astonishing beauty and a deep-rooted culinary culture with a great passion for food. In the most southern areas like Patagonia, local BBQ experts - The Gauchos - have mastered, over the ages, the technique of slowly roasting food by rotating it over a fire until is perfectly and evenly cooked. The results? Incredibly juicy, soft and tender meat and veggies. But this method hasn't change in centuries...nor have their tools. This inspired us to create a product that could replicate this ancient technique and results in a completely fresh and innovative way, adapted to modern-life needs featuring automated rotation, complete portability, and designed to be so simple to use that it would be accessible to all!With the KANKA Grill, you’ll never worry again about burning or overcooking your food! You can cook a "traditional" BBQ or innovate preparing a fancy Brazilian style BBQ and those colorful and tasty shish kebabs that everyone loves! All of this without having to attend the grill: Just relax, and let the KANKA Grill do the job! And not just any job. You will get perfect and consistent results BBQ after BBQ...guaranteed! YOU CAN carry it ANYWHERE! The prefect complement for your RV...Just imagine that perfect setting!​Enjoy while fly fishing, hunting, camping or at any outdoor adventure! Road trip ready! (Just imagine carriying your old fashioned grill with you ;) Camping or picnic? Instantly earn the respect of anyone within a 1,000-foot radius :)When at home: Just relax and let the KANKA Grill do the job!

story:
In our wedding vows, we  mentioned all the adventures we had had and all the ones to come. By definition, adventure is “an unusual and exciting, typically hazardous, experience or activity and when defined as a verb, it mentions the exploration of unknown territory”. Adventure is one of our favorite things. And now we want to make a show about it.

When we travel, we research our destinations intensely. We buy books, read blogs, and find out everything we can about where to stay, eat, and explore. We learn about the currency (if it's foreign territory), the “must see” attractions, and the tiny off-the-beaten-path spots. We find a lot of our friends and family ask about our travels because we do it so often and we usually have a pretty good time. While in Costa Rica, on our honeymoon, we thought, “Hey, why not make this a show?”


Here's how you can help:


We want to answer the follow questions about every destination we explore:

-Where to stay

-Where to eat

-Where to see


Followed up by these other important factors:

-How to get around

-Currency/Tipping policies/Languages

-The prices of all these bullet points


Equipment needed:

GPS unit (PURCHASED!)

Selfie arm

Monopod (it's a tripod, but only one leg!)

Universal dash phone mount

AC car adaptor

Shotgun microphone, lavalier microphone

Small external hard drive

Extra camera batteries


We want to be able to share our journeys and help encourage people to explore a new place they maybe hadn't thought of or show a cheaper way to travel to a new zone when they found it impossible before. Every place we stay, we will give an in-depth review as well as film the grounds, room, and restaurant if applicable. We will offer options for everything including a cheap, moderate, and expensive option so no matter whom you are; you can find something in your budget. We will make note of important landmarks and their cost and if they are worth it according to our opinion.


We want to create a show that is fun, positive, and helpful to couples, groups of friends, and families who want to travel but are worried they can't afford it or they don't even know where to start. We want a variety for everyone. We want to include places like the Grand Canyon and Mount Rushmore as well as Paris and Montreal.

We need your help to produce this project. We aren't asking much as we rely on ourselves for travel and we save and save to be able to do so. Your donation will help get this project on its feet and get us exploring. It will help provide the minimal equipment we need and perhaps a night's stay or gas money.

After we raise the initial funds, we are moving this bad boy over to Patreon. It's a great program to help raise money for artists creating constant content. As we create an episode, you will be able to donate per episode/season.

The Hayes household has a lot of dreams. To be able to travel and explore this great world is one of them. We have never felt more happy or alive than when we are somewhere spectacular (aside from being on stage). Help us achieve this dream, this adventure, this journey.

story:
Short Summary

Here's your chance to be part of something fresh and fruity! Nicaragua is a natural wonder quietly waiting to be explored and Tropical Fruit Adventures are ready to make it happen. We are LGBTI owned and operated, providing a variety a fully inclusive tours for all tastes with fun, sun and culture served on a gayly basis. We're super excited to be one of Central America's first gay friendly tour operators and can't wait to show of our little piece of paradise to the world!

Check here for some tour details: http://www.tropicalfruitadventures.com/


What We Need & What You Get

We've already established the business and are a fully licensed operator, what we're looking for is a little help in making our operation as professional, competitive and generally awesome as possible in order to provide a truly unforgettable experience. In return we are offering some sweet perks and gifts to show our gratitude.

The $7390 we seek will help us out with the following:

$1000 toward legal and tourism association fees.

$500 toward office supplies (printer, filing system etc).

$500 toward pimping out our webpage.

$1500 toward activity equipment (surf/paddle boards etc).

$150 toward promotional apparel (t-shirts, tank tops, caps).

$3740 toward downpayment on an adventure vehicle

Any and all money raised will go toward making Tropical Fruit Adventures truly awesome!


The Impact

As well as contributing to the upgrading of our business you will be helping a number of community groups in Nicaragua with whom we are affiliated. In addition to us offering a Volunteer Tour where the group will spend a part of each day visiting and assisting at a number of community organizations, each adventure package will have the option of visiting one or more of these organizations as part of their tour.

Risks & Challenges

The major challenge in setting up Tropical Fruit Adventures has been the bureaucratic process. Jumping through all the right hoops and attending numerous government meetings in order to ensure everything is legit has kept us super busy. The next major challenge is ensuring all aspects of the business are running as professionally as possible, and I guess that's where you guys come in!

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way you can help us non-financially is to spread the word and keep a little place in your mind for Nicaragua!

story:
Short Summary

Your help will bring this new technology to connect many undiscovered small businesses that have the best matching flavors, drinks and live entertainment.

 

 

​

 

What We Need & What You Get

In more detail:

  • We need 50K for our bot to bring you our first high traffic region this quarter: The Mayan Riviera. This area has the best getaway options, shows and weekend activities like paradise island visits, exploring the reef etc as early as this summer.  
  • Be the first to be awarded the special treats from the best beaches in the continent.
  • Your help will get us funded for this important milestone which is already in flight.

Track Record 

 

 

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make:

  • After this initial milestone, we will support so many small businesses and events that will be at your fingertips. Our Chatbot will connect you to your closest friends to share activities.
  • We brought about the best events content to more that 30K users last quarter.
  • Join us and experience never missing out on timely events around you.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our day in the life..

  •  Special events are a strong market and we know this is the time to bring AI to you. 
  • Our plan includes partnerships with the local chamber of commerce and participation of these amazing venues and places, just for you. We will target special events like concerts and other fun activities.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We thank you for contributing but if you cannot here is how you can help:

  • Pass the word to your friends by sharing this campaign on your social network.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Also, don't miss out trying our current demo: https://www.messenger.com/t/mypepperbot

And that's all there is to it.

Join Us

Our team has been at Google, University of Michigan and UCSC. Now, we promote innovation for those in need. This time we want to bring you the first personal assistant to find places to go out.

It is important for us to connect you with the fun. We connect you with every small restaurant, bar and event venue that is happening around you at the right time.

story:
Hello Everyone! 

For those of you who do not know me personally my name is Alyssa Kobza. Thank you for taking time out of your day to visit my funding website. For most of my life I have had an incredibly strong urge to travel. This summer I have an amazing opportunity to travel to Thailand for one month with a group of like-minded students and young adults.

I will be in Thailand for four weeks and as you might imagine each day is going to be packed with adventure. At the bottom I have outlined in detail what each week will have in store, but I will also give you a short run-down. The first two weeks I will be staying in a remote village where I will be teaching English to school aged children. The third week I will be touring Thailand, getting to know Thai culture, and going on adventures. The fourth week I will staying near the beach and working on sea turtle rehabilitation and conservation. 

What I Need & What You Get

I have been saving money for this trip for about a year in a half by working as a lifeguard, swim lesson instructor and swim team coach. In that time I was able to save about $4500 out of the total of $6120 for tuition. My goal is to raise $1800 which will cover the rest of my tuition. 

In exchange for you generosity I am offering some really cool perks. Most of you know that I have always been an artsy person. I am transferring to University of Nebraska Lincoln in the fall to get a Bachelor degree in art with the hopes of becoming an art teacher. With the skills I have learned so far I will create for you some really amazing perks which includes:

  • Shoutout on Facebook
  • Mailed postcard from Thailand
  • Postcard with Watercolor
  • T-shirt from Thailand
  • Handmade Elephant/Turtle Keychain
  • 6" x 8" Print from Photo taken in Thailand
  • Handmade Canvas Bound Journal
  • 12" x 10" Print from Photograph
  • Elephant Paintings
  • Handmade Ceramic Elephant
  • Custom Paintings
  • AND MORE!!

Each of these items are listed on the left of the website. I will be posting pictures of each of these perks on Facebook and to this website, so continue to check back from time-to-time. For more information please click on the link at the left of the webpage or send me an email at alyssakayart@gmail.com. Also like my facebook art page where I will post photos of the available perks! https://www.facebook.com/AlyssaKayArtOfficalPage/?ref=bookmarks

I have selected flexible funding for this fundraiser. What that means is if I don't raise the entire $1800 by the end date, I will still keep the donations and you will still receive your perks.

The Impact

You are doing so much more than just receiving perks by donating to this trip. You are providing young kids with little means a chance to have a better education. You are supporting wildlife and environmental conservation. You are supporting culture education and allowing yourself to learn more about things that are unfamiliar to you. You are supporting a young adult who want to make a difference in the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I fully understand if you are unable to contribute. But what I do ask of you before you leave this page is to spread the word. Share this page on whatever social media you prefer and write a cute and catchy saying to promote it. I thank you so much!!!

Detailed Itinerary:

Weeks 1 & 2

I will spend two weeks teaching English to school-aged kids and earn my TEFL certification. A TEFL certification will qualify me to teach english as a foreign language. These two weeks will be spent in the hill-tribe villages of either Ban Lao or Maekon. The day time will be spent teaching English to school kids and studying and practicing how to teach English. Teaching will be done in pairs or one on one and feedback is given from classmates and instructors on ways to improve. During the afternoons there is time to study Thai, teach extracurricular classes such as art and sports, and care for gardens and animals in the community. Whatever is going on in the community is what we will be taking part in.

On the weekends we will tour Chiang Mai. Here we will have the amazing opportunity to trek to hidden temples, bathe with elephants at ‘Elephant Nature Park,’ swim under waterfalls, zip-line through the rainforest canopy and take in everything the ancient city has to offer.

Even after returning to the US I will still be provided benefits from this trip; Loop Abroad offers assistance to Alumni after graduating college in finding a job in the field. Loop Abroad will help my write my resume, cover letter, and prep me for interviews. They even connect me with English learning centers from around the world and set up interviews along with providing a recommendation. The benefits of this trip will last me a lifetime and create an infinite amount of possibilities in the future.

Week 3 & 4

I will spend the third week of the program based in Chiang Mai, Thailand. Known as the "Rose of the North", this mountain city is the perfect base from which to explore rain forests, mountains, cloud forests, and the beautiful culture of Thailand. In Doi Inthanon National Park we will see ancient temples that rise above the clouds line and waterfalls that seem to be at the top of the world. This week we will volunteer with the university on a reforestation project and spend time rafting a jungle river. The group will spend a day ziplining through the rainforest and learn how zipline projects contribute to conservation efforts.  We will take an amazing overnight trek into the jungle, including a visit to a hilltribe village and an overnight at a hot springs. We will wander through a mountain templed into the Chiang Dao caves and explore its depths by lantern light. This week is dedicated to experiencing everything Thailand has to offer. We will experience the culture more vividly during cultural activities such as a meditation lesson with Buddhist monks, shopping in the city craft and food markets, visiting an arts village, making paper and touring 700 year old temples.

In week 4, we fly and ferry to the island of Koh Tao ("Turtle Island") in the Gulf of Thailand. With the little sandy bay just steps from our rooms, we will fill our days with morning beachside yoga, supporting the sea turtle nursery, snorkeling to track marine life, building an artificial reef, and learning from the experts at New Heaven about marine animals and conservation. The last day of this week will be spent at Elephant Nature Park where I will have one more amazing experience with elephants before headed back to the United States.

If you are interested in traveling with me contact me at alyssakayart@gmail.com

Purple Elephant Painting- $350
story_txt:
Hello Everyone! 
For those of you who do not know me personally my name is Alyssa Kobza. Thank you for taking time out of your day to visit my funding website. For most of my life I have had an incredibly strong urge to travel. This summer I have an amazing opportunity to travel to Thailand for one month with a group of like-minded students and young adults.
I will be in Thailand for four weeks and as you might imagine each day is going to be packed with adventure. At the bottom I have outlined in detail what each week will have in store, but I will also give you a short run-down. The first two weeks I will be staying in a remote village where I will be teaching English to school aged children. The third week I will be touring Thailand, getting to know Thai culture, and going on adventures. The fourth week I will staying near the beach and working on sea turtle rehabilitation and conservation. 

What I Need & What You Get
I have been saving money for this trip for about a year in a half by working as a lifeguard, swim lesson instructor and swim team coach. In that time I was able to save about $4500 out of the total of $6120 for tuition. My goal is to raise $1800 which will cover the rest of my tuition. 
In exchange for you generosity I am offering some really cool perks. Most of you know that I have always been an artsy person. I am transferring to University of Nebraska Lincoln in the fall to get a Bachelor degree in art with the hopes of becoming an art teacher. With the skills I have learned so far I will create for you some really amazing perks which includes:

Shoutout on Facebook
Mailed postcard from Thailand
Postcard with Watercolor
T-shirt from Thailand
Handmade Elephant/Turtle Keychain
6" x 8" Print from Photo taken in Thailand
Handmade Canvas Bound Journal
12" x 10" Print from Photograph
Elephant Paintings
Handmade Ceramic Elephant
Custom Paintings
AND MORE!!

Each of these items are listed on the left of the website. I will be posting pictures of each of these perks on Facebook and to this website, so continue to check back from time-to-time. For more information please click on the link at the left of the webpage or send me an email at alyssakayart@gmail.com. Also like my facebook art page where I will post photos of the available perks! https://www.facebook.com/AlyssaKayArtOfficalPage/?ref=bookmarks
I have selected flexible funding for this fundraiser. What that means is if I don't raise the entire $1800 by the end date, I will still keep the donations and you will still receive your perks.

The Impact
You are doing so much more than just receiving perks by donating to this trip. You are providing young kids with little means a chance to have a better education. You are supporting wildlife and environmental conservation. You are supporting culture education and allowing yourself to learn more about things that are unfamiliar to you. You are supporting a young adult who want to make a difference in the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help
I fully understand if you are unable to contribute. But what I do ask of you before you leave this page is to spread the word. Share this page on whatever social media you prefer and write a cute and catchy saying to promote it. I thank you so much!!!
Detailed Itinerary:
Weeks 1 & 2
I will spend two weeks teaching English to school-aged kids and earn my TEFL certification. A TEFL certification will qualify me to teach english as a foreign language. These two weeks will be spent in the hill-tribe villages of either Ban Lao or Maekon. The day time will be spent teaching English to school kids and studying and practicing how to teach English. Teaching will be done in pairs or one on one and feedback is given from classmates and instructors on ways to improve. During the afternoons there is time to study Thai, teach extracurricular classes such as art and sports, and care for gardens and animals in the community. Whatever is going on in the community is what we will be taking part in.
On the weekends we will tour Chiang Mai. Here we will have the amazing opportunity to trek to hidden temples, bathe with elephants at ‘Elephant Nature Park,’ swim under waterfalls, zip-line through the rainforest canopy and take in everything the ancient city has to offer.
Even after returning to the US I will still be provided benefits from this trip; Loop Abroad offers assistance to Alumni after graduating college in finding a job in the field. Loop Abroad will help my write my resume, cover letter, and prep me for interviews. They even connect me with English learning centers from around the world and set up interviews along with providing a recommendation. The benefits of this trip will last me a lifetime and create an infinite amount of possibilities in the future.
Week 3 & 4
I will spend the third week of the program based in Chiang Mai, Thailand. Known as the "Rose of the North", this mountain city is the perfect base from which to explore rain forests, mountains, cloud forests, and the beautiful culture of Thailand. In Doi Inthanon National Park we will see ancient temples that rise above the clouds line and waterfalls that seem to be at the top of the world. This week we will volunteer with the university on a reforestation project and spend time rafting a jungle river. The group will spend a day ziplining through the rainforest and learn how zipline projects contribute to conservation efforts.  We will take an amazing overnight trek into the jungle, including a visit to a hilltribe village and an overnight at a hot springs. We will wander through a mountain templed into the Chiang Dao caves and explore its depths by lantern light. This week is dedicated to experiencing everything Thailand has to offer. We will experience the culture more vividly during cultural activities such as a meditation lesson with Buddhist monks, shopping in the city craft and food markets, visiting an arts village, making paper and touring 700 year old temples.
In week 4, we fly and ferry to the island of Koh Tao ("Turtle Island") in the Gulf of Thailand. With the little sandy bay just steps from our rooms, we will fill our days with morning beachside yoga, supporting the sea turtle nursery, snorkeling to track marine life, building an artificial reef, and learning from the experts at New Heaven about marine animals and conservation. The last day of this week will be spent at Elephant Nature Park where I will have one more amazing experience with elephants before headed back to the United States.
If you are interested in traveling with me contact me at alyssakayart@gmail.com
